loans.name: Amil

texts.en: Amil I., 23, operates a wholesale food store in the Imishli central bazaar. He has six years of experience in this field. As the oldest son in his family, Amil tries very hard to cover all of his family's needs. To improve his life he needs to increase the inventory of foodstuffs that he sells, so for this purpose he is requesting a loan of $1000.  Amil thanks you for your interest and support.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mrs Chhuon Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Four people in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province make up this group and Mrs Chhuon C. is the group leader. She is a security guard in a company. Her husband, Mr Or Ti, is a wedding chef in the local village. Since their workplace is too far from home and they typically spend a lot of money on their transportation, Mrs Chhuon C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for going to work. She hopes to reduce her family's expenses with this loan.

Mrs Chhuon C. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a tailor while the others are attending school.

Mrs Chhuon C. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for going to work.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Cliente con mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de molinos, tiene 20 años en este negocio, cuando adim le entrego su primer crédito, lo invirtió en la compra de  canela, clavo de olor, pimientas etc., esto con el objetivo de aperturar otro negocio dentro del mismo, ya que estos productos los oferta a sus mismos cliente que llegan a solicitar el servicio de molino, este servicio cuenta con mucha demanda ya que en la comunidad es el único, tiene su casa propia y vive con su hijo menor, a pesar de que sus hijos mayores trabajan y tienen negocios propios a ella no le gusta que le estén dando y se empeña en manejar bien su negocio, ya que siente que ha crecido como persona, como empresaria y como mujer.
texts.en:
This is a client with a lot of experience with respect to the business of mills. She has been in this business for 20 years. When ADIM gave Maria her first loan, she invested it into the purchase of cinnamon, cloves, peppers, etc. She did this with the goal of opening another business within the one she already had, since she offers these products to the same clients who come for the service of the mill. This service has a lot of demand because it is the only mill in the community. She has her own home and lives with her younger son. Even though her older children work and have their own businesses, she doesn’t like when they give her anything, and she strives to manage her business well, because she feels that she has grown as a person, as a businesswoman, and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en:
Qabil S. is 41 years old and married with three sons.  Qabil is a hard-working man who is running a cattle breeding business.  He started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment.  He is also working as a teacher in the local school, but the salary is too small even to cover the monthly basic needs of his family. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 16 years ago. 

Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business.  Therefore, Qabil is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase four additional cattle to sell.  More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing.  

He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mr. Samnang L. is a farmer who lives in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He owns a plot of land where he cultivates vegetables to earn a living. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy corn seeds so he is requesting a loan $500 USD. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's standard of living. His wife, Mrs. Yoeurn Samet, is a rice-soup seller. Mr. Samnang L. is 30 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend the local school but the other two are too young (ages 2 and 4).

loans.use: To buy corn seeds

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng N., a 35-year-old man, lives in the village of Trapaing Thmor in Kampong Cham province. His wife, Mrs. Bin Soeun (pictured on the right of the photograph), is a pig-breeder by trade. They have four children: two children are currently enrolled in the local school, while the others are too young to work or study.

He is a rice middleman: in other words, he purchases rice and later resells the rice at higher prices in order to generate profits. Because his business has been doing rather well, he wants to expand it; thus, he decided to request a loan in order to buy more rice to resell. With the loan proceeds, he is hopeful that he can generate an increase in his income to thereby provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional rice for resale purposes

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao H., 59, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year, in the dry season and the rainy season--a skill she learned from her grandparents. She is married to Him Hoeun, 64, who is a domestic marble carver. He normally collects marble from the mountains to make statues, carving and selling them out of his house.

His business is going very well with a lot of customers recognizing the quality of his statues. The couple has four children; three of them are single and one is married. Two of H.'s daughters are employed as garment workers. Since statue-carving is their main source of income, H. and Hoeun are applying for a loan as capital to purchase a carving machine to use to carve the marble blocks.

loans.use: to purchase a carving machine to use to carve the marble blocks

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, convive hace 4 años, con su compañera y madre de su hija de 1 año y 8 meses, actualmente viven en la casa de sus suegros. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a diferentes actividades, pero no conseguía un trabajo formal; pero desde el año 2002 puso en un kiosco su propio taller de electrónica llamado “G.”, ubicándolo en un lugar estratégico, ya que ahí circula toda la gente; se dedica a reparar radios y televisores usados, lo cual es su pasión y está muy contento de realizarlo, pero también compra artefactos electrónicos usados a los cuales le repone todas las piezas faltantes, revendiéndolos a un precio considerable. Carlos comenta que cuando no es tiempo de la cosecha de café, la gente no tiene ganancias y por lo tanto no solicita mucho su trabajo, pero en tiempo de cosecha (Abril), sus ganancias mejoran ganando de 400 a 500 soles por semana, sin contar las posibles ganancias por las ventas de los televisores y radios usadas. Su esposa vende ropa, y él quiere apoyarla con parte del dinero que solicita, y de ese modo alentar el crecimiento de sus negocios. Carlos tiene un buen sentido del humor, y es muy apasionado en su trabajo, se integró a su banco comunal para tener posibilidades de desarrollo, asimismo se compromete en efectuar el pago en las fechas señaladas y horas exactas, este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará radios y televisores usados, y con la otra parte apoyará a su esposa con capital para la compra de prendas y así aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old. He has been living common-law with his partner for four years; they have a daughter aged 1 year and 8 month. They are currently living with his in-laws. He has had many jobs since he was a young man, but never had formal employment. Since 2002 however he has had a kiosk, his own electronics shop called "G.", strategically located where there are many passers-by. He repairs radios and television sets; this is his passion and he is very happy doing this job. He also buys used electronics which he repairs, replacing missing parts and reselling them for a good profit. Carlos says that when it is not time to harvest the coffee beans, people do not have money and then do not need his services; but, when harvest time comes in April, his income improves to 400 to 500 soles per week not including the income from selling used televisions and radios. His wife sells clothing and he wants to help her with part of the loan which he is requesting and so encourage the growth of his businesses. Carlos has a good sense of humour and is very passionate about his work. He joined his community bank in order to explore development possibilities. He is committed to repaying his loan on time. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use part of the loan to buy used radios and televisions and the rest of the loan to help his wife to buy clothing and so increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used radios and televisions.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 41-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Youssef has been working as a taxi driver since 2000. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Youssef has requested a loan.

Youssef is special because his car is clean and he is punctual. His clients are family members, friends, neighbors and other passengers. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Youssef decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and likes the contact with the clients. In the future, he plans on purchasing a new car.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en:
Kojo S. is a single parent with 2 children; he has received schooling through the primary level. Since 2008, Kojo has sold groceries such as milk, "Milo" (cocoa powder), canned products, rice and cosmetics at Abrobiano near Elmina.

Kojo uses his income to provide food, clothing, and other basic needs for the family. Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of groceries to help meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of his business.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase the sale of groceries

loans.name: Rachetés Plus Group

texts.fr: Elisa N. vend des vivres frais et des épices. Elle a commencé son affaire en 2000 après le divorce avec son mari. Son capital initial était de $25 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter un carton des poissons à revendre. Après un dur travail, elle est parvenue à accroitre son capital à $100 en 2005. L’affaire d’Elisa a connu des difficultés de 2005 à 2007 suite aux coupures intempestives d’électricité dans son quartier qui causait la pourriture des poissons. Son affaire a reprit l’élan normal en 2008 depuis la stabilisation du courant électrique. Dans le souci de renforcer son affaire de façon permanente et d’accroitre son revenu,  Elisa a rejoint un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC dénommé « Rachetés » en décembre 2008. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu lui a permit d’acheter un carton des poissons frais, des arachides et épices à revendre en vue d’augmenter le bénéfice. Actuellement,  son affaire génère un bénéfice de $20 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison de chambre froide pour revendre des vivres frais. Elisa est agée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants agés de 16 à 30 ans dont les deux derniers vivent encore avec elle. Elisa est contente des crédits reçus de Hope parce qu’ils l’aident à développer son activité et lui donner l’espoir.
texts.en:
Elisa N. sells fresh staple foods and spices. She started her business in 2000 after her divorce. Her initial capital was $25, which had enabled her to buy a box of fish to resell. After working hard, she was able to grow her capital to $100 in 2005. Her business experienced some difficulty in 2005-2007 following untimely electrical outages in her district that caused the fish to spoil. Her business regained its normal momentum in 2008 since electrical power was stabilized.

Wanting to bolster her business continually and to grow her revenues, Elisa joined one of the groups of the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC named “Rachetés” in December 2008. The loan she obtained enabled her to buy a box of fresh fish, some peanuts, and spices to resell with the goal of augmenting her profits. Currently, her business generates a profit of $20 per week. Her ambition is to open a house with a cold room for reselling fresh staple items.

Elisa is 50 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children, ages 16 to 30. The last two of them live with her. She is happy with the loans received from HOPE because they help her to develop her business and give her hope.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of fresh fish, peanuts, and spices to resell

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Cecelia A. is engaged in selling fish to the community.  She is married with two children, both in school.  She is an active member of Paglaum MPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to have additional capital for selling fish.  Her husband helps her dry fish to sell for added income. Cecelia hopes that she can give her children a brighter future by letting them complete a good education.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac tiene 28 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al pintado de carros, se inició trabajando de manera dependiente en otro taller, y ahora tiene su propio negocio, con éxito, pues trabaja con mucho esmero. Ocupa todo el tiempo que sea necesario para cumplir puntualmente lo encomendado, y su labor es bien remunerada, esto lo anima a seguir dedicándose a esta actividad porque le permite sostener sus necesidades diarias, además de tener ahorros. Para más adelante, Isaac quiere ofrecer el servicio de reparación de autos, por ello se está preparando estudiando este oficio. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, fue invitado por un amigo a ser parte de su banco comunal, le mostró la forma de trabajar del grupo para crecer en forma solidaria, por lo que Isaac tiene la intención de integrarse a ese ritmo, con mucha responsabilidad de en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de diversos colores de pintura y lijas especiales para la carrocería, ya que tiene varios trabajos pendientes que tiene que cumplir puntualmente.
texts.en:
Isaac, 28, lives alone in a rented house. For 4 years, he's operated a business repainting cars, work that he began doing as an employee of another garage. He now has his own business which is successful because he works with great care. He keeps working for however long he has to so that he can complete the jobs he's charged with on time. He is well paid for his labor, something that encourages him to keep the business going because it allows him to pay for his everyday needs and also save. In the future, Isaac wants to offer auto-repair services and he's preparing to learn how to do it. This is Isaac's first MFP loan. A friend invited him to become a member of his community bank and showed him how the group can help businesses grow. Isaac intends to fall into the rhythm of the group and be responsible about repaying his loan. The money that he's applying for will be use to buy paints of different colors and special polishes for vehicles, supplies that he urgently needs to fill various pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for auto-paint business.

loans.name: Felicisim

texts.en: Felicisim A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Felicisim owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Felicisim joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Felicisim is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This will be her 18th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair greenhouses and purchase seeds.

loans.name: 07 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (95) runs a general store selling food and daily use products in her community. Hoan is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. She is widowed and has four adult children. Hoan has been in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoan plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Hoan is the leader of a five member group receiving a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 07 Nam Ngạn (17.07.07).

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Lê Thị Chờ (87) is a 63-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. N. Thị Xuân (99) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Đỗ Thị Bách (97) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 4. N. Thị Hùng (98) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hoan N. Thị (95) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07 Nam Ngạn (17.07.07).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Chờ (87) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. N. Thị Xuân (99) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Đỗ Thị Bách (97) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 4. N. Thị Hùng (98) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. is from the village of Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-four years old. Josephine is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a service-based business, providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $65 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined one of Kiva's field partners, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Now Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This is her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita D. is from the village of Tampagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 42 years old. Nita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She runs a sari-sari store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. Nita has been engaged in her business for more than a year now and has been able to earn approximately 1,500 PHP per month.

In 2009, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for sale. This will be Nita's first loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of various products for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Soloiluma

texts.en:
Soloiluma L. is a 74-year-old woman living in the town of Vavau B. She is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Soloiluma raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Soloiluma has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Soloiluma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soloiluma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers like manure. Soloiluma is now requesting a new loan of 3000 WST, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers like manure. The loan will be the sixth taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Soloiluma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers like manure

loans.name: Malita

texts.fr: Cette femme est spécialisée dans la vente d’une bouillie très appréciée de la population dénommée « akassa » ; c’est une bouillie faite avec de la farine de maïs fermentée. Elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce en 1995 parce que les revenus financiers de son mari électricien ferrailleur, n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer. Le couple a 03 enfants, c’est pourquoi cette dame veut compléter les revenus de son mari pour assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Elle vend sa bouillie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé et dispose de beaucoup de clients. Les gens apprécient  sa bouillie et le bon accueil qu’elle a toujours eu à les réserver. Actuellement elle a besoin de disposer des stocks en provision ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 01 sac de riz et du bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is specialized in selling a much appreciated porridge called akassa, which is made from fermented cornmeal. She started her business in 1995 because her husband’s income from being a scrap metal merchant and electrician was no longer managing to cover all household expenses. The couple has three children. This is why this lady wants to round out her husband’s income, so as to ensure that their children are educated. She sells her porridge in the Agoè district in Lomé and has many customers. People appreciate her porridge and the nice welcome she always reserves for them. Currently, she needs supplies. For this reason, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 5 sacks of corn, 1 sack of rice, and some firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia C. is from the city of Bañaderos Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Cecelia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cecelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cecelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more DVDs for her shop

loans.name: Wisdom

texts.en: Wisdom is 24 years old, and is single with no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Wisdom is a trader in motor spare parts. He buys the spare parts from nearby towns and sells them in a store by the roadside in his community. Wisdom has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure all kinds of spare parts to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy motor spare parts

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Sobresalientes II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 45 años y 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de arroz y azúcar al por menor, ya que de esta manera aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, lleva 05 años en el negocio y desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y haciéndose conocida. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa  a comprar, o es ella misma quien juntamente con su esposo, se trasladan por diferentes calles, a repartir y ofrecer sus productos y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en kilos; parte del dinero también lo invertirá en repuestos y combustible, para su motokar, herramienta principal, para repartir sus productos.

Mirtha, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirtha is a member of the Banco Comunal “Mujeres Sobresalientes II” in the Morales District in the Province of San Martin – Dept. of San Martin. She is married and is 45-years old with two children. They depend on her and are currently studying. Her character and her desire to carry out her dreams, motivates her to undertake a business of selling rice and sugar at retail. It is because of this work ethic that she has seen great profits. She has been at this business for 5 years and right from the start she has gained a lot of clients and has become very well known. She has daily clients who come by her house to make purchases and works with her husband on the same business. They transport products along different streets, offering their goods to clients with attentiveness, kindness and charisma. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 she will buy rice and sugar by the kilo and with a portion of the loan they will also invest in spare parts, gas tanks, tools to distribute her goods. Mirtha has a great desire to continue working and is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women develop in the environment where they conduct business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar by the kilo.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La familia de Reina está compuesta por 4 personas, Reina tiene 42 años, su hija 16 años, dos varones un 12 y 4 años actualmente vive sola. La vivienda que tiene actualmente es de un cuarto con obra bruta, cuenta con servicios básicos. Reina se dedica a la preparación y elaboración de pan, también vende refrigerios ya que su domicilio se encuentra muy cerca del colegio modelo de la localidad. Reina es la única clienta que se dedica a la elaboración de pan y la competencia es muy baja, por lo mismo tiene mucha demanda ya que todo lo que produce termina de vendarla. El destino del crédito es para la construcción de vivienda, actualmente está construyendo un cuarto más y cuenta con el material necesario como se puede apreciar en la fotografía de Reina. Reina es clienta antigua en nuestra institución con dos operaciones canceladas anteriormente de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Reina's family consists of 4 people. Reina is 42 years old, her daughter is 16, and the two boys are 12 and 4. She is currently single. Her home is a crudely-built room with basic amenities. Reina prepares and bakes bread. She also sells snacks because she lives close to the local design school. Reina is the only client that makes bread and she doesn't have much competition. At the same time, the demand is high and she sells everything she produces. The loan will be used for construction on her home; she is building an additional room and has all the materials necessary, as shown in the photograph. Reina is one our institution's oldest clients, with two previous loans that were repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Meylin Eliette

texts.en:
Meylin is married and has three children between the ages of 14 and 19; they are all in school.

Her business is the sale of small food items like eggs, crackers, bread and ice cream. Meylin sells these items on foot. She started this business as a way to supplement her family's income when her husband wasn’t able to support the family with what he makes. Meylin says that her loans with Fundación León 2000 have helped her to improve her family's income and improve their household.

Meylin will use this loan to buy items like eggs and bread for resale. Meylin says that the challenge of her business is the difficulty of the quantity of eggs that she sells because she has to carry so many and the eggs will break if she cannot maintain her balance. Meylin dreams of being able to have her own motorcycle as it will help both her and her husband with their work.

loans.use: To buy items like eggs and bread for resale

loans.name: Las 3 Barbie Group

texts.es:
El grupo las 3 Barbie está integrado por tres mujeres caritativas  que a pesar de sus precarias condiciones económicas ayudan en las obras caritativas de la iglesia. Ellas dicen que no pueden dar ayuda económica como las instituciones  pero con su gran voluntad trabajan gratuitamente para llevarles un bocado de comida a los más necesitados.

Ellas son Darling C. Gonzáles quien vende ropa y cosméticos, Miriam del Carmen P. M. tiene una pulpería y comercializa ropa y zapatos y Ana María P. vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The 3 Barbie group is made up of three charitable women who, despite their precarious economic situations, help in the charitable works of the church. They say that they cannot give economic help like the institutions, but with their strong will they work voluntarily to give food to those people in most need of help. The first of the women is Darling C. Gonzáles who sells clothing and cosmetics, the second is Miriam dl Carmen P. M. who has a grocery store and sells clothing and shoes, and the third is Ana María P. who sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Milton Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Milton M. comenzó a atender su negocio de venta de granos básicos en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua donde ha ofertado diversidad de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, entre otros. También vende papel higiénico y jabones.

Actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los granos básicos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita dicha compra para ofertarlos en su localidad y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The young Milton M. started his business selling basic foodstuffs in the Mayoreo market in Managua offering a diverse range of nonperishable including rice, beans, sugar, and corn among others. He also sells toilet paper and soaps.

Now he feels the need to invest in buying more basic foodstuffs and has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan which would allow him to allow him to purchase wholesale to offer better prices to his area and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying grocery products for resale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 26 year old married mother of one. She owns a hardware shop selling plumbing and building materials in Nairobi. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy building and plumbing materials. She hopes to expand her business and open other shops. She describes herself as flexible.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a hard working and friendly woman. She is a widow with 5 children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her, but she is coping well. She sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients at retail prices to her customers. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 27 years old and married with one child. He sells clothes on a busy highway. He sells a variety of clothes such as men and womens' clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. He has grown his business into a higher level and attributes his success to his strong marketing and communication skills. He is also employed as a driver, and with his earnings he is able to support his family. He dreams of growing his business into a wholesale operation and wants to improve his living standards in the future.  He has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: El señor Leonel de edad de 44 años, es padre de familia de tres hijos que junto con su esposa procrearon, los tres estudian, junto a su esposa trabajan en un negocio familiar, un comedor en el cual es el encargado de la caja chica como de hacer las compras para preparar los ricos platillos del comedor. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ahorro ha logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto, pero a un le falta embaldosar el piso que es de suelo, para una mejor higiene,  repellar las paredes, pintar. Con el préstamo lo que hará es embaldosar toda la casa para luego solo ponerle la cerámica. Para esto comprara: tierra para compactar, arena, cemento, piedrin. Ir poco a poco terminando lo de más. Con su crédito anterior logro hacer el muro en  la parte de atrás el cual esta contento por los beneficios que a través de estos financiamiento esta obteniendo.
texts.en:
Leone is a 44 year old family man. He and his wife have three children. All three of them go to school. He and his wife work together in a family business. It is a dining room. He is in charge of the small funds like making purchases in order to prepare the delicious dishes of their dining room. Thanks to their saving efforts, he has been able to build his house all of concrete. But, he still needs to tile one floor, which is a dirt floor. He needs to do this for better hygiene. He needs to plaster the walls and paint. With this loan he will tile the whole house, and later he will put in the ceramics. To do this he will buy land to compact, sand, cement, and gravel. He will finish the rest little by little. With his previous loan he built a wall in back of his house. He is pleased with the benefits he has gotten through the loans he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dirt to compact, sand, cement, and gravel to tile the floor in the house for better hygiene

loans.name: Pari

texts.en: Pari T. is a 47 year old woman who breeds cattle in Bilasuvar city. She is an internally displaced person. She fled to Bilasuva. The only way to earn any money was cattle breeding. Peri has more that 20 years experience in this field. She enjoys her calves and working all day long looking after them. Pari is single and lives with her parents, helping them. Pari has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell for a profitable price, several months from now.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda Espinas Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda T E. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old and single. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Rosalinda raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela E., 51 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Estela owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises some chickens. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 22 years now. In 2009, Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Estela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Estela from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Proyecto Group

texts.es:
El grupo Proyecto está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Alexandra Vulizo L. P. quien inicio hace cuatro años vendiendo enchiladas y tajadas con queso negocio que con el trabajo arduo ha ido creciendo. En la actualidad comercializa carne asada, pollo, cerdo etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Auxiliadora L. Gonzales  quien tiene una pulpería la que abrió hace 9 años con la venta de chiverías y ahora distribuye gran variedad de productos y Margina Elizabeth Monje Rodríguez desde hace 10 años se dedica al destace de cerdo de donde produce chicharrón, frito, moronga, nacatamales etc.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto” (Project) Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Alexandra Vulizo L. P., who started a business four years ago selling enchiladas and plantains with cheese. Through her hard work, her business has been increasing. Alexandra currently sells roasted beef, chicken, pork, and other foods.

Her fellow group members include María Auxiliadora L. Gonzales who has a grocery store she opened nine years ago where she sells yogurt products. She now distributes a large variety of products. Margina Elizabeth Monje Rodríguez has been butchering pigs for ten years in order to produce chicharrón, fried pork, blood sausage, nacatamales, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain, meat, oil, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Maritza Edinora

texts.es:
Maritza Edinora G. C., tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 14 años. Reside en Juticalpa en la Colonia Mazarela y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Brisas de Mazarela. Hace ocho años vendia ropa interior de forma ambulante pero desde hace dos años tiene un negocio de reparacion y venta de repuestos de computadora junto con su esposo. Cambio de negocio para darle una mejor atencion a su familia y ahora trabaja desde su domicilio y por telefono. 

Martiza invertira el prestamo para la construccion de un muro. Comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, varillas de hierro, ladrillos, bloques, ceramica. Tambien pagara la mano de obra. 

Con la construccion del muro el ambiente de su negocio sera mejor y su familia estara mas segura. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Desde que es cliente de FAMA se siente mas util porque con su negocio puede ayudar con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maritza Edinora G. C., age 40, has two children ages 18 and 14. She lives in the Colonia Mazarela in Juticalpa, and she is a member of the Brisas de Mazarela Solidarity Group. Eight years ago, she used to sell undergarments as a street vendor, but for the last two years, she has run her own computer repair and parts business with her husband. She changed businesses in order to better attend to her family, and she now works from home and over the telephone.

Maritza will invest this loan in building a wall. She will purchase the following construction materials: cement, iron rods, bricks, cinder blocks and tile. She will also pay for labor.

With the construction of this wall, the atmosphere of her business will improve, and her family will be safer. Her goal is to one day own a store, and she hopes that her children will become professionals. Ever since she has been a member of FAMA, she has felt more useful because she can help out with the family expenses through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Tabo-o,Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Chona is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to add capital to her business. Chona is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Katampe Maraswa

texts.en:
Katampe has practiced livestock farming for eight years. He is 27 years old and married to Saitet N.. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and has no history with any other MFI (microfinance institution). This will be his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the cash to buy more calves, which he will rear and sell at a profit later, after they grow.

Katampe also plans to open a butchery in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more calves, which he will sell later

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en:
Madelina P. is 31 years old and married with a husband who is a manager. She has one child who does not go to school.

Madelina is currently in the business of selling fruit such as jackfruit, pineapples, oranges, passion fruit, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more fruit such as pears and mangoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up an ice cream and juice shop.

loans.use: To stock more fruit such as pears and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de su esposo junto a su menor hijo Bryan de 13 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El cultivo de zanahoria y gladiolo es la actividad que realiza diariamente Delia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Espera en adelante tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives together with her husband and their youngest son Bryan, 13 years old. They are the reason for all of her efforts. She harvests carrots and gladiola flowers. This is Delia's daily work. With a great deal of effort she has managed to make her fields to be very productive, generating excellent quality harvests and very sought out by the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her favorite part of her work is caring of the plantations. She has had 15 years in the field. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport her products all the way to the city of Tarma. The sacks are very heavy. IN the future she hopes to have a stand in the wholesale market to improve her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she will endeavor to be on time with her payments, not wanting to cause any troubles with her community bank, where she feels very content. With the thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests, she will purchase pea seeds. This product is selling very well these months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Depend On God Group

texts.en:
Fatu F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Depend On God. She is 48 years old, widowed and has five children whose ages are between 10 and 22 years. She was only able to attend school through twelfth grade due to a lack of financial support.

For 20 years, Fatu has been selling socks and earrings in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 16,250 LRD portion of this 81,250 LRD group loan to buy more socks and earrings. She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue her education.

loans.use: To buy more socks and earrings

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

La señora Olga esta en su segundo ciclo en  el Banco, está muy contenta y a gusto por la ayuda que ha recibido y por las facilidades que brinda la institución. Tiene 55 años de edad, separada hace 10 años, de esta relación tuvo 7 hijos dos de los cuales viven con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de mariscos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, vende los pescados por piezas o por libras, muchas veces también compra camarones para vender por libras, lo que mas vende es el pescado albacora por libras y el bonito blanco por piezas, ella desde muy de mañana se va al mercado para comprar el mejor pescado a los comerciantes que traen de Manta. Trabaja hasta las 18h30  todos los días,  compra siempre lo necesario para vender en el día ya que cuesta dejarlo hasta el otro día en congeladores.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar pescado más que todo albacora y bonito que s lo que más ganancias le deja.
 
Su sueño es tener un frigorífico de mariscos.
texts.en:
In the Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of royal tamarinds (fruit), members of the Communal Bank of the Virgin of Guadalupe meet every two weeks.   

Mrs. Olga is in her second cycle at the Bank, and she is very happy and please for the help she has received and for the facilities the institution provides.  She is 55 years old, separated 10 years ago, and has 7 children from this relationship, two of whom live with her. 

She sells fish, and she has a small stand in the seafood market in Portoviejo city. She sells fish by the serving, or by the pound. Quite often she buys shrimp to sell by the pound. The fish she sells the most of is the albacore tuna, sold by the pound, and bonito (white tuna), which she sells by the serving. Every morning she gets up very early and goes to the market to buy the best fish the merchants bring from Manta. She works until 6:30 p.m. every day. She always buys what she can sell the same day as it costs her to leave extra in the refrigeration overnight. 

This loan is to be used to buy more the costlier albacore and bonito tuna which leaves her with the highest earnings. 

Her dream is to have a cold storage (refrigerator) for seafood.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles S. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates a specialized retail store selling coconut husk for copra and coconut shells for use as charcoal in the local community. She decided to start up this kind of business because it's more profitable than have a sari-sari store (a small general store). Angeles has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine peses (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Angeles joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Angeles from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles M. is a widow who lives in Hda. Yusay, Barangay San Jose, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures. She gives manicures and does smocking detail on fabrics. 

Angeles joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $120, thus raising the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy materials for her smocking business so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business and for the education of her children.  Angeles M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for smocking

loans.name: Jordan Ali

texts.es:
Jordan tiene 19 años, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Esteli, sus padres le ayudan a pagar los gastos universidad,  tiene una beca que se la dio la universidad, siempre quiso aprender acerca de la produccion, agricultura y ganaderia. Nunca a tenido un negocio.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Este credito, abre la oportunidad a los estudiantes para aprender la practica en la carrera. Quiere terminar su carrera y le gustaria tener su propio negocio en Ganaderia o Agricultura.
texts.en:
Jordan, 19, is a second year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Esteli.  His parents help him pay university costs.  He has a scholarship the university gave him.  He has always wanted to learn about production, agriculture and cattle raising.  He's never had a business.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project:  to grow cabbage.

This loan opens the opportunity for students to learn the practical side of the career.  He wants to finish his studies and would like to have his own business Cattle Raising or Agricultural business.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) farming.

loans.name: Mirla Soraya

texts.es:
La señora Mirla es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo menor.  Su esposo se desempeña como docente (profesor).
La señora Mirla lleva año y medio trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida (desayunos), esta actividad la desarrolla en el patio de su casa, de esa manera le queda tiempo para atender a su hijo y hacer otras cosas más.
Con este nuevo prestamos de S/. 1,000.00 soles comprará 5 bolsas de cemento, 1 metro de ripio, 4 varillas de fierro, para arreglar el piso de su patio y tener más comodidad para atender a sus clientes.
Co los ingresos que obtiene de su venta está comprando cosas que le hacían mucha falta en su hogar, y lo bueno es que puede ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindar a las mujeres esa oportunidad  de poder acceder a un  pequeño crédito, con el que puedan iniciar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mirla is a member of the 'Las Almendras' community bank which is located in Ucayali department.  She is 31 years old, married, and has one dependent child.  Her husband is a teacher.  Mirla has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for one and a half years.  She has a small business where she sells meals (breakfasts).  She runs her business from the open space directly outside her house.  This means that she also has time to look after her child and do other things.

She will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy 5 bags of cement, 1 meter of gravel and 4 iron rods to fix the ground outside her home so that she can serve her customers more comfortably.

Mirla is using the profits she makes in her business to buy things which she really needs for her home and the great thing is that she can help her husband with some expenses.

Mirla is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing women with this opportunity to access a small loan.

loans.use: To buy construction material (5 bags of cement, 1 meter of gravel and 4 iron rods)

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa B. is 61 and resides in Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Solomon, a retiree with a pension, and the mother of six children, who are all working and settled down with their own families. By the grace of God, Narcisa has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level -- a dream for most Filipino parents like Narcisa. She was a college undergraduate and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. At this time, Narcisa is working hard for the family's everyday expenses

Narcisa operates a buy-and-sell business.  She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, processed foods and other products of the like. Her current products are dried fish, peanut butter and frozen goods. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Narcisa hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to buy additional capital for her business. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gaviotas De Atla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se ubica en una comunidad cercana al municipio de tenango del valle muy conocida por la fabricacion de globo y asi mismo la de pan,este grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes de los cuales la señora sofia Montañez C. se dedica a la fabricacion de pan el cual tiene este oficio desde pequeña ya que toda la familia siempre han ejercido dicha actividad su familia esta conformada por cinco hijos de los cuales son tres mujeres y dos hombres todos ellos ya conforman su propia familia .De la señora sofia ya nadie depende, ella vende su producto en santiago tianquistenco.La señora enviudo hace dos años , su anhelo de ella es que sus hijos enseñen a sus nietos la fabricacion de pan y esta actividad continue de generacion en generacion.
texts.en:
This group (Seagulls of Atla) is located in a community near the municipality of Tenango del Valle, very well known for making balloons and also bread. The group is composed of 10 members, among whom Sofia is dedicated to making bread.

Sofia has been doing this since she was small, as her entire family has always done this. Her family is composed of 5 children, of whom 3 are women and 2 are men. All of them have established their own families. Sofia no longer has dependents. 

Sofia sells her products in Santiago Tianquistenco. She has been a widow since 2 years ago. Her hope is that her children will teach her grandchildren how to make bread and that this activity continues from generation to generation.

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THEIR BAKERY

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú.
Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora, ella tiene un pequeña picantería donde la pueden encontrar desde las 11 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche vendiendo la rica chicha y frutillada, ella nos cuenta que todos los días a las 4 pm ofrece una cortesía a sus clientes que consiste en un plato de comida. Ya son 40 años que se dedica a la venta de chicha y frutillada. No solo Gregoria vende en su picantería sino cuando tiene la oportunidad de vender en la ferias de la ciudad. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, azúcar y otras cosas más.   

Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Gregoria lives in the historic city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She prepares and sells “chicha de jora” (a beverage made of corn). Gregoria has a small eatery that is open from 11am until 9pm where she sells the rich tasting “chicha” and fruit smoothies. She says that every day at 4pm she offers her customers a complimentary plate of food. Gregoria has been selling “chicha” and smoothies for 40 years. In addition to managing her eatery, she also takes the opportunity to sell at the city fairs. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as cornmeal, sugar, and other ingredients.

Gregoria belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making "chicha" & fruit smoothies

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 61-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: selling Ready-to-Wear clothes and selling hardware merchandise. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family.  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria a la vez también trabaja en un kiosco escolar en un colegio nacional, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para realizar los desayunos que realiza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank ”KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gladis is 44-years-old. She lives with her partner and 3 children. She alternates between daily chores and her business of selling breakfast. She also works at a kiosk in a public school. She's a pretty happy person and she's eager to get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making breakfast. 

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making breakfast

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is 56 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar in the municipality of Cabatuan, a part of Isabela province on the island of Luzon. Nelia makes and sells food and drinks to passersby in the community. Nelia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nelia is requesting a new loan, her sixth from ASKI, of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make the foods she sells

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Амирхонов Хабибулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хабибулло занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян для весеннего посева.
texts.en: Habibullo A. lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Habibullo is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase seeds for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Darlyn Yessenia

texts.es: Darling Yessenia es madre luchadora tiene 2 hijos y están estudiando. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 5 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días. Este crédito es para la compra granos básicos, jugos, golosinas, galletas, detergentes, sopas entre otros.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia.
texts.en:
Darlyn Yessenia is a hard-working mother of two school-aged children.  She has been in the grocery store business, which is set up in her home, for five years.  She began selling groceries little by little until she was able to increase inventory.   Despite the many difficulties in her life, she is always struggling to get ahead in order to provide the best she can for her children.

She enjoys her work and knows that, were it not for her business, she would be unable to put food on the table.

This loan is to buy basic grains, juices, sweets, cookies, soups, detergents, etc.  Her dream is to expand her business and become competitive.
