When he started this job he drove a truck for hauling and was paid by commission, but now his wages are fixed. Even though he doesn’t make much, it is enough for food, basic bills, and other expenses. With this loan he wants to able to properly close off his bathroom and latrine, which he has covered with pieces of tin and a curtain. This is uncomfortable, unsafe and not very hygienic, but he can’t afford to put up concrete walls all at once. With the loans given to him by Afodenic he is making the improvements bit by bit. It is a great joy for him to be able to make the improvements which are a daily necessity for his family’s hygiene. He will buy construction supplies such as stone, sand, cement and iron in order to complete the project. Only through this process can people of low income carry out these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, sand, cement and iron in order to build a concrete bathroom and toilet for the improved hygiene and safety of his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a portable Illico and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Juana Dolores

texts.es:
la sra Juana Dolores S. Z. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de comidas, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Comedor “JUTIAPA”
Doña juanita, como mas se le conoce en la aldea de Jutiapa, tiene 29 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, nos comento que con los ingresos que le genero su negocio crió y brindo educaciones universitarias a sus hijos.
Su clientela la prefieren  por la atención que les brinda, la higiene con que prepara los alimentos, el buen gusto que le da a las comidas, y por el precio que les da.
Doña juanita, le da la comida al crédito a (6) seis agentes de la Policía mismos que le cancelan en fin de mes.
texts.en:
Juana Dolores S. Z.'s principal activity is the sale of food, she operates her business under the name The "Jutiapa" Eatery. Doña Juanita, as she is best known as throughout Jutiapa, has 29 years of experience with this type of business. It is notable that in this time she has learned to manage it, she told us that the income generated by the business has grown and she has provided university educations for her children. Her clients prefer her for the attention that she gives, the hygienic way she prepares the food, the good tastes that she gives to the foods and for the prices. Doña Juanita gives food on credit to six police agents that they pay back at the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red meat and pork, chicken, vegetables, tortillas, drinks, butter, oil, plates, glasses and take out containers, juices, condiments, beans, sugar, rice, salsa, pasta

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She makes lovely Nigerian and western designs for her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 36 years old, is married with 5 children, and her husband also works to support the home. She hopes to have a fashion shop in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 39-year-old single woman living with her mother and sisters. For two years, she has owned a chocolate shop where she produces chocolates and she also makes designs and special stands for all occasions. 

Ghada has already taken her first loan from Kiva and she is pleased with her decision because in regard to her business progress, she reports that both her income and productivity have increased since taking the loan. She choose to repay her loan early and take a new loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise such as chocolate products and accessories to be ready to satisfy orders before the Easter holiday.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as chocolates products and accessories

loans.name: Alhadi Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the Alhadi Primary School in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 2002 by Sheik Hassan Mohamed K. to give both Arabic and Western education to the children of Magburaka town.  Presently, the school has 7 teachers and 233 pupils.  

This is the first loan this school is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

42-year-old Paul A. C. (right) is the deputy headmaster at the school. He has been a teacher for seven years now. He was born in Matunkara village about 12 miles away from Magburaka town. He is married with nine children – five in secondary school and four in primary school. Paul is currently doing a distance-learning course and he is in his third and final year. He will like to use his share of this loan to pay for his final year's course. 

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To pay college fees

loans.name: Djily

texts.fr: Monsieur Djily D. est un jeune boutiquier de 36 ans qui exerce son activité de commerce dans un local pris en location situe a quelque mètres  de  la caisse de Yoff. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 2 mois. Il a appris l’activité pendant plusieurs années en étant  employé par d’autres boutiquiers plus expérimentés. Actuellement il gère sa propre boutique. Pour Monsieur D. c’est le seul moyen de gagner sa vie et subvenir a ses besoins. Cependant c’est aussi une activité  qu’il a hérité de ses parents. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de marchandises pour renforcer sa boutique. Ce crédit pourra l’aider à acheter certains produits qui sont fréquemment demandes par les clients et qu’il ne peut pas acquérir avec son fond propre. Ainsi il pourra considérablement accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et ses bénéfices avec ce financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Djily D. is a 36-year-old shopkeeper who rents his commercial location a few meters from the local Yoff branch of U-IMCEC. He is married and the father of a two-month-old infant. He learned the business for several years working as an employee of more experienced shop owners. He currently manages his own shop. Mr. D. feels this is the only way he can earn a living and meet his personal needs. Running a business is also something he has inherited from his parents. He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy merchandise and build up his shop. The loan will enable him to buy certain products frequently requested by his customers, for which he lacks sufficient funds. He will therefore be able to significantly increase his turnover and his income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: boost working capital

loans.name: Helen Abrinica Group

texts.en:
Helen A. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Helen is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,009 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lhurielyn

texts.en:
Lhurielyn V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 48 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lhurielyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a farm where she plants and harvests rice crops.
Lhurielyn joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lhurielyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha ella es soltera, debido a que su esposo ya falleció, y tiene 2 hijas los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan económicamente. La señora se dedica a la sastrería, en su casa tiene varias maquinas de coser, las cuales utiliza y contrata a veces personas para la elaboración de trajes de damas, camisas, faldas, etc. Ella ya tiene 50 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual empezó gracias a que su mama la indujo a aprender este oficio desde los 16 años. Primeramente trabaja con su mama, luego quedo ella trabajando sola. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo realizar compras de materia prima, ya que actualmente posee varios pedidos de faldas y camisas de mujer. Su sueño siempre ha sido dejarles un buen negocio establecido a sus hijas para así como ella, puedan mantenerse con los ingresos del mismo.
texts.en:
Bertha is single because her husband passed away, and she has 2 daughters who are adults and who help her financially. She works as a tailor; in her home she has various sewing machines which she uses. At times she hires workers to make women's suits, shirts, skirts, etc. She has been in this business for 50 years. She started thanks to her mother, who led her to learn this trade when she was 16 years old. First, she worked with her mother, and later she was left working on her own. She wants to use this loan to purchase raw materials, since she currently has a number of orders for skirts and women's shirts. Her dream has always been to leave and established business to her daughters so that they, like her, could support themselves with the income it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Don Genaro V. es casado, cuenta con 34 años de edad, vive con su señora en casa propia, posee un hijo menor.
El señor es dueño de un centro comercial, se dedica a vender, carne vacuna, porcino, embutidos en general, comercializa en la ciudad de pilar, en los principales centros comerciales de la ciudad.
Posee clientelas de todo lado, inclusive clientes de la capital del país, por su buenos cortes, precios y calidad de sus productos.
El prestatario es ganadero, posee animales a su nombre , realiza también la criá de animales, engordes intensivos de vacunos, preparaciones de vientres.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne porcina.
Cliente agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a  Kiva , por los buenos servicios que le brinda para su negocio.
texts.en:
Genaro V. is married, 34 years of age, and lives with his wife in their own home; he has one minor son. He is the owner of a shopping center and sells beef, pork, and cold cuts in general. He sells his products in the city of Pilar, in the main shopping centers of the city. He has customers from all over, including customers from the country’s capital, because of his good cuts, prices and the quality of his products. This borrower is a livestock farmer, he owns animals in his name and also raises animals, practices intensive fattening of cattle and the preparation of entrails. At this time he is seeking the loan to purchase pork. The client thanks the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the good services they provide for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pork

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon O. Is a cereal vendor, a business he started in 1994, in Nambale, Busia. Owing to his family's needs, Solomon realized that he could not depend only on the salary from his employment alone, and needed to start this venture to enable him get enough income to sustain his family basic necessities. 

He normally travels to Busia twice a week to purchase more inventory because of the high demand of the products. His dream of diversifying his business could not be realized, and for this reason, he joined K-MET micro finance initiative to access a loan worth Kshs 10,000 to enable him increase his inventory to boost his income. He is 56 years old, married and the father of ten children.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Stand Strong Group

texts.en:
These women are the members of the “Stand Strong United” group. They are small-scale-business women in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone, and this will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.

With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses and make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve and they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Mahawa K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and they have five children: three in primary school, one in secondary school, and one not of school-going age.

Mahawa sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of ready-to-wear clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy dozens of ready-to-wear clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin H. is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community he is now a well known and appreciated merchant.  Previously Shahin was a farm hand, working in the fields for different people.  Because of his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc.  His wife sells his harvest at the market and his products have become very popular among buyers. 

Now Shahin requests a loan to better serve his customers and to differentiate himself from the competition.  He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  He only wants to continue growing his business and to improve the quality of life for his family.  His loan request is 1000 AZN.  He is a repeat client for AqroInvest and has a very good client history.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila vive en la ciudad de la Paz,  en la zona denominada Alto Tacagua   cuenta con dos hijos ya mayores de edad, es viuda, cuenta que fue un golpe para ella el quedarse sola sin su compañero, pero supo reponerse y salir adelante, su actividad es la venta de comida  cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y menciona que invertirá el dinero en la compra de un terreno  que esta de ocasión, ella cuenta con parte de lo que cuesta el terreno y le hizo falta los un mil dólares americanos que actualmente solicita, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in the city of La Paz in an area called Alto Tacagua. She has two grown children, and she is a widow. She says that it was a blow for her to be left alone without her life partner. But, she knew how to recover and get ahead. She sells food, and she has ten years of experience in this field. She says that she will use the money to buy a piece of land that is a bargain. She has part of the price of the land, but she still needs $1,000 American dollars. She is requesting that amount now. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is always thinking of her family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piece of land

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie B. is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Port Area, a part of Iligan City on the Luzon islands. Emelie runs a business in which she makes and sells specialty food dishes like sotanghon to the local community. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emelie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Emelie successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase ingredients needed to make her food specialties. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del banco hace ya siete ciclos con este,  está muy contenta con el Banco Comunal ya que se ha mantenido y ha crecido en el número de socias, y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos dos mayores de edad y el ultimo que tiene 16 años que estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios), también trabaja desde las 6h30 en una casa como empleada domestica pero en las tardes se dedica a recorrer con sus productos los cuales entrega ya que son bajo pedido   y cobra cada semana los domingos.

Este crédito lo quiere para pagar los pedidos que le llegan este fin de mes ya que tiene mercadería entregada y que no cobra en su totalidad.
  
Su sueño es terminar por completo su casa.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in the sector known as Las Piedras, we find the Caminantes de Cristo (Followers of Christ) Communal Bank, which meets every 15 days.

Nelly is a founding member of the bank and has been with it for seven loan cycles. She is very happy with the bank because it has survived and grown its membership, and she's appreciative of Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir for the help she has received with her loans. She is 43 years old; she is married and has three children, two who are older and the other who is 16 years old and going to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.
 
She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume, and accessories). [Translator's note: Yanbal is like Mary Kay or Avon.] She also works from 6:30 am as a housemaid, but in the afternoons she travels with her products and delivers them even though she is understocked, and takes payment every Sunday.

This loan that she is requesting is to pay for the orders that are coming at the end of this month because she has already delivered some products but not gotten fully paid for them.

Her dream is to finish her house.

loans.use: Buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica has successfully repaid her first Kiva loan. With it she financed and has sustained her rug-making business. She is thankful for your support and the opportunity to borrow money from Kiva. Rustica is very happy that, with the loan, she is able to provide prompt service to her regular customers. She wants a larger loan to expand her business and make more profit. She thanks Kiva for providing her with the opportunity to increase her income. Your support is important to her family and they are very grateful. Rustica joined Kiva partner, ASHI, to follow her dreams of giving a decent life to her family. 

Now Rustica would like another Kiva loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase raw materials needed in her business. She wants to save for the future of her family, especially to enable her grandchildren to complete their studies through college. Her long-term goal is to expand her business to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life — currently far below poverty level.

loans.use: To buy materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazan está formado por 10 mujeres quienes con su trabajo diario buscan la manera de entregar a sus familias una mejor estabilidad económica, viven a los alrededores del cantón Nabon, cantón que es de clima frió en donde la mayor parte de su gente se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su gente encuentran en la ciudad varios trabajos entre ellos los de la construcción, son gente humilde y mantienen su cultura.

La Señora María M. vive en la comunidad de Guantogloma que  pertenece al cantón de Nabon, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos,  los cinco son mayores de edad y  casados, su ultimo hijo estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como jornalero, con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña María se dedica a trabajar como jornalera en tierras propias y ajenas donde siembra  verduras, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y vacas, animales que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en la banca,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es llegar a tener más animales.

La Señora. Lidia C. vive en la comunidad de Guantogloma que  pertenece al cantón de Nabon. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal. Se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar aprovecha el tiempo para criar  cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y borregos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. 
Doña Lidia es una mujer muy joven de 24 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad que  estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa de varios herederos.
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Entrada a Chuazan is comprised of 10 women who look for a way to bring more economic stability to their families through their daily work. They live in the surrounding areas of the canton of Nabon, a canton with a cold climate where the majority of people work in agriculture and raise animals. Many people find various jobs in the city such as in construction. The people are humble and maintain their culture. 
  
Señora María M. lives in the community of Guantogloma which belongs to the canton of Nabon. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children. 5 are adults and married, her youngest child studies in high school. Her husband works as a farm laborer and with their hard work they have managed to build their own house. María works as a farm laborer on her own and others' land where she plants vegetables. She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cows - animals which she sells when she has economic need. This is the second loan that she has asked for from the communal bank and she likes that she already has very good friends in the bank. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals. 

Señora Lidia C. lives in the community of Guantogloma which belongs to the canton of Nabon. This is the second loan she has asked for from the communal bank. She is in charge of the household chores and takes advantage of her time to raise guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep which she sells in her community. Lidia is a young woman of 24, married with 3 children of 8, 6, and 4 years of age who study at one of the community's schools. Her husband works as a farm laborer. They don't have their own house and for that reason they live in the house of several heirs. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: María Otilia

texts.en:
Maria is forty-eight years old.  She lives in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa in La Victoria.  La Victoria is one of the poorer sections of the city of Chiclayo.  It is primarily populated by laborers and individuals who participate in small commercial activities.  Maria shares her home with her husband.  They have no dependent children.

Maria sells vegetables in the major market of Moshoqueque in the northern sector of the city of Chiclayo.  She manages a small stand and sells on a daily basis.  She finds that her business has the opportunity to grow and has therefore requested this loan.  She plans to invest the proceeds in expanding her inventory and her selection.  She hopes that the action will improve her income and market share.

Maria has very good references and an excellent credit history.  She is proud of her business and her ability to earn income.  She works arduously on a daily basis to better her lifestyle and that of her family.

loans.use: Expanding her inventory and her selection.

loans.name: Milena Johana

texts.es: Hace ya un año Milena de 27 años, buscando alternativas de ingresos adicionales cré su negocio de comecializar artesanias provenientes de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolivar donde hacen manualidades como hamacas, bolsos y tejidos con tecnicas especiales de pintura que solo en este municipio hacen con tanta dedicación y buen gusto. Ella inició con poco capital y unas cantidades muy pequeñas de artesanias pero encontró un gran mercado de consumo en Soledad, lugar donde vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 4 años,  y donde su negocio  creció en número de clientes y en infraestructura porque ahora exhibe las artesanias en sus vitrinas en la sala de sus casa. Su principal meta es tener un local independiente a su vivienda donde exhibir y vender sus productos como punto de venta especializado en arte de los Montes de Maria. Milena está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es justamente un credikiva con el cual comprará hermosos colgantes de sonidos adornados con flores, hamacas, sandalias tipicas y mesas de centro. Sus ventas promedio son $ $2.742.857 COP su endeudamiento con el credito sería de 35,4% y mantiene una rentabilidad del 31%, mientras sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 18 dias y su inventario cada 23. Con su credito augura el aumento de sus capital de trabajo y por consiguiente de utilidades porque se acercan las temporadas de ventas de estos productos muy apetecidos por las familias soledeñas.
texts.en:
One year ago, 27 year-old Milena was looking for ways of making additional income. She established her business selling handicrafts from San Jacinto, in Bolivar department.  Here they make handicrafts such as hammocks, bags and knitted items with special painting techniques which are only made with such commitment and good taste in this particular town.

Milena started out with only a little bit of capital and a very small quantity of handicrafts but she found a big consumer market in Soledad which is where she lives with her two children aged 7 and 4 and where her business grew both in terms of number of customers and in infrastructure because she now displays the handicrafts in display cases in the living room of her home.  Her main goal is to have independent premises where she can display and sell her products.  She would like to have a specialized retail outlet for arts from Los Montes de Maria.

Milena is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it is a Kiva loan which she will use to buy beautiful musical mobiles adorned with flowers, hammocks, traditional sandals and coffee tables.  Her average sales are 2,743,857 Colombian pesos.  Her debt (with the loan) would be 35.4% and she maintains a profitability of 31%.  Her accounts receivable turnover is every 18 days and her inventory turnover is every 23 days.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and, consequently, her profits because the sales seasons for these products which are very much in demand with families in Soledad are approaching.

loans.use: To buy beautiful musical mobiles adorned with flowers, hammocks, traditional sandals and coffee tables

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A., 51 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 2 children, aged 27 and 20. Regina is a farmer. She plants rice crops and vegetables. Regina rents a stall at the market where she sells her harvest. Regina wishes to have a stable business. 

Regina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Regina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Marigold Group/rosalinda Lapinig

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of Manla Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. Rosalinda is the group leader of a two-member loan group called “Marigold” offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, the group is collectively responsible for paying back the loans of fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Rosalinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Rosalinda joined GDMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan. Rosalina will use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Jena's Group

texts.en:
Jena M. is from the village of Dimaluna, city of Ozamis. She is 30  years old. Jena is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Jena is married and has two school-aged children. She owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In March 2010, Jena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Jena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Excelencia Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Excelencia,escogio este nombre  porque tienen el reto D. comportarse como lo dice su nombre, este grupo se encuentra en Toluca Estado D. Mexico; el grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes, una D. las integrantes es la señora Irma R., tiene 35 años y casada desD. hace 18 años; tienen 2 hijos D. 17 años y 7 años estudian actualmente la educacion media superior y la educacion primaria. La señora decidio apoyar a su marido con la venta D. zapato por catálogo, solicito el prestamo para una  mayor cobertura D. entrega a sus clientas y así elevar sus ventas. Sus hijos son su mayor inspiracion para trabajar día con día teniendo como meta darles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
This group is called “Excelencia” (Excellence), a name that was chosen because the members have been challenged to conduct themselves in such a manner. The group is from Toluca in the State of Mexico and consists of ten members.

One of the members is Sra. Irma R.. She is 35 years old and has been married since she was 18. Irma has two children, ages 17 and 7, who are currently in high school and elementary school respectively. She decided to help her husband by selling shoes through a catalog. Irma is requesting a loan so that she can cover most of the cost of her customers’ orders and increase her sales. Her children are her greatest inspiration, so she works day after day to proviD. them with a good education.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: 31-year-old N. Norman is an agro sales businessman mostly dealing in bananas. He operates his business from Kanyambe food market-Rukungiri. He also sells coffee. These two businesses have over the course of time enabled him to give a better well-being to his family of three kids and one wife. Weekly the banana sales business generates shillings 150,000 and he says with this loan he is going to purchase better manure for his banana gardens.

loans.use: The purchase of better manure

loans.name: Margarita María

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita María; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, viuda y tiene 3 hijos; la socia trababa en una entidad pública de lunes a viernes desde las 08:00am hasta la 01:00pm y de 03:00pm hasta las 07:00pm, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia que es lo más importante que tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal (no especifico).

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita María is a member of the "MOSOQ ALLPA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Margarita María is 58 years old, widowed, and has 3 children.  She works for a public company from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 1.00pm and from 3.00pm to 7.00pm.  She is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life as they are the most important thing that she has.

Margarita María is requesting this loan for her own (non specific) personal use.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: For her own (non specific) personal use

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 47 years old, married and has a child. She graduated from intermediate school. She has a beauty salon, and will use this loan to develop her shop and purchase new barber chairs, equipment and makeup. She has a good reputation in the market and has a lot of experience in the job. She has lots of clients because she relies on the most modern, updated styles in cutting hair and does arrangements for brides as well. This borrower has high ambition and motivation to develop her shop.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and makeup materials.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 17.

Thelma is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops. She sells her harvest to the people in her community. Thelma works hard to support her family. She wants to help improve their living conditions.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora. María Gonzáles es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña María tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene una hija de 6 años de edad que  estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (Arreglo de latas de  Vehículos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora María labora como auxiliar contable en un almacén de pinturas que es de su propiedad y de su hermana, ellas venden todo tipo de pinturas de agua, de caucho, automotrices, diluyentes, tiñer, etc. laboran de lunes a sábado hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pinturas y diluyentes para su almacén.
 
Su meta es tener su negocio independiente.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of Las Flores (the Flowers) communal bank and lives in the Totoracocha sector of the city of Cuenca. This city, which is visited for its natural beauty and architectonics, has a varied gastronomy that captures the local and foreign palate alike.

Maria is 40 years old, married, and has a daughter aged 6 who studies in a little school in the city.  Maria's husband works in a metal body shop repairing vehicles. They lack their own house, and they live by renting.

Maria works as an accountant's helper in a paint store that belongs to her and her sister. They sells all types of paints, water, rubber, automobile, and thinners, etc.

Maria's communal bank  is in its 2nd loan cycle and her loan will be used to buy paints and thinners for their store.

Maria's goal is to have a store independently.

loans.use: TO BUY PAINTS AND THINNERS FOR THEIR PAINT STORE

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 38 years old and lives with her son in the Songino-hairhan district and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older sister's backyard. Her son, age 13, attends a local secondary school. She manages a women's wear trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2002 and gained much experience. Before her business operation, she used to work as a dressmaker at a private clothing manufacturer for three years. Her business was quite successful which allowed her to build a strong customer base. She is planning to continue her business in the future. She is an honest woman who says, "I want to expand my business in order to be able to pay my son's education fee." She is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more women's clothes and to increase her business sales.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes.

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Dawood Nagar. She is 55 years old, married to S. J. and has three children. Her elder son operates a gent's beauty salon and the second son is a daily wage labor. Her daughter Shakila is studying. Irshaad is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her children. She is still very active at the age of 55 and completes her daily tasks efficiently.  Her husband is a daily wage laborer. He worked very hard all through his life to raise his children. 
 
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her eldest son's beauty salon business. With the loan, he will buy beauty products like creams, masks etc to offer better services to his customers and increase his profits. Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will make a better impact on her son’s business and make him more income than before.  Irshaad is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident that it will give good financial results to her son in his business.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a bakery since 2000 with more than 20 years of experience in this occupation. He prepares delicious food and pastries such as pizza, tarts, pies etc.  Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to satisfy his family needs. He has taken advantage of his first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client paying on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as flour, gas etc. He says that with these purchases, he will be able to increase his productivity and meet his customers’ demands. In the future, he intends to enlarge his business even more.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies such as flour and gas

loans.name: Sivia De Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Sivia de Fátima de 55 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien hace 12 años puso una modesta venta de chiverías en la actualidad gracias a su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo ahora tiene una pulpería donde vende desde granos básicos hasta productos de belleza.
Ella tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, casados y con hijos. En el negocio cuenta con la ayuda de una  sobrina quien despacha y ordena los productos.
texts.en:
Sivia de Fátima, 55 years of age, is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She installed a modest grocery store in her home 12 years ago that currently, thanks to her efforts and the loans, has been growing.  She now has a grocery store where she sells everything from basic staples to beauty products.  

She has three grown children who are married and have families.  In her business, she counts on the help of a niece who takes care of and orders the products.

loans.use: buy basic staples, food, sodas....etc.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 39 years old, married, and has four children aged 1 to 7. He has been selling Mitumba bags and clothes for 11 years and employs two people. Benson intends to use his loan to stock up on more bags and clothes. 

Benson hopes to become a wholesaler of Mitumba bags and own a fleet of vehicles. Benson describes himself as efficient.

loans.use: to stock up on more bags and clothes.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
29-year-old Loida is a married woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 6.  She is a farmer working in the town of Sta. Josefa,  Agusan Del Sur.  She has been growing rice and corn crops for 5 years. Loida earns about 3200 PHP per month doing this farming.

Loida has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, like urea. She hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, like urea

loans.name: Leyli

texts.es:
La señora Leyli, es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras de Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, está casada, tiene 44 años de edad y dos hijos menores de edad.
Tener su primer préstamo le dió las ganas de hacer lo que siempre había pensado, pero no contaba con capital.
Es socia fundadora de su banco comunal, tiene una bodega instalada en su casa y no interfiere con la atención de su casa y de sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 docena de fruta al jugo, ½ caja de conservas, 1 paquete de fideo, 1 caja de galleta, 1 caja de leche, 1 bolsa de harina, 1 caja de cocoa, 2 tiras de nescafe, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite.
Con este negocio puede ayudar con algunos gastos en la casa, su esposo es maestro de obras y es quien mantiene el hogar, debido a su trabajo a veces tiene que ausentarse casi todo el día, ella tiene que hacerse cargo de todo.
texts.en:
Leyli is a member of the 'Líderes Triunfadoras' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 44 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  Her first loan gave her the will to do what she had always planned to do but didn't have enough capital for.

Leyli is a founding member of her community bank.  She has a grocery store in her home.  This allows her to look after her home and her children as well.

Leyli will use her new loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy one dozen lots of fruit juice, 1/2 a crate of canned goods, 1 packet of noodles, 1 box of cookies, 1 crate of milk, 1 bag of flour, 1 box of cocoa, 2 strips of Nescafe sachets, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice and 1 crate of oil.

Through her business, Leyli is able to help with some of her household expenses.  Her husband is a master builder and he supports their household.  As a result of his work, he sometimes has to disappear for almost the whole day and Leyli has to take care of everything.

loans.use: to buy milk, juice, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Tulinawe Kyangwali Group

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in a permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He has been dealing in a textile business for five years, and with the income earned he has been able to build a house for himself. He started with 500,000/=  shillings as working capital but now his stock is worth 3,000,000 shillings. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations. 

Wilfred hopes to set up a wholesale shop in the next five years. He needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: canecería, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, venta de medias, venta de salteñas, venta de ganado.

La señora Celia, indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que viene trabajando hace dos años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para  la compra de una heladera, para la refrigeración de la carne, este equipo lo comprará de la Ceja y lo acomodará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud, crédito y ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Celia. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various business activities in order to get ahead such as operating a butcher shop, knitting sweaters, managing a neighborhood store, selling vegetables, selling socks, selling turnovers, and selling livestock.

Sra. Celia says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a friend. Celia currently has a business selling meat and has been working for two years.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to buy a refrigerator for preserving meat. This piece of equipment will be purchased in the neighborhood of La Ceja and she will make room for it in her store. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Celia is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celia said she enjoys the health services, the loans, and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for preserving meat.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is 30 and the mother of four kid and currently they live in the Siem Reap Province. All of her children still live under her care and her income. Mrs. Sam is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for over ten years. She also relies on income from her husband’s work, a fisherman as well as a foreman construction worker. This couple makes an income in average of $7USD each day to cover their family’ needs.
Presently, her husband meets a problem with fishing activity as his boat is broken now. It may affect with his fishing process as well as his daily revenue.  So, Mrs. Sam requested a loan of $400 to buy a new boat for her husband going his fishing business. With the rest, it will use to purchase some nets.

loans.use: to to buy a new boat and some nets.

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: Mirna Patricia D. 34 años D. edad, habita en casa propia dentro D. una ciudad urbana cercana a la capital del país, junto con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su esposo y sus dos hijas. Mirna se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad tales como: medicinas, frijoles, arroz, aceite, golosinas, detergente y D. mas artículos  que los clientes soliciten. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar D. residencia el cual se encuentra sobre la calle principal del lugar donD. ella habita. Esto es una ventaja para ella ya que muchos clientes la prefieren por encontrarse en un lugar accesible y sobre todo porque ella siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad. Ya tiene 7 años D. dedicarse al negocio y durante todo este tiempo le ha dado muy buenos frutos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y trabaja duramente para poder darles lo que necesitan. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tienda en la  compra D. productos por mayor como: detergentes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, café, medicinas, golosinas, pan dulce,tc. para surtir su negocio y poder atraer a más clientes que demanden sus productos con el fin D. mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
34-year-old Mirna Patricia lives in her own home, in an urban town, near the country's capital city.  She lives with her family group which consists of her husband and her two daughters.

Mirna sells basic household products such as medicines, beans, rice, oil, candies, detergents and other items that her customers request.  Her business is in her home which is located on the main road.  This is an advantage for her.  Many customers prefer to buy from her because she is in an easily-accessible place but, above all, because she serves them with a smile and a lot of kindness.  She has been in this business for seven years and, over the years, the business has provided her with very good rewards.  The most important thing in Mirna's life is her family and she works hard so that she can give them what they need.  This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in her store by purchasing products wholesale such as detergents, oil, rice, beans, coffee, medicines, candies, sweet bread, etc.  This will enable her to stock her business and attract more customers.  Her aim is to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale such as detergents, oil, rice, beans, coffee, medicines, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sifa, leader du groupe d’affaire «Akiba », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 34  ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous à l’école primaire. Son mari est un mécanicien. Elle est  sociétaire d’une boucherie, vendeuse de viande. Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir le tout premier  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  une chèvre à abattre.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client Sifa is leader of the group "Akiba" and is a young entrepreneur aged of 34. She is married and mother of 5 children who are all going to middle school. Her husband is a garage mechanic. She is a member of a butchery that sells meat. She does income generation activities such like this one for 8 years. However, she just received her first loan from Hekima. Her first capital was given by her husband. This new loan will allow her to buy a goat to slaughter. Moreover, she hopes to see her children growing in a comfortable environment and to expand her business. Sifa thanks Hekima for their actions toward poor women left out of the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy a goat

loans.name: Gioconda Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Gioconda Patricia es comerciante y  posee su propio negocio de pulpería desde hace 6 años. Con la ayuda de su familia ha logrado mantener su negocio y ahora necesita incrementar mas sus ventas por lo que se acerca a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para poder comprar los productos para la pulpería tales como granos básicos y perecederos y así satisfacer la demanda de la clientela y de igual poder cubrir esas necesidades.

Considera que con este préstamo, podrá sobresalir en su negocio y darle una mejor comodidad a su familia
texts.en:
Giocondo Patricia  is a merchant and she has had her own small grocery business for 6 years. With the help of her family she has been able to sustain her business. Now she needs to increase her sales, which is why she came to the office of Ceprodel, to request a loan to buy products for her store, such as basic grains and perishable items. This way she can meet the demand of her customers and also cover her necessities. 

She believes that with this loan she will be able to excel in her business and give her family a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Suni, tiene 57 años, es casada y madre de 7 hijos.
Máxima tiene un taller de confección de pantalones, antes trabajaba en una Cooperativa y no le gustó, gracias a una amiga ingresó a Finca, se siente contenta de pertencer a su Banco Comunal y disfruta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan a ahorrar. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the Communal Bank “Suni”. She is married and the mother of seven children.

Máxima has a workshop where she makes trousers. She previously worked with a cooperative, but she did not like it. Thanks to a friend, she joined FINCA. Máxima is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank and enjoys the training classes because they have taught her how to save. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: 03.11.07 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng has a retail business selling office supplies. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase office supplies for resale.

Hằng is 41 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 7 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties she faces is the lack of capital. With the profit from her business, Hằng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies to resell

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is from the village of Alambari, West Georgia. She is 51 years old, married and lives in the village with her family: husband Amiran and two children, a 25-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son. Mzevinar’s son goes to school. Her daughter and Amiran work on the family farm. In particular, the family owns 600 nut trees and 20 citrus trees. Harvested nuts and citrus fruits are sold locally. Mzevinar trades their greengrocery products on the local market. She purchases fruits and vegetables in nearby villages, as well as locally from the wholesalers, and sells them on the open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Mzevinar requested credit for increasing her stock for trade. She will use it for purchasing a variety of fruits and vegetables and resell them on the open market. Her sales will increase and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale on open market

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: El  señor  Guadalupe  es  muy trabajador  y   día con día  se  esfuerza   por  salir  adelante,  gracias  a   su empeño y  dedicación  a  podido  adquirir   su  vivienda   pero nos  comenta  que   requiere  acondicionarla  para   brindarle a  su  familia  una mejor  estabilidad,  en este  momento  el requiere  realizar  la construcción de  una  barda   por  que  de esta  manera  brindara  a su  familia una  mayor   seguridad  y así cuando  el tenga   que    ir a  su trabajo  el lo   hará  de una  manera  mas  tranquila,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Guadalupe  is a very hard-working man who strives to make progress every day.  Thanks to his determination and commitment, he has been able to acquire a house.  However, he tells us that he needs to do work on it in order to provide his family with better stability.  

Right now, Guadalupe needs to build a perimeter wall so that he can provide his family with more security.  This will mean that when he has to go out to work he will be able to do so more peacefully.  He is grateful for the support that he has received to carry out his project.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Amelia solicita un préstamo para comprar más mercancía para vender ya que con la que cuenta, no es de temporada de invierno y lo que desea es ofrecer buena mercancía para no perder a sus clientes. 
Doña Amelia quedo viuda desde hace años lo cual tuvo que realizar algunas actividades para sacer adelante a sus hijos y lo único que funciono fue la venta de ropa y zapatos en diferentes partes de la ciudad , desde entonces de a dedicado a las ventas y ha logrado tener un patrimonio y ha ver educado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell. Even though it is not yet winter, she wants to offer good merchandise so that she does not lose customers.

Doña Amelia has been a widow for several years, so she has had to engage in a few businesses in order to help her children move forward. The only business that has succeeded is selling clothes and shoes in different parts of the city. Since then she has dedicated herself to making sales so that she can build up assets and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 37-year-old mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Jane who sells fruit. They are blessed with one child who is 4-years-old.  He has been in the farming business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Patrick will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit, he will expand the business. 

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, vinegar, cooking oil, eggs and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia is forty-two years of age and is married with five children. Fia owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business. Fia needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon, 39 years old, is a divorced lady. Maysoon is a very talented woman who has been making art from straw and wax, She even does embroidered clothes and covers.

Welcoming people with her beautiful smile has helped her in attracting more people to buy from her. It has been 10 years now since she started. In addition to her business, she participates in training centers to train the girls on embroidery and other skills.

Now Maysoon wants to expand her business by buying more materials and looking for markets for her products. For that reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials and look for markets for her products

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una joven emprendedora que hace poco inició su propio negocio en busca de mejores oportunidades económicas para brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 padres. Fue así como montó una tienda general con unos ahorros que tenía y gracias a su dedicación ha venido creciendo mucho y generando cada vez más ventas. Debido a que su negocio lo montó con muy bajo capital, en un principio no contaba con mucha variedad de productos, sin embargo ha tenido la disciplina para ir creciendo poco a poco y así ir ofreciendo a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Andrea busca un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y poder ofrecer a sus clientes carnes, pollo y demás productos que requieran de este almacenamiento.

De esta manera seguirá creciendo y cada vez generando más ingresos para que en su hogar mejore la calidad de vida y las oportunidades económicas. Su mayor sueño es sacar sus 2 padres adelante ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida y en un futuro crecer con su negocio y tener un supermercado.

loans.use: Comprar un refrigerador y poder ofrecer a sus clientes carnes, pollo y demás productos que requieran de este almacenamiento.

loans.name: Esbelida Eulalia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás como comerciante de ropa, plásticos y porcelana; hasta ahora esta actividad le ha resultado muy beneficiosa.  Trabaja todo el día, en compañía de su esposo.  El también se dedica a la venta de artículos recorriendo por toda la ciudad.  No tiene hijos y a futuro le gustaría incrementar mucho más su negocio.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de platos, tasas, baldes y otros artículos para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de artículos para el hogar

loans.name: Mmasava Mawangi's Group

texts.en:
Mmasava’s group has four group leader farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 KES to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Mmasava is pictured on the right of the Bahati Group with his hand raised. 

Mmasava is a reliable member of the community. He is married with three children. Mmasava is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family. In addition to this, Mmasava is very active in his community and involved in the savings and prayer groups. His harvest last year was not with One Acre Fund. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer, he will be able to join the ranks of the One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program! 

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Mmasava’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to learn new farming methods. As an active member in his community, Mmasava also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers. Mmasava plans on using profits from the harvest to save for the future. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund. 

Mmasava and the Bahati Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nonvignon 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 8  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Cécile, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans ne vit plus avec son mari. Cécile est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Cécile vit seule avec ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Cécile. Cécile n’ a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour y arriver, Cécile vend de la pâte de maïs fermenté accompagnée de sauce depuis quatre ans environ. Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Cécile sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 8, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, de l'huile de végétale et des condiments.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael tiene 30 años de edad, y se caracteriza por se un hombre emprendedor y dedicado a su negocio de venta de tortas de jamón y carne; dicho negocio le permite percibir los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito  a FUSAI  para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para proceder en la mejora del piso de la vivienda y así brindar a su familia condiciones más higiénicas. Agradece el apoyo que recibió en el pasado por la institución dado que esto le permitió instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda.

loans.use: Para comprar: cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para proceder en la mejora del piso de la vivienda.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Sarah is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 7 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps cows. Sarah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: "I have to do something for my family." 

Sarah joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Sarah is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Sarah to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

For smallholder women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Sarah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are many because Sarah will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase. 
Sarah is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Sarah will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Millicent started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kerugoya, a remote town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Taking care of her farm is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her livestock is her hobby. Rice farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kerugoya area. Millicent has good knowledge of the market and wants to take advantage of the ready market. She is seeking a loan to plant rice.
Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, enterprising women like Millicent can achieve their dreams and goals. Millicent believes that the key to increased rice production is proper farming methods and irrigation of the rice. In addition to selling rice, she will also sell rice husks which will be used as fertilizer. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

Kindly lend to Millicent to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To plant rice

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania has a small store where she sells a variety of items. Her products include shoes, clothes, cleaning products and even toys. She also has a partnership with her mother who lives in rural Ecuador. Tania buys many of her products wholesale and she also distributes to her mother’s store. Her business is doing well but she is in need of more capital in order to continue investing in different types of products that will allow her to increase her profits. She and her husband have two children, one of which has a mental disability. The business has allowed her to provide her son with therapy and medicine.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk to sell from her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Ms. Rosa has 15 years of experience in business. She used to work as a household servant, and also sold clothing to her friends. Little by little, she saved her money, until the time when she decided to start her own business. She bought a cooler and, with the help of her sister, started selling drinks, sodas, and juices. She works every day of the week from 6 AM until 12 PM. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Rosa wants this loan in order to invest in school supplies, because in her area there is no such business, and also to invest in her current business.

Rosa is married. She is 55 years old and has 7 children, of whom only the youngest one still lives with her. Her husband works at a lumberyard and helps her with the household income. Not long ago her house was flooded, and with the help of her entire family she was able to fix it. In the future she hopes to be able to remake it out of cement.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in drinks and school supplies

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline I., a 56-year- old woman, is from the semi-urban area of Jattu, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells chicken to people in her environment and is married with three (3) children. She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for sale

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía C., divorced and mother of a 13 year-old son, is a craftswoman dedicated to making skirts, blankets, and hats that are sold in a small store in on Franco Valle Avenue in la Ceja de El Alto.

Lucia has been doing this work for more than 18 years, as an associate of Pro Mujer, she would be able to increase her small amount of capital in order to continue making her crafts that could be later sold in the fairs in the city of El Alto and also through travel to sell the crafts in other locations.

It has been two years since Lucia first had the help of Pro Mujer with her business, which allowed her to open her small store in la Ceja de El Alto, and now Lucia hopes to invest new capital in her goal as stated above, but before doing so she would like to enlarge her store so she could better accomodate a greater variety of products that she has already produced.

Only in this way she will be able to earn the necessary amount of money in order to follow through with her idea of having a booth at the fair in El Alto.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lucía C., divorciada, y madre de un niño de 13 años, es artesana y se dedica a la confección de polleras, mantas y sombreros, que comercializa en una pequeña tiendita en la Av. Franco Valle de la Ceja de El Alto.

Son más de 18 años que Lucía viene realizando este trabajo, ingresando como socia a Pro Mujer, logra incrementar su pequeño capital para seguir confeccionando sus artesanías, que en ese entonces eran vendidas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y de forma ambulante.

Hace dos años y con la ayuda de Pro Mujer Lucía logró la apertura de su pequeña tienda en la Ceja de El Alto, y hoy en día su intención es reunir capital para invertir en dicho negocio, pero principalmente para la ampliación de su tienda con el fin de dar mayor cabida a la diversidad de productos que a la fecha ya ha confeccionado.

Solo de esta manera logrará reunir la cantidad de dinero necesaria para concluir su pequeña casita que se encuentra en la fase de terminado con la implementación de la obra fina.

loans.use: To enlarge her store to provide for a greater variety of goods and invest in a sales booth at the fair in El Alto

loans.name: Virgílio André

texts.pt:
Virgílio André L. is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children. He sells used clothes at his home in the neighborhood of Mahotas in Maputo.
