He joined the program in February of this year, then he requested a loan of 3.000MT. He is in the 2nd cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 5.000MT to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Virgílio André L. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 3 filhos. Vende roupa usada na sua residência situada no bairro Mahotas em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro deste ano com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 5.000MT para pagar em 6 meses.

loans.use: Strengthen business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth I. is 45 years of age, married with 5 children and comes from the rural area in Abule, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kerosene in retail to the nearby market and to the community at large. She has been in business since 2004. She is a member of the  LAPO Union Elizabeth seeks a the loan of US$ 550 to buy more kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene for sale

loans.name: Leontine

texts.en:
Leontine G. is a 48-year-old single mother. She has 3 children she has cared for alone for years. She lives with her children in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west coast of Cote d'Ivoire.

Leontine sells various personal care and cosmetic products in the Sassandra market. She works with her elder daughter who travels to our neighoring country Ghana to purchase the goods her mother sells.

Leontine uses the income from her sales to pay household and education expenses for her younger children. She will use this loan to purchase goods in bulk to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase goods in bulk for re-sale in the market

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
In 1998 Rose began selling gifts outside her home. Previously she had begun to sell lingerie, but once she saw that people bought other types of presents, she expanded her business to sell jewels and silver jewelry. Gradually, she has made her way in the world of commerce. The main idea for which Rose began this business is because she is a single mother with three children who she previously supported by cleaning houses. Since she wanted to make sure that her children could study, she started this business to cover those costs.

Rosa wants to further grow her business; this is why she is asking for a loan of $800, which she will be able to repay within 6 months. With this money Rosa will be able to buy a greater variety of products and will thus keep all of her customers. With your assistance, Rosa will help her children succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

En 1998 Rosa comenzó a vender regalos y detalles fuera de su casa. Posteriormente comenzó a vender otros productos de lencería, y poco después que vio que la gente comenzaba a buscar otro tipo de regalos, agregó a su negocio la venta de bisutería y joyería de plata. Poco a poco se ha ido abriendo camino en el mundo del comercio. La idea principal por la que Rosa comenzó este negocio es porque es madre soltera de tres hijos a quienes ella a mantenido limpiando casas. Sin embargo ella desea que sus hijos puedan estudiar es por eso que comenzó con el negocio para así poder pagarles los estudios a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Rosa desea crecer más su negocio es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $800 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Rosa podrá comprar más variedad en sus productos y así poder mantener cautivos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Fasat

texts.en: Fasat Akirinade, 29-years-old  has one child. She is from the Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in the business of selling building materials since 2003. She is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional building materials for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional building materials for resale

loans.name: Maria Lucia's Group

texts.es:
Leonor, Marcelina and Maria have belonged to the Obreras community bank for 8, 8 and 10 years respectively. At their community bank they have learned to save and be self-sufficient.

Leonor is married, 54 years old and has 4 children. Leonor sells trout in the Nery García market, her product is bought by wholesalers. In addition, Leonor runs a general store from her house.

Marcelina, on the other hand, is married, 61 years old and has 5 children, of which 1 still lives with her. Marcelina buys and sells typical breads of the region such as "chapla" (a flatbread) which she distributes to stores in the area. She also travels to the various markets where she sells bread and vegetables and buys grains.

Maria is married, 52 years old and has 2 children. Maria has a restaurant on one of the main streets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria, with her loan, will be able to better equip her restaurant.

Leonor, Marcelina and Maria need loans to purchase trout, rice, sugar, barley, wheat, corn, onion, bread, cooking pots, cutlery and kitchen utensils.

Leonor, Marcelina and Maria dream of having their own homes, starting other businesses and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor, Marcelina y Maria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 8, 8, 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y a valorarse a si mismas.

Leonor es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, Leonor vende truchas en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los compra de mayoristas. Además Leonor tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Marcelina es casada, tiene 61 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Marcelina compra y vende panes típicos como “chapla”, reparte por mayor a las tiendas. Además viaja a las ferias de la región donde vende panes, verduras y de las ferias trae cereales.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maria con el préstamo que obtendrá implementara más su restaurante.

Leonor, Marcelina y Maria necesitan préstamos que serán invertido en la compra de trucha, arroz, azúcar, cebada, trigo, maíz, cebolla, panes, ollas, cubiertos y utensilios de cocina.

Los sueños de Leonor, Marcelina y Maria son tener casa propia, implementar otro negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase trout, rice, sugar, wheat, corn, onion, bread, cooking pots and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Thi Thao

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thao is 38 years old. Her husband is a construction worker, and her three children are going to school and working. Mrs. Thao stays at home and raises pigs. Her average monthly income is about 100,000 to 200,000 VND (about 6USD-13USD). She wants to borrow 2,006,000 VND (which is equivalent to 125USD) to buy bran for her pigs. Mrs. Thao is very interested in participating in the program for long. Mrs. Chu Thi Luong is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 2,006,000 VND (which is equivalent to 125USD) to buy fertilizers and piglets. Mrs. N. Thi Nguyen is 28 years old. She wants to borrow 2,006,000 VND (which is equivalent to 125USD) to buy bran for her pigs and fertilizers. Mrs. N. Thi Hien is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 2,006,000 VND (which is equivalent to 125USD) to buy bran for her pigs. Mrs. N. Thi Ha is 22 years old. She wants to borrow 2,006,000 VND (which is equivalent to 125USD) to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Thảo (MS: 09050068) năm nay 38 tuổi, chồng làm thợ xây, có 3 con đang đi học và đi làm. Chị Thảo ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập trung bình của gia đình khoảng 100.000 ->200.000 VNĐ một tuần. Chị vay 2.006.000 VNĐ để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn. Chi rất muốn được tham gia lâu dài với trương trình. Chị Chu Thị Lương (MS: 09050069) năm nay 27 tuổi.Chị vay 2.006.000 VNĐ để mua phân bón lúa và thêm vốn mua lợn giống. Chị Ngô Thị Nguyên (MS: 09050070) năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VNĐ để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn và mua phân bón lúa. Chị Ngô Thị Hiền (MS: 06050071) năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VNĐ để mua cám cho lợn. Chị Ngô Thị Hà (MS: 09050072) năm nay 22 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VNĐ để thêm vốn mua lợn giống.

loans.use: Vay vốn để chăn nuôi và trồng rau.

loans.name: Wara

texts.en: Wara, 37 years old and married with four children, started her business of selling foodstuffs four years ago.  With a previous loan from SMT, she diversified her business and rented a stall in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  Wara now feels confident and empowered, with hope for a better future, and so would like to expand the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to accomplish her dream.

loans.use: To increase stock to generate more income.

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Mrs. Nhim S. is a subsistence farmer in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Moeurn, is a fisherman in the local village. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while one other assists Mr. Sokha Moeurn on the lake. The remaining one is a construction worker. Mr. Sokha Moeurn’s business now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase more fish nets to catch the fish. Thus, Mrs. Nhim S. needed to apply for a loan to buy fish nets and the rest of the money she would use to buy a new boat for her husband's business. Ten years ago, Mrs. Nhim S. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy pigs for breeding. Three years ago, Mrs. Nhim S. got a liver disease and she spent $500 to get cured. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and the rest of the money she would use to buy a new boat for her husband's business.

loans.name: Lam

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Tung Lam is 53 years old. She has 2 grown children who are employed, and 1 is married with family. Not as lucky as many other women, she is divorced and had to work very hard to raise her children. Presently, in addition to farming work, she does retail sale of gasoline to the general public after buying them from large gas companies. This business brings her an income of about 120USD a month. She joined TYM fund at the beginning of 2008, and wishes to borrow 300USD for additional investment to continue her gasoline sale business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Tùng Lâm năm nay 53 tuổi. Chị có 2 người con đã trưởng thành, có công việc làm ổn định trong đó 1 người đã xây dựng gia đình. Không gặp may mắn như những người phụ nữ khác hai vợ chồng chị đã ly hôn vì thế chị đã phải làm việc rất vất vả để nuôi các con khôn lớn. Hiện nay ngoài làm nông nghiệp, hàng ngày chị đi lấy xăng từ các cửa hàng xăng lớn về bán lẻ cho người dân. Công việc kinh doanh này cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2008 chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh xăng.USD

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P. lives in Angk Tapok Village in Kampong Spue, Cambodia. She is a farmer and Khmer noodle maker and makes little income. She now faces a problem on her plantation because her field is infertile. She has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer for the field and she would use the remainder of the loan to buy sticky-rice to make Khmer noodle.

Mrs. Sim P. is a 51-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the field and any remaining funds would be used to buy sticky-rice to make Khmer noodle.

loans.name: Guessin

texts.fr: Guessin R. est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de « tchoukoutou », une boisson locale qui consommée par la plupart de la population, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 7 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenu. Avec ce crédit, madame Guessin souhaite acheter des sacs de maïs et de mil pour la préparation de tchoukoutou. Ceci permettra de gagner plus d’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Guessin R. is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four. She is a retailer of "tchoukoutou", a local drink that most people consume in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has been in this work for over seven years, and it remains her main source of income. With this loan, Ms. Guessin wishes to buy sacks of corn and millet for making tchoukoutou. This will enable her to earn more money in order to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and millet

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en: Taliilagi M., 26, is married and has three children.  She has many years of experience in the food market business. She sells to the public five days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (about $229 USD).  SPBD loans are Taliilagi's only access to capital because she was cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, plastic cups, kool aid, seasonings, oil, and a big frying pan. She will use her earnings to improve her business and to help out with family expenses. Her husband is a taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her market

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Pedro M., tiene 41 años, esta casado con Elsa Franco de 37 años,  la pareja con  5 hijos menores tres de ellos en edad escolar.nViven en casa propia gracias a una herencia que recibió de su abuelo que hoy día es su vivienda y su local de trabajo.  nDesde muy joven trabajo en una carpintería  realizando trabajos   como empleado, viendo la necesidad y las ganas de salir adelante mas aun ya casado y con hijos  en el año 2002,  su abuelo decidió apoyarlo con un capital y así poder montar su propia carpintería.nCon su experiencia y buenos trabajos se pudo hacer muy rápido de una buena cantidad de clientes.n Hoy día gracias al ingreso de su negocio el puede solventar los gastos de la casa y el estudios de sus hijos y  elevar su nivel de vida.nLa solicitud de préstamo obedece a la necesidad de aumentar  el stock de maderas.  Y así brindar  una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro M., 41 years old, is married to Elsa Franco, 37 years old. The couple has five children, three school-aged. They live in their own house thanks to an inheritance received from his grandfather. Today the house is both his home and his workplace. Since he was very young he worked in carpentry working first as an employee. Seeing the need, wanting to get ahead and being married with children, in 2002 his grandfather decided to support and invest in him and that is how he built his own carpentry business. With his experience and hard work he was able to very quickly gain many customers. Today, thanks to the income from his business he is able to afford the household expenses, his children's studies and to improve their quality of life. The loan is needed to increase his lumber supply to provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his lumber supply

loans.name: Numonjon

texts.en: Numonjon B. is 24 years old. He is married and has a daughter. His wife keeps the house and takes care of their daughter. Numonjon and his wife are raising their daughter with love and trying to ensure that she has everything a kid may need. Numonjon has been running his business for about four years. He has a retail store, and he supports his family with this small business. He sells different kinds of TVs and DVD players at his store in the central local market. All the goods are supplied from the neighboring country China. Numonjon tries to have wide range of goods, thus meeting the requirements of his customers and satisfying the needs of clients with different levels of income. Numonjon has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006. His credit history makes him eligible to receive new and larger loans. In order to increase profits, Numonjon needs to increase the variety and number of goods that he offers. With this purpose, he requests 4000 Somoni ($1,200). He promises to repay the loan within six months. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Numonjon’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to increasing his stock

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Sophie B., célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bignona B. depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du poisson fumé, des balaies et du citron pour renforcer son petit commerce. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sophie B. is single and has two children to support. She's been a member of the Bignona B. village bank for 7 years. She wants to buy palm oil, dried fish, brooms, and lemons, in order to bolster her small business. The loan she's seeking will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil, dried fish, brooms and lemons

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en: Mrs. Nirmala M., 33 years old, lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district of Nepal. Thecho is one of the less developed areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs.M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and the younger son is studying in grade 5. Her husband's name is Tari Babu M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture-making shop 8 years ago. All the requirements of their family must be met with only the shop’s income. With her first loan from kiva her husband was able to purchase wood supplies for her small furniture shop. Now Mrs. M. is requesting a second loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy timber to be able to fill their orders for furniture. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture such as beds, tables, chairs, and wardrobes

loans.use: To buy timber supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo A. operates a passenger tricycle in their village at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela, an Agriculture Reformed Community (ARC) village. Reynaldo is 35 years old. His wife, Marites, is a simple housewife who takes care of their two children: Rema – 14 years old, who is in her second year of high school and Remark – 6 years old, who is in day care. Though operating a passenger tricycle is the only source of income, Reynaldo has able to support his family basic needs and education of his two children.

He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP6,000 to maintain his tricycle operation that travels from their village to the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. He plans to use his loan to buy new spare parts for the safety of his passengers. Reynaldo is a hard-working man. He prays that God will help him in achieving his dreams and provide a better life for their family.

loans.use: Buy spare parts

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Candida reside en villa reconciliación, tiene 37 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, películas de cd y productos de cosméticos, tiene siete años de estar administrando este negocio, inicio con dinero propio y ahorros, y luego con préstamos que Afodenic a otorgado esta es su quinta solicitud la cual va invertir en comprar materia prima como maíz, maseca, leña y gas butano para hacer sus ricas tortillas. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder crecer en inventario, captar clientes.
texts.en:
Candida lives in Villa Reconciliación and is 37 years old. Her business is selling tortillas, DVDs and cosmetic products. She has been running this business for seven years, starting with her own cash and savings and continuing with loans from Afodenic. This is her fifth loan, which she will invest in the purchase of raw materials such as corn, Maseca corn flour mix, firewood and butane gas to make her delicious tortillas. Her short-term plans are to increase her inventory and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, Maseca corn flour mix, firewood and butane gas

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua B. is 40 years old. She is a widow and mother of three children, one son and two daughters.

The last born is in primary school while the first two are out of school and learning trades. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.

Akosua is into trading. She sells ready-made textiles such as ladies’ dresses, fabrics, etc. She buys from Accra and treks to markets in nearby markets to sell. She also hawks, selling in her community. Akosua has been in this business for seven years.

She wants a loan to procure more goods in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin to cater to her children.

loans.use: Buy ready-made textiles.

loans.name: Iluminata

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35 years old Iluminata L. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 4 and 11 years old. Iluminata has been running a shop selling clothes since 2006. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee.

Iluminata currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to add her capital and buy clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to open another business. Iluminata thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To add her capital and buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es socio del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Alejandro es separado, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Alejandro realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con carro propio. Además Alejandro tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, su hija es quien se encarga de la atención.
Alejandro necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los sueños de Alejandro son comprar otro carro, mejorar su casa y tienda y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. He is 45 years of age, separated and has three children. Alejandro uses his own car to operate a taxi service in the city of Ayacucho. He also has a store in his house from which he sells mostly groceries. His daughter tends the store. Alejandro needs a loan of 2,600 Sols which will be used to buy rice, sugar and for maintenance on his car. He dreams of buying another car, fixing up his house and his store, and providing a good education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar, and for maintenance on his car.

loans.name: 1ª De Mayo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Primero D. Mayo" esta representado por la señora Maria Ester, es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado por 14 integrantes, algunas socias ya trabajaron con grupos solidarios con nuestra institución. Una mayoría D. la socias se dedica a la elaboración y distribución D. pan y masitas, otras D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y al servicio D. limpieza y portería. La competencia es dura en el mercado y los miembros del grupo saben que si quieren realizar sus ventas deben esforzarse para tener un buen producto terminado y  buena mercadería para competir en el mercado, es aquí donD. la Institución coadyuva brindándoles capital para poder competir con productos nuevos y variados. Las socias tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios y saben que para obtener un financiamiento deben tener responsabilidad y cumplir con los pagos a tiempo solo así podrán obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Primero D. Mayo" ("First of May") is represented by Maria Ester. It is a new group that is maD. up of 14 members, some of whom already had worked with lending groups with our institution. The majority of the borrowers bake and distribute bread and pastries. Other borrowers sell cosmetic products, clothes, and shoes, and others offer cleaning services or work as caretakers. Competition is tough in the market and the members of the group know that if they want to have good sales they have to work hard for a good finished product and good merchandise. It is in this area that the Institution collaborates with them, providing the capital so that they can compete with new and diverse products. The borrowers have experience working with lending groups and they know that they must be responsible and make their payments on time to obtain loans. Only this way can they increase their income and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita Y. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 36 years old. Enecita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector; she is involved in banana and barbecue stick production. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling banana and barbecue sticks per order. Enecita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Enecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to used to finance the business. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Enecita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the education of her children and to cover the needs of her family. About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Will be used to expand the business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 33 years old. She is single with one child. She owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body creams, detergent, hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her child's education. She would be grateful for the assistance. Rita belongs to the village bank named Maranatha.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en: Mirna is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been working as a tailor for the past 10 years. She has become known in the neighboring villages. After this long experience in the field, Mirna is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to buy tools to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is 56 years old and has six children, ranging in age from 39 to 25 years old. Three of them have their own families at present while three are still single and still live with Lilia, together with her husband Emelio. Emilio is a farmer while Lilia is an artist who weaves traditional sleeping mats made of "pandan" leaves called "banig" and traditional bags made of twigs and "abaka" (a kind of palm different from "pandan") fiber. This has been the kind of livelihood Lilia has worked at from 40 years ago up to the present. Her membership in ASHI in 2006 enabled her to support and grow her business as well as the needs of her family, including the needs of her grandchildren.

Lilia's children have learned the kind of business their mother generated her income from to support their needs since they were young. Now, they are helping their mother in the business and with Lilia's loan from ASHI, she can support the growth of her business and meet the demand of her customers. In the future, she wishes to reach the maximum amount of loan that ASHI can offer to really expand her business and generate employment within her community. For now, her loan will be used to purchase necessary materials for her business and produce a bigger volume of items than she could produce before, since her loan amount has increased.

loans.use: Buying "Pandan" (a kind of palm) leaves and other native materials to be used in her handicrafts

loans.name: Nadette

texts.en:
Nadette L. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Nadette is widowed and has one infant child. To make a living, Nadette owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing to local community members. Nadette has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nadette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadette is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Nadette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture are Mrs. Pel Y. with her child. Mrs. Pel Y., 26, lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, about 200 km from Phnom Penh along National Road No. 6.

Pel Y. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband works as a local carpenter making wooden beds for sale. This couple has given birth to one lovely kid who is still not in school.

Pel Y. finds that her husband's carpentry business is not a profitable one and she wants her husband to have another good job driving a trailer-taxi. Because she lacks the money, Pel Y. would like a loan of US$700 to buy a trailer motorbike for her husband to begin a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a trailer motorbike for her husband to begin a taxi service

loans.name: Rosa Elvia

texts.es:
Rosa es  otra socia del banco Comunal 3 de Mayo que se reúne cada quince días en la localidad de Picoaza una parroquia perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí. 

Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y entregada a su familia, ella piensa siempre en el bienestar de los suyos  por eso acude a la fundación para solicitar un crédito que aportaría mucho para mejorar el negocio que ya tienen establecido.

Rosa es casada con Hernán Arteaga desde hace  30 años tienen tres hijos de 18, 26 y 28 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa  por ahora lo hacen  en un carro en el cual  junto a su esposo recorren las calles del lugar donde viven, vendiendo ropa y otros artículos.

Su vivienda es propia y está situada en el centro  de la localidad para sobrellevar su negocio,  en esta viven ya  diez años. Rosa sueña con arreglar su casa  para ahí también tener su negocio de venta de ropa que ella misma confecciona ya que es modista desde hace 26 años.
 
Rosa nos manifiesta que es un negocio familiar donde todos participan, su esposo hace fletes  y  también le  ayuda mucho en la venta de ropa, el es su gran apoyo acota.

El crédito que reciba de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. para sus confecciones y para adquirir algo de bisutería para complementar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 3 de Mayo Communal Bank. They meet every 15 days in the Picoaza area, which is a parish belonging to the city of Portoviejo in the Manbí province. Rosa is a fighter and a hard-worker who is dedicated to her family. She always thinks of her family’s well being. That is why she comes to the foundation to ask for a loan, which will greatly contribute to her established business. Rosa has been married to Hernán Arteaga for 30 years. They have three children; ages 18, 26, and 28. She sells clothes. For now she sells in a car together with her husband . They travel the streets where they live selling clothes and other articles. Her house is her own, and it is situated in the center of the region in order to deal with her business. They have lived in this house for ten years. Rosa dreams of setting up her house to also have a business selling clothes there. She makes clothes herself, and she has been a dressmaker for 26 years. Rosa’s business is a family business where everyone participates. Her husband makes deliveries and also helps a lot selling clothes. He is a great help and a big advantage. She will use the loan that she receives to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons, etc. to make clothes and to get some jewelry to compliment the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons, etc. to make clothes and  jewelry to compliment the clothes

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Committed first and foremost to his family and business, Jahongir works hard at ranching. He has his own herd of cattle which he works day after day to earn a living to support his dear wife and little child. As every business requires investment, Jahongir needs to add some young bulls, that he hopes to raise and sell. He turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to buy the cattle and help improve his standard of living. Jahongir sincerely thank you for your generous heart.

---------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: "Doña Beatriz tiene 26 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Daniel, con el que tienen un hijo; dona Beatriz tiene como actividad la venta de chompas y blusas, el esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi con uno de los vehículos de su padre. Doña Beatriz realiza su venta en diferentes lugares o ferias de la ciudad;  en la zona 16 de julio los jueves y domingos donde tiene su puesto, luego en la ceja del alto, en Pocota, Batallas. El crédito solicitado es para ampliar su capital de trabajo, pues le conviene comprar al por mayor (docena) lo que le permite tener un mayor margen de utilidad."
texts.en:
Beatriz, 26, is married to Daniel, and they have a son. Beatriz sells sweaters and blouses. Her husband works as a taxi driver in one of his father’s cars. Beatriz sells in different places and in fairs in the city. She sells in the 16 de Julio zone, where she has her stand, on Thursdays and Sundays. Later she sells in La Ceja in El Alto, in Pocota, and in Batallas. The loan she is asking for is to increase her working capital so that she can buy wholesale (by the dozen), which will allow her to have a greater margin of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses by the dozen

loans.name: Risikatu

texts.en: Rasikatu is 36 years old, married and has two children. Her husband makes a living selling spare parts for motors. Rasikatu helps support her family, and put food on their table, by spending many hours each day selling wood to customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has applied for a loan for 70,000 NGN to buy more planks to sell, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more wooden planks to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie M. is 44 years old. She is married to Rosendo, who is a farmer. They live in the village of Cabaritan in San Manuel, Isabela. 

Rosalie has a manicure and pedicure business. To earn extra income, she also goes door-to-door selling vegetables and snacks in their village. Rosalie and her husband are blessed with three children, Rosanna, Richelle, and Ronald. They are all high school graduates.

Rosalie has been in business for five years. When she heard about the ASKI program, it gave her hope that her business would continue. Then she heard about Kiva and she decided request a loan from the lenders. She wants to borrow Php 6,000 to use as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: 75% of the Cambodian people make a living as farmers. One of these, Hul C. E., 38, is a hard working farmer living in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a good and determined mother who tries to feed her four children, who are all small kids. To earn a living, Hul C. E. either raises pigs or cultivates a rice crop. Her husband is a local fisherman and helps her breed pigs when he is not fishing. Hul C. E. will be using her first loan to buy farmland that will allow her to grow many kinds of crops.

loans.use: To buy farmland that will allow her to grow many kinds of crops

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco.  The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish).  Hilda is 53 years old and lives in Cusco with her daughter, aged 17 and her son, aged 26.  Her son in a nurse in Cusco and her daughter is finishing high school and looking to continue her studies in a university or an institute.  

Hilda’s business is buying and selling health and beauty products, which she has been doing for the past 5 years.  She generates orders through a catalogue she circulates and then fills the orders by buying inventory from a distributor.  She has several loyal customers and relies mostly on word of mouth to gain new clients.  Hilda has several new orders but can’t afford to buy the inventory to fill them at the moment, and therefore needs a loan.  She hopes to grow her business so that she can contribute to her daughter’s education.

Hilda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.
texts.en:
Hilda is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish). Hilda is 53 years old and lives in Cusco with her daughter, aged 17, and her son, aged 26. Her son is a nurse in Cusco and her daughter is finishing high school and looking to continue her studies in a university or an institute. Hilda’s business is buying and selling health and beauty products, which she has been doing for the past 5 years. She generates orders through a catalogue she circulates, and then fills the orders by buying inventory from a distributor. She has several loyal customers and relies mostly on word of mouth to gain new clients. Hilda has several new orders but can’t afford to buy the inventory to fill them at the moment, and therefore needs a loan. She hopes to grow her business so that she can contribute to her daughter’s education. Hilda appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to fill several back-orders

loans.name: Luis Ivan

texts.es:
Luis es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Luis es soltero, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, Luis junto a su mama tienen un molino en su casa en donde procesan cereales, productos que comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad.
Luis necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Luis son terminar sus estudios de Administración de Empresas y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). He is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Luis and his mother operate a mill out of their home where they process grain and then sell their goods at the city markets.

Luis is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to purchase wheat and barley. He dreams of finishing his studies in business administration and improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Suhbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two month old infant in a house in Arhangai province in central Mongolia.  His wife is a dressmaker and she sews a variety of traditional clothes and shoes. 

Suhbaatar operates a taxi service. He started his business in 2007 and since then has doubled his orking capital. He uses his own car to transport people around his local area.

He says, “In order to make and sell shoes during the national holiday, “Tsagaan Sar,” we would like to purchase more fabric with a loan.”  He is requesting a 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan.  Suhbaatar is planning to expand both his and his wife's businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase materials and fabrics.

loans.name: Roberto Francisco

texts.es: El señor Roberto Francisco González es trabajador de Uponic labora como conductor con tres hijos a su cargo , lleva dos crédito trabajados en dos años, el primer crédito lo utilizo para compra de materiales , como bloque , cemento mano de obra ya que son prestamos pequeños para construir  se necesita  mas dinero.
texts.en:
Mr. Robert works for Uponic. He works as a driver. He is responsible for three children. He has had two loans in the past two years. The first loan he used to buy construction materials such as cement block and cement. These are small construction loans. He needs more money.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y tres de sus seis hijos en el centro poblado menor Motupillo, del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace más de 30 años, el tiempo que lleva viviendo en la zona, usualmente siembra caña, maíz y yuca. Actualmente ha instalado hace 25 dias una hectárea de maíz en un terreno de cultivo cercano al lugar en donde vive. 

Este negocio no es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta, ya que es consciente de que los ingresos que percibe por agricultura son temporales, por ello también se gana la vida en dos actividades ligadas a la agricultura: la apicultura y la crianza y venta de cuyes (mamiferos comestibles, oriundos de la región), posee algunas colmenas en su terreno de cultivo y cría sus animales en su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive.

Tomás desea sembrar una hectárea adicional de maíz, además de brindarle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo que ya tiene para asegurarse una buena producción. Por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Tomás sueña con brindarle a su esposa y a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. El ya es un cliente antigüo de Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas. En la imagen aparace junto a las jaulas donde cría sus cuyes.
texts.en:
Tomás is a father of a family, he is 62 years old and lives together with his wife and three of his six children in the center of a small town called Motupillo, in the district of Pítipo, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture for more than thirty years, all fo which he has lived int he area, usually growing sugar cane, corn and yuca. Nowadays, twenty five days ago, he installed a hectare of corn in a plot of land close to where he lives. This business is not the only source of income on which he relies, he is conscious that the income that he receives from agriculture is seasonal, which is why he also makes a living in two activities outside of agriculture: beekeeping and the growing and sales of a type of guinea pigs, cuyes (edible mammals, native to the region). He possess some beehives on his plot of land, and cares for his animals in order to sell them to businessmen who usual visit the area where he lives. Tomás wants to grow an additional hectare of corn, and furthermore to provide a good mantience of the crop that he already has in order to assure a good production. For this reason he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa, an affiliate of Kiva, for a loan of 1500 Soles to help him achieve his objective. Tomás dreams to provide his wife and his children a better quality of life. He is an old client of Nuestra Institución and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client the moment he takes on his loans. In the photo he is shown by the cages where he grows his guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of growing and maintaining a crop of corn.

loans.name: Blossom

texts.en: Blossom is a 32 year old woman who is married with 3 children. Her husband is a fashion designer. Blossom renders laundry services to her customers. She started this business a year ago. Her major challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome that challenge. She hopes to own a classic laundry company in the future. Blossom hopes for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more laundry equipment to boost her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more laundry equipment to boost her business.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Miriya sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux, dans le village de Sido, préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de boissons sucreries. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, 300 casiers de boisson sucrerie auprès de l’usine de production de boisson non alcoolisée  à Bamako. Toutes les boissons sont revendues en détail, au comptant ou à crédit dans le village de Sido à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera réutilisé dans leur activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Miriya are married and average 35 years of age and six children each.  And they live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands in the village of Sido, Prefecture of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through business.  Meaning to buy more goods, these women decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to do commerce in soft drinks.  They are now on their sixth group loan.  The previous loans were all properly repaid.   With this new loan, they intend to buy 300 cases of soft drinks from the production factory for non-alcoholic beverages in Bamako. All the drinks are sold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the village of Sido.  The customer base is composed of men and women.  With this loan, the women hope to obtain a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA.  A portion of the profits will be reused in their work, and the other will go toward their children's education costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying non-alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Cau's Group

texts.en:
Cau T. N. is 54 years old. She lives in the village of N. Xa, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has three children, and they all have jobs. Cau grows rice and breeds pigs and cows. She has been in this line of work for many years, and she earns a total monthly income of about 2,300,000 VND. She is the leader of a five–member group loan. She has been with SEDA for two years and always repays her loans on time. In this credit cycle, she is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes her investment will turn a profit so that her family will be able to afford more household appliances.

About the other members in the group:

  • Mai T. N. is 34 years old, and she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.
  • Gam T. P. is 28 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture.
  • Huy T. N. is 20 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to expand her business.
  • Mien T. N. is 36 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy scrap iron to resell.

loans.use: To buy more .

loans.name: Kanie

texts.fr: Madame Kanie N. est une femme âgée mais dynamique de 73 ans. Elle s’active et forme les jeunes filles de la maison à la restauration en sevrant du petit déjeuner et diner aux gens de son quartier. Elle habite à Ngaparou dans la localité de Yoff. Elle a 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 35 et 50 ans. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2004. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans la restauration. Madame N.  projette  à avoir une activité secondaire qui consiste à louer des chaises. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs destine a compléter les frais d’acquisition des chaises. Ses revenus lui permettent de mieux soutenir  ses enfants et ses petits enfants qui sont dans le besoin. Elle compte agrandir son restaurant son restaurant et accroitre ses gains financiers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kanie N. is a dynamic 73-year-old woman. She actively coaches young girls in the household to the restaurant business by serving breakfast and dinner to customers from her neighbourhood. She lives in the Ngaparou area of Yoff. She has seven children whose ages vary from 35 to 50 years old. She has been a member of the Yoff branch of UIMCEC since January 2004. Mrs. N. has over 20 years’ experience in the restaurant business. She would like to start a side business renting chairs. For this she is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs to finalise the acquisition of chairs. Her earnings enable her to provide support to those of her children and grand-children in need. She wishes to expand her restaurant and increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old, is married to Teofilo, and they have a 5-year-old child.

Agnes owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years already.

In 2008, Agnes joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Agnes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Antonia; Nuestra socia es  casada y ella tienen 52 años de edad, Nuestra socia es natural de Angostura, ella alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, La socia es muy buena cocinera, por lo que debido a su buena sazón tiene desde hace 12 años el negocio de venta de comida, Nuestra socia aprovecha el trabajo de su conyugue que es albañil de profesión y este a su vez recibe a diario o mientras están en obras la visita de su esposa a la hora de la comida con su taper  y junto a él sus compañeros de trabajo, ella vende comida a los compañeros de la obra y así se gana la vida. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y todos los ingredientes del mes para seguir cocinando rico, parte de esto la socia solicita para comprar algunos víveres y cosas para su hogar.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “VIRGEN PURIFICADA – ANGOSTURA communal bank; she lives in Angostura district, Saylla province, Cusco department. Antonia, 52, is married; she’s from Angostura and she is a retail merchant. She’s a good cook and, thanks to her tasty preparations, she has had a food sales business for the past 12 years. She benefits from her husband’s job as a bricklayer and he receives from her every day at his work site a Tupperware with lunch for himself and his coworkers. She sells lunch to his coworkers and this is how she earns a living. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients for the month to continue cooking her delicious meals. Part of the loan will be used to buy some groceries and things for the home. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan because it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She also pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and part for home improvements.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es casada, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Sonia vende gorros, sombreros de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días durante la mañana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras.
Los sueños de Sonia son tener un puesto donde venda sus productos, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y construir su casa de material noble porque el que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Sonia is married, she has four children that are in school. Sonia sells a variety of hats on foot in the central market of Ayacucho, an activity that she does every day during the morning. She acquires her products in Lima. Sonia belongs to the communal bank of Santa Rita and is soliciting a loan of 800 Soles that will be invested in the purchase of hats. Sonia's dreams are to have a place to sell her products, for her children to complete their studies and to build a house of good materials because her house is rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hats

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo V. is from the village of Mangcuram. He is 56 years old. Edgardo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over 29 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippinep pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Edgardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Edgardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Aujelia

texts.en:
Aujelia S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Aujelia is 31 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ndiankou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiankou N. est un jeune yoffois de 32 ans qui habite à Yoff  Ndenatte. Il est célibataire sans enfant. 
Monsieur N. est un plongeur sous marin depuis 2002.Il a choisi cette activité par passion mais aussi   pour  gagner sa vie.
Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis septembre 2009.Il dispose d’une petite pirogue  pour son activité. Le prêt de 250 000 frs qu’il sollicite est destiné à compléter son épargne en vue de se payer un moteur a bord. Par conséquent ce financement pourra participer a rendre son activité plus rentable et productive.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiankou N. is a 32 year old man from Yoff who lives in Ndenatte. He is unwed and without children. Mr N. has been underwater diver since 2002. He picked this profession for love as well as to earn a living. He has been a member of the Bank of Yoff since 2009. He utilizes a dugout canoe for his work. The requested loan for 250 000 frs is intended for the completion of his canoe by purchasing an engine. Therefore, this investment could make his business more profitable and productive.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of an engine

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo Ramón S. R. es un hombre de 65 años cuyo oficio aprendió desde su adolescencia y en más de 47 años de la realización del mismo sigue sintiéndose con fuerzas para “echarle ganar aún más tiempo”. Él es agricultor, además se dedica a la compra-venta de leña y siembras. En su labor diaria recibe ayuda de sus hijos y sus nietos, pero siente la pena de la enfermedad de su conyugue, quien por su avanzada edad no puede ayudarle como en los años de su juventud.
texts.en:
Gerardo Ramón S. R. is a 65 year old man who learned his craft as an adolescent and after 47 years of working still feels strong enough to “hang in there a bit longer.” He is a farmer and also buys and sells firewood and his crops. His children and grandchildren help him in his daily tasks. But he is sad about his spouse’s illness who, because of advanced age, can’t help him like in his younger years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bendetta Mbevo

texts.en:
Benedetta N. is a 40 year-old married lady and the mother of three children — 27, 22 and 17. She is a greengrocer who sells vegetables and fruit. She has been in this business for five years and takes home a monthly income of 8,400 Ksh. She also gets additional income from her husband who is a farmer.

Bendetta is a new KADET client, applying for her first loan which she plans to use to add more fruit and green vegetables. The profits received from this boost will be banked as savings for the family. Bendetta is very hardworking and she hopes to increase the capacity of the business and move it to wholesale level.

loans.use: buying more stock of green vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 29 years old, married, and has a four-year-old child.  For eight years, she has been running Rocky Hair salon.  She opened the salon after closing her barber shop.  She also runs a butcher shop.  She is glad that Faulu Kenya has helped her to start her beauty salon, which is now running well.  She hopes to improve her salon business and move the business to the city center.  She has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy beauty products, a steamer, and a flat iron.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, a steamer, and a flat iron

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say K. is a 55-year-old pot seller in Kompong Chhnang Province. She sells her products in the village by using her motorcycle with her husband. She was blessed with seven children, all of whom are single. Two of her children are employed in different careers in Phnom Penh City. Her husband also helps her in the same business. This couple usually generates revenue of US$6 each day and they have been in their business for five years. She uses his cars horse as transportation and it takes a week to sell all her items. Say K. facing difficulties transporting her items because her horse cart is slow and small and it cannot contain in large amount of her products. Therefore, Say K. would like to borrow a loan to buy a trailer to attach to her existing motorcycle to transport her items.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to her existing motorcycle to transport her items.  .

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 49-year-old lady, married to a builder with seven children. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in her own permanent house with a family of nine and her dream is to have a good family. Margret has been operating a retail shop for two years now and it has been steadily progressing. She says that she started with farming. This is how she got capital to start the retail shop. However, she has the challenge of insufficient funds. But this has not stopped her from seeing herself move to a wholesale shop. Margret needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transport business as she strives to achieve her business dream of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena S. is from the village of Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Lucena is the leader of a group loan. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Lucena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from thier rice field. Lucena has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Lucena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 140000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and fertilizer for their farm. This will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain the health of her crops

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Cresilda G. is from the Barangay of Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and blessed with 3 children  who are either still at their school and infant age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a bakery shop. She’s been engaged in this kind of retailing business for 2 years already. This time she is earning an amount of not less than Php5,000.00 from sales of this business. 

In the year 2009, Cresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresilda, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of Php20,000.00 as her 1st loan which will be used as additional capital for her bakery shop business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.
	
 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her bakery business

location.town: Tangub-Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Hin P., age 36, has three children, all of whom are still young. She was married for a year, but divorced her husband. Presently, Hin P. works as a sewing laborer in the garment industry and receives a formal salary to feed her children. In order to find more profit, Hin P. would like to borrow some fund from Kiva to share with her coworker for opening new business by selling cloth for both men and women in front of the garment factory. This is the reason that Hin P. is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To share with coworker for puchasing clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene S. is from the village of Tabon. She is 40 years old. Ma. Arlene is a group member of PMPC. She is married and has three children two of whom are students and the other one is younger. To make a living, Ma. Arlene operates a business selling fish with the fish being caught by her husband who is a fisherman. Ma. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Ma. Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to provide additional capital to buy more fish to sell. This will be the second loan that Ma. Arlene has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 51 años D. edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco departamento del Cusco, Perú. Lidia se dedica a la venta D. bocaditos especiales llamados “Churros”, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria en sus productos en carretas acondicionadas para este negocio, ella trabaja con cinco empleados quienes atienden cada uno D. las cinco carretas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lidia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, miel y muchas cosas más.   

Lidia pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas D. María” D. la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año D. funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Lidia is 51 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Lidia sells special snacks called 'churros'.  She sells her products as an itinerant street vendor from small carts which are adapted for this business.  She works with five employees who serve from the five carts she has.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to her hard work.

Lidia needs this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, honey and many other products.

Lidia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Hijas D. María” (Daughters of María) community bank in Cusco, Peru.  The community bank is in its third year and is working very well for all its members.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El  señor Genaro, es comunicador y también trabaja como chofer; el crédito lo requiere para continuar los estudios universitarios como comunicador social.

Genaro es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la primera que es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro, is in communication and also works as a chauffer.  He needs a loan to continue his studies in the university in social communication. 

Genaro is single and has no children.  He lives in the house of his parents, which is located in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. This is the second loan that he has requested from IMPRO and the first channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to continue his studies for a degree in the science of communication

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Ofelia del Socorro C. L. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de Mariscos  ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto ella vende de casa en casa y sus mismos clientes le recomiendan  clientes nuevos  tiene siete años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, es Acompañada actualmente  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  ocho créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Mariscos como pescados, langostas etc  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Ofelia del Socorro C. Lopez works for herself and she has business selling seafood.  She has clients to whom she sells her products and she sells from door to door. Those same clients recommend new clients. She has seven years in the business. She is married and she has one school-aged son. She has had eight past loans through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has been used to purchase seafood such as fish, lobster, etc. and this is how she invests and improves her business. The loans she has had through Ceprodel have helped her a great deal because this is how she has been improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seafood, such as fish, lobsters, etc.

loans.name: Elmo

texts.en:
Elmo P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old and single. To make a living, Elmo plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elmo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Elmo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his 3rd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Mpa-Atabulira Kizinga Group-Jinja

texts.en: 47-year-old K. Robinah has been in the motorcycle transportation business for close to three years now. Most of the motorcycle riders she has hired operate from Kizinga, Mpa-atabulira in Jinja. This mother of eleven is testament to the fact that females can also play first fiddle in a male dominated business genre. Before she set forth in this business, she was engaged in an agro sales business. She dispensed with it later and used her savings to buy a motorcycle. At present she also has a pig husbandry business. She says her weekly profits are about $42. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther esta agradecida con su cooperación en los dos anteriores crédito los cuales han sido para invertir en su negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía ya que desea vender, verduras, frutas, productos de lactaos, queso, leche, crema  y también carnes frías. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea para su negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que su esposo el señor José Fidel se encargara de los gastos de la casa y de sus dos hijo que tiene con el ingreso de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Esther is thankful for your participation in her two past loans that she has invested in her business.

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise that she will sell, including vegetables, fruits, dairy products, cheese, milk, cream, and cold cuts.  At this time, she doesn't have the necessary money for the investment she wants to make in her business. 

She plans to pay back the loan with the income she earns from her business, since her husband José Fidel pays the expenses for the household and their children with the income from his job.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vicheka

texts.en:
Mrs. Vicheka K. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Pon, live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have one daughter. 

Vicheka and her husband are weavers. They sell their finished products to a middleman in the village who then in turns to sell in Phnom Penh. In addition the couple also raises pigs at home. 

Vicheka hopes to expand her business raising pigs, so she is applying for a loan of $1,000 US to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Enkhbazar

texts.en:
Mr.Enkhbazar, a 27-year-old single man, lives with his mother and younger brother in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. His mother lives on a disability allowance and his brother attends a secondary school. Enkhbazar rents a stall inside the shopping center and sells mobile phone equipment including phones, phone covers, batteries, accessories and some spare parts. His business is the only source of income for the family.

He is planning to expand his enterprise and so is requesting this loan to buy mp3, mp4, and Flash players, earphones, and a variety of mobile car accessories to sell.
