loans.use: to buy mp3, mp4 and Flash players, earphones, and various mobile car accessories to sell.

loans.name: Wambui

texts.en:
Wambui is 34 years old and married to Patrick, who contributes to the family income. She has two children who are 13 and 12 years old. She runs a retail shop that she has operated for about five years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is her second loan with KADET. She repaid the previous one successfully. 

She wants the loan to pay school fees for her children as she has not been able to make enough from her retail business. She hopes to give her children quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Farida

texts.fr: Agée de 27ans, Farida est revendeuse de d’habits, de perles et des accessoires pour dames. Il ya de cela 01an qu’elle a démarré cette activité et sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des habits afin de renforcer son activité et assurer sa future vie maritale. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique.
texts.en: At the age of 27, Farida retails women's clothing, pearls and accessories. She started this activity one year ago, and is requesting this first loan to purchase clothing, with the objective of increasing her activity and supporting her future married life. She gets her supplies at Lomé Grand Market and retails in her shop.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolás es productor lechero y también se realiza trabajos de albañil. El crédito lo requiere para comprar un terreno que lo utilizara para sembrar el forraje para alimentar a sus vacas lecheras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de  La Paz; es casado  y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is a milk producer and also, works as a brick mason.  He lives in his own house, located in Achacachi, in the department of La Paz.  He is married and has 3 children.

The loan he requests is for buying farm land that he needs for sowing forage crops to feed his milk cows.

loans.use: buy farm land to sow forage crops to feed his milk cows.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 52 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops on their land. According to Nicanora, they can earn as much as 9000 PHP per month, but this income is not stable due to weather conditions.

Nicanora has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes for their harvest to increase.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anselma Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Anselma cuenta con una Despensa en casa propia, cuenta con clientela formada, se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años, es casada, tiene varios hijos, todos mayores de edad, independientes, vive con su marido, el cuenta con un camión el cual lo hace trabajar como taxi carga.
Ella es muy conocida en el barrio por su buena atención en el negocio. Sueña con tener un supermercado donde pueda tener ya todo tipo de productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, arroz, fideos, lácteos y demás para el abastecimiento del negocio. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito, este le sera de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Anselma runs a grocery store from her home and has steady customers.  She’s been doing this for four years.  She’s married and has several adult children on their own.  She lives with her husband and he has a truck which he uses as a delivery taxi.

She is very well known in the neighborhood, for the great attention she gives to her business and dreams of having a supermarket when she can have all sorts of products to offer her customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy food, drinks, rice, noodles, and milk products, among other things to stock her business.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunities it has given her.  This loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, (62 años) es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive en casa propia junto a su último hijo quien ya es mayor y su esposo. Ella trabaja duro porque desea tener una mejor calidad de vida. Mercedes es dueña de una bodega que esta ubicada en su casa, donde también vende bebidas heladas. Ella tiene muchos clientes ya que en la cuadra donde vive no hay más bodegas además ella procura que sus clientes se vayan contentos después de hacer sus compras y vuelvan muy a menudo. Lleva ya en este negocio 24 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo quienes generan ingresos adicionales con los diferentes trabajos que realizan. Le agrada su trabajo por que esta en contacto con la gente y así no esta sola cuando su esposo e hijo salen a trabajar, además su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos. Este es el préstamo séptimo que le otorga la entidad MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los 3000 soles solicitados, comprará más bebidas e implementara aun más el almacén de su bodega.
texts.en: Mercedes is 62 years old and she is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives in a house of her own together with her youngest son, who is of age, and her husband. She works hard to have a better quality of life. Mercedes is the owner of a grocery store installed in her house. She also sells cold drinks. She has many clients because in the block where she lives there are no other convenience stores and she also makes sure that her clients leave happy with their purchases and to make them return very often. She has been in business for 24 years and she gets help from her husband and her son. They generate additional incomes from the different businesses they carry out. She enjoys her work for the contact she has with the people and therefore she is not alone when her husband and son go out to work. Her business also generates a good profit. This is the seventh loan granted to her by MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to have received it. She expects to make all of her payments on time. She is very well liked within her communal bank for the humor she brings to the group. With the 3000 nuevos soles she requested she will purchase more drinks and she will stock her inventory for the grocery store.

loans.use: purchase more drinks and she will stock her inventory for the grocery store.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELO AZUL.” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de ropa, producción en comida, producción en textiles y servicio de cafe.

La señora Rosmery, indica que hace seis meses que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de café, que viene trabajando hace años atrás, implementando este negocio con el apoyo de su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de azúcar y café) y arreglo de su kiosco, que comprara de la Av. Buenos Aires y lo comercializará en la Av. Chacaltaya. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, salud y la Asociación comunal.
texts.en:
The group "CIELO AZUL.” will begin a new cycle to benefit its women members.  This group has 6 members and is led by a head of council, Rosmery. The members' business sectors are diverse and include sales, production and services.  Rosmery has led "Pro Mujer" for the past 6 months, having been invited by friends to participate.  She runs a small café, a business that she has built up over several years assisted by her mother.
She seeks this credit to grow their base of capital (used to buy sugar and coffee) as well as to set up an improved kiosk for sales, that she will purchase on Avenue Buenos Aires and sell on Ave. Chacaltaya.  Her business allows her to support her family, as she is single and has 5 children.  She most enjoys "Pro Mujer" for its training, health and other programs offered.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee and set up a sales kiosk

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa, 27, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. Channa sells fish, earning $8 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 US on food and $20 US on other expenses. Channa is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase fermented fish stock to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase fermented fish stock to resell.

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 30 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Salcedo que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Latacunga en el centro de Ecuador. Nancy se considera una persona responsable y respetuosa.

Trabaja con su familia cultivando su terreno, es el cuarto crédito que le solicita a Fodemi este último será utilizado para la compra de semillas de fréjol para sembrar y después de su cocecha poder vender.

Su sueño es poder entrar al negocio de la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Salcedo which is 20 minutes from Latacunga in the centre of Ecuador. Nancy considers herself to be a responsible and respectful person.

She works with her family cultivating their land. This is the 4th loan that she requests from FODEMI and it will be used to buy bean seeds for sowing and selling after the harvest.

Her dream is to be able to start a livestock raising business.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old single man. He has been working as a blacksmith since 1995.

Ahmad is a hardworking man with good reputation. Most of his clients like dealing with him because of the honest verbal agreements he makes. He is highly recommended by most of his clients, who are from his village. His business is highly requested in his region.

Ahmad is professional in his business, this is his first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He has to buy buy necessary tools for his business.

Ahmad is working hard to improve his business through updating his machinery to do the requested work in a very short time with the best quality. Ahmad hopes to have a small family in the future. To ensure his family's good social and financial situation, he works hard for his business continuity.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos,ella se dedica a vender mariscos (conchas, curiles, camarones),el oficio lo inicio hace varios años, todos los días venD. no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería (conchas, punches, curiles, camarones, pescado) para mejorar en las ventas y tener  variedad y aumentar en clientela.
El propósito D. María es que sus ingresos aumenten, tener más clientes y satisfacer las espectativas D. ellos.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and two children.  She sells shellfish ( oysters, clams, shrimp) and started the business years ago and she sells everyday with no established hours.

She will utilize the loan to purchase more merchandise ( oysters, crab, clams, shrimp, fish) in order to improve sales and have more variety and more customers.
Maria's goal is to increase her sales, have more customers, and to satisfy people's expectations of the business.

loans.use:
Compra de pescado, camarones, conchas.
To purchase fish, shrimp, shellfish

loans.name: David Oswaldo

texts.es:
David Oswaldo  tiene treintaiun años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá sembrar y cosechar  para tener utilidades ya que con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. Con el dinero  pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos.

El sueño es seguir trabajando junto a la familia para lograr prosperar  en la familia y en el negocio.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
David Oswaldo is 31 years old and married without children. He lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN is located in the area of Guamayacu, which belongs to the canton of Echeandía. This settlement grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and green pigeon peas.

David works growing corn, rice and green pigeon peas, the buying and selling of which take place in Echeandia.

The loan will be very helpful because he could plant and harvest for income. The previous loan helped him to get ahead and he had no problem making timely payments to the communal bank. With this loan he could buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to maintain the crops in good condition.

His family relationship has improved because now he can contribute a little more to the well being of his family. His work is going along better because he has expanded the production and increased his earnings because now with the sale of his crops he is making more profit. 

His dream is to continue working together with his family in order for his family and his business to prosper. 

He is very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant and harvest for profit

loans.name: Patricia Elena

texts.es:
El deseo de salir adelante y de contribuir en su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos, hcieron que Patricia Elena aprendiera el oficio de la confección viendo realizarlo a otras personas, desde entonces viene realizando algunas prenda, así como decoraciones navideñas. 

Esta emprendedora de 33 años de edad, necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y adornos para algunas decoraciones que realizará pues se aproxima la temporada navideña. Así podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes diferentes alternativas e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The wish to get ahead and contribute to her home composed of her husband and three children caused Patricia Elena to learn dressmaking with the aim of doing it for others.  Since then, she’s been making clothes as well as Christmas decorations.

This enterprising 33-year-old needs a loan to buy fabric, thread and decorative items to make some Christmas decorations for the approaching season to offer her customers different choices and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and docorative items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de molinera,el muele granos de trigo,cebada y maiz y lo convierte en harinas y lo reparte en las diferente tiendas de abarrotes,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de molinera. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is 47 years old and married with three children.  He continues working in his milling business.  He grinds wheat, barley, and corn grain, and converts it into flour to distribute in various grocery stores.  He works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  By means of this job he gets his children ahead.

The member wants to expand his milling business.  He is requesting the loan to buy corn, barley, and corn wholesale.
                                                
He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba est un homme marié de 50 ans qui vit  au Sénégal. Il exerce la profession d’agent de sécurité municipal. Il est en meme temps maçon et commerçant. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité de commerce. Il est issu d’une famille d’éleveur et a toujours pratiqué l’élevage. Sa finalité a toujours été de gagner des revenus légalement. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2003. Il a déjà remboursé 4 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 prévu pour l’achat de moutons à revendre. Son dernier crédit lui a permis de payer le permis de conduire de son fils.
texts.en: Mr. Demba is a 50-year old married man living in Senegal. He works as a municipal security officer. At the same time, he is also a stonemason and an entrepreneur. He has over 15 years of experience in his enterprise. He comes from a family of animal farmers and has always raised animals. His goal has always been to obtain a legal way of earning revenues. He has a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since June 2003. He has already repaid four prior loans. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 [West African franks] to buy sheep for resale. His latest loan has allowed him to pay for his son’s driver’s license.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris

Puntarenas 
500000

	Damaris tiene 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y 3 hijos en la zona de Fray Casiano, Puntarenas, es un barrio pobre  y como muchas limitaciones. La clienta  se presenta como una persona con muchos deseos de superarse, se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades y artesanías desde hace 10 años. Ella está  en constante capacitación para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de mayor calidad. Además de adornos elaborar bolsos,  ropa para artículos electrodomésticos y para el baño y productos para fiestas de cumpleaños y otras actividades como primera comunión y bautizos manejando productos de calidad, es ampliamente conocida en la zona por dedicarse a este trabajo, por lo que no le falta clientela durante el año.

	Inició comprando una pequeña cantidad de material con ayuda de su esposo hace 10 años, empezó a capacitarse y mejorar las técnicas y por ende diversificar su producción, aumentando su clientela y mejorando sus ingresos, el objetivo de este préstamo es comprar materia prima y reparar una máquina para ofrecer una mejor calidad en el producto confeccionado.

	 Ella se dedica a su trabajo durante la mayor parte del día, su hija mayor está en la Universidad y los menores de edad se encuentran estudiando, por lo que su primer labor del día es prepararles la comida para que vayan al colegio y escuela, debido a la gran cantidad de encargos trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que realiza el trabajo de forma manual, pero una vez reparada la máquina este se agilizará incrementando así su producción y el tiempo que comparte con su familia.

	La limitante principal ha sido la falta de dinero, pero esta oportunidad de crédito le va a permitir contar con capital para comprar materia prima y poder así incrementar su producción, y cumplir así el sueño de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Damaris is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Fray Casiano, Puntarenas zone, a poor neighborhood with many limitations.  She’s been doing arts and crafts for 10 years and presents herself as being someone with a great desire to succeed.  She constantly trains to offer her clients high quality products.  She embroiders purses, appliance covers, bath items, and quality decorations for birthday parties and other events, such as first communions and baptisms.  She’s widely known within the zone, for being dedicated to this work and she is not short of customers throughout the year.

She began by buying a small quantity of materials with her husband’s help.  She started training herself and improving her techniques and ended up diversifying her production, increasing her number of customers, and increasing her income.  The objective of this loan is to buy supplies and repair a sewing machine to be able to offer better quality products.

She works throughout most of the day.  Her oldest daughter studies at university and her younger children attend school.  Her day begins with her preparing their lunches for school.  Because of the large number of orders, she works late into the night.  She has to work by hand, but once the sewing machine is fixed, she will be able to speed up and increase her production, and have more time to spend with her family.

The main limiting factor has been lack of money, but this opportunity for a loan will allow her to have the capital she needs to buy supplies, increase her production, and make her dream of fixing up her house come true.

loans.use: to buy art supplies.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Marichu has a shop that makes and sells milk candies (or yema), and she is using a motorcycle for the delivery of the snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Marichu has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is thirty-four years of age and is married with three children.

Anita owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Anita needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional goods to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Anita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Anita's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Teresa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Boffel Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité faisant partie du Banc Villageois Boffel existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009 date de son inauguration. Il est constitué de vingt trois femmes qui habitent le même village et leurs activités principales sont l'agriculture, l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Madame Sénéba la responsable est âgée de 52 ans, c'est une femme divorcée mère de neuf enfants dont une fille .Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de savon, de fruits et légumes et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu imprimé et a levé la main droite.

Elle achète le savon, les fruits et légumes aux marchés hebdomadaires de Gouye Mbeuth et Thiamène;elle revend dans le village.


Avec son prêt elle envisage acheter 4 moutons pour embouche ovine et compte les vendre d'ici l'année prochaine pour espérer beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices elle a les charges de la famille (nourriture,santé, habillement); renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" Boffel and exists since December 30, 2009 when it was created. It consists of 23 women who live in the same village and their main businesses are agriculture, breeding and shopkeeping.

Sénéba is responsible for the group and is 52 years old. This is a divorced woman and mother to 9 children of whom 1 is a girl. She is active in shopkeeping selling soap, fruits and vegetables, and also fattens sheep. In the photo, she is standing to the right dressed in patterned blue and has raised her right hand.

She buys soap, fruits and vegetables at the weekly markets of Gouye Mbeuth and Thiamène; she resells in her village.

With her loan she envisions buying 4 sheep for ovine fattening and plans to sells them by next year and hopes to bring in a lot of income.

With her profits she has the responsibilities of the family (food, health, clothing) and strengthens her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Soxaly Askane Nasru Group

texts.fr: SOXALY ASKANE NASRU est un groupement féminin qui regroupe 05 femmes habitant le meme quartier et à quelque mètres du Guichet. La présidente Meleyée est divorsée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle évolue dans le commerce de l'alimentation depuils plus de 14 ans.Meleyée commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle demande un pret de 175.000F pour renforcer son activité et diversifier son stock de marchandise. Madame Meleyée est reconnue dans la photo par sa main levée. Elle gère les charges quotidiennes de sa petite famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir elle souhaite  agrandir son commerce et créer sa propre entreprise

loans.use: Diversifier son stock de marchandises

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 33 year old lady who is married and has three children who are aged 2, 4, and 8. 

She started her restaurant business in 2007 and has been running it since then. It is sometimes rather challenging due to increased competition. Right now she would like to get a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy a little more furniture for the place. She would love to see her working capital increase to a level where she can be self sustainable.

In the photograph are Resty and the loan officer(left to right). In the country side especially the small trading centers, our people usually do not differentiate a restaurant and hotel, so, they usually refer to them as hotels even when they are restaurants.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a rural smallholder farmer in Kerugoya area of Kenya who dearly loves animals and crop farming. She is married and has three children. Esther does both livestock-rearing and crop farming(vegetables and onions) for food and income. She enjoys working on the farm and taking care of her animals. During the loan appraisal process when the photo was taken, she said, "Farming is my means of securing the basic necessities for my family." 

Esther is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, she plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer before planting seasons starts. These inputs will enhance her farm’s fertility and increase the quality and quantity of harvest. 

The impact this loan will have on her family is increased income and improved livelihood.

Support a humble smallholder farmer with a loan so that she can get ahead with her land!

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin K. lives in the town of Alphatar, which is 35 km. away from Silistra. He is 45 years old and has two daughters. Valentin has worked as technician in a state company for more than 15 years but 5 years ago he starts his agricultural business. Valentin grows 150 decares lavender. Two years ago he builds a small workshop in which he distils lavender oil. This oil is used in pharmacy and perfumery. This $ 2000 loan Valentin K. will use to grow another 100 decares of lavender.

loans.use: To grow 100 decares of lavender.

loans.name: Ruhim

texts.en:
This young man has sold soft drinks for 5 years. 
Having borrowed $400 he bought soft drinks. 
His shop is very small and it prevents him to improve  his business.
Now he applies for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop.
Ruhim is an Internally Displaced Person, (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli is 34 years old and has five daughters.  She lives in a small Samoan village with her daughters and husband.  Kalameli’s husband is unemployed, so Kalameli is the breadwinner, and it is the income from her mat sales that supports their large family.  Kalameli weaves mats and fans according to the traditional Samoan art.  She is anxious to secure loan funds so that she can rent out a flea market stall in her village from which she can sell her mats and fans.  Currently, she has to transport them to the city for sale, and this is a costly exercise that eats into her margin.  Kalameli is certain that there is enough local demand for her product if she can secure a stall at the nearby market.

loans.use: Flea market rent

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en: Fakhraddin N. began his business 10 years ago. Fakhraddin is 47 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his family in Yenkiand village, in the Salyan region. His business gives him opportunities to provide for his family. Fakhraddin would like a loan of $1200 to buy fodder, and balling presses. He wants to improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fodder, balling presses

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Bahriniso K. has been selling sweets for 7 years. She is married, has 3 children and a secondary education. Previously she received her products from deliverymen and her place of business was not very good. She started borrowing through MicroInvest in 2004 and received a $100 loan. After receiving a loan and step by step expansion, Bahriniso increased her inventory and thereby expanded her place of business and started traveling to purchase products herself. She also improved her standard of living.

Bahriniso plans on using this loan to shift toward wholesaling. Her daughter is pictured in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Бахринисо занимается продажей кондитерских изделий вот уже 7лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей, образование среднее. Раньше брала товар у поставщиков, также место её торговли было не очень хорошее. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала кредитоваться 2004году, она получила займ в размере 100$. После получения займа и шагового увеличения Бахринисо увеличила товарооборот и тем самым расширила место своей деятельности, стала ездить за товаром сама. Она также улучшила уровень жизни. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.На фото ее дочь.

loans.use: To move into wholesale sales

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam  T. is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells provisions and food items She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Mariam has been in business since the year 1999 and needs the loan $400 to buy more provision and food items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta S. is married and has children. She is from the village of Sinamoga, and her business is selling barbeque plates. She works three days only, and she sells one barbeque plate for 6 tala ($2.40 USD). Imeleta also supplies pies for birthdays and special events. These pies are only made when customers phone in the orders. This is her second loan, and she will use this loan to buy stuff for her barbeque. She is one of SPBD's active members and she is doing well with her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and boxes of mutton flaps and turkey tails for her barbecue business

loans.name: Natividad Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad Mercedes

loans.use: Purchase of bread and beverages

loans.name: Nkokonjeru East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to boost business. Harriet is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 5 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to take care of her home and ensure a healthy family Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to start her matooke business and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Nuulu Nakyanzi, Sarah N., Hadija M., and Teopista K.. Nuulu Nakyanzi has a business in poultry farming and wants to buy poultry feeds. Sarah N. is currently operates a hardware shop and wants a loan to increase stock in her shop. Hadija M. operates a business of poultry farming and wants to buy poultry feeds. Teopista K. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to construct a business stall.

loans.use: To purchase more matooke for sale to villages

loans.name: Angelo 3 Group

texts.es:
Yolanda sells lingerie, perfumes and cosmetics. She sells them to her friends and neighbors who live nearby. When she has a new product to offer, she goes door to door. With her loan she would like to increase her purchases of different products to offer to her clients, and in this way, contribute to the family income. She is 28 years old, has two children, and belongs to the solidarity group called Angelo 3 along with Roxana, Janey (sale of perfumes and cosmetics), Jesus Irma (catalog sale of shoes) and Liliana Dolores, who will set up a cafeteria one of the universities.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

. YOLANDA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LENCERIA, PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS, LOS VENDE CON AMIGAS Y VECINAS CERCA DE SU LOCALIDAD. CUANDO TIENE UN PRODUCTO NUEVO VA OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA. CON SU PRESTAMO PRETENDE AUMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTAS, Y DE ESTA FORMA CONTRIBUIR AL GASTO FAMILIAR, ELLA TIENE 28 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO ANGELO 3 JUNTO CON: ROXANA JANEY (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS), JESUS IRMA (VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO) Y LILIANA DOLORES INSTALARA UNA CAFETERIA EN UNA ESCUELA UNIVERSITARIA.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Halima's Gofu Juu Shule. Group

texts.en: Halima is a married woman with one child, age three years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 60 and 50 years old. Halima sells fruit through a business she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.  Halima now hopes for a loan of $400 to buy more fruit for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Amina and Mwanakombo, who also have businesses dealing in fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Srun Nhean Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun N. is the group leader in Ro Laing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Thol Thy, are farmers and together, they have four children. Two of their children are employed at a garment factory while the others are studying in state school.

The family lives in an extremely poor condition, although the family members are involved in different business activities. They now live in an old house that regularly leaks during the rainy season. Now, Mrs. Srun N. wants to build a new house for her family. Unfortunately, Mrs. Srun N. has insufficient money so she has asked for a loan to combine with the existing profit that she generates.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add with her profit that she tries to generate for many years to build her house.

loans.name: Sowra D 2012-3 Group

texts.en:
Rose A. is the leader of this small group. Forty years old and a widow, Rose is in the business of selling soya beans, earning a weekly profit of approximately 300 Sudanese pounds. She is requesting a loan to help pay the school fees of her three children, who range in age from 2 to 16.

Rose is joined in her small group by Janefa T., Siyama S., Lilian K., and Margret K.. Janefa T. has a business selling charcaol and wants to expand. Siyama S. operates a business selling green vegetable and wants a loan to initiate the distillation of alcohol. Lilian K. sells bread and wants to expand her shop. Margret K. is currently selling fruits including tomatoes and mangoes, and is requesting a loan to buy a generator for hire.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Xuan is 50 years old. She has 2 children who are both grown. In 1998 she joined TYM to borrow money to improve her family's income. She used the original loan to buy seeds to grow rice for saL.. Her rice business expanded every day. After seeing the result of her loan, she borrowed a larger amount to buy a machine to grind rice and sell to the peopL. in the area. In addition to her rice business, her family also raises chickens. The rice business and the poultry business bring them good results. Now her family is planning to expand the poultry farm and, therefore, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to fix up the chicken coops and purchase additional chickens. Her income is 180 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Xuân năm nay 50 tuổi. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đã trưởng thành.Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư mua thóc về say sát gạo để bán. Công việc kinh doanh gạo của chị ngày càng phát triển. Sau một thời gian ởt dụng vốn hiệu quả chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn hơn để đầu tư mua máy sát lúa phục vụ nhân dân địa phương. Ngoài công việc say sát lúa gia đình chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn từ công việc say sát lúa công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình cũng rất hiệu quả. Đến nay gia đình chị đang có dự định mở rộng chăn nuôi gà theo mô hình trang trại vì thế chị mong muốn đươc vay 10.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm gà về nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Josephine is a forty-year-old widow with two children under the age of eighteen, and she also takes care of an orphan who is a relative. She runs a local Mama Lishe, or small café, with three employees to generate a monthly profit of 700 USD. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don't even appear in the Lonely Planet's budget guide, but if you're looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. Josephine also works as a caterer for local businesses on an as-needed basis, which has helped her increase her monthly profit immensely. She is requesting 450 USD to purchase additional serving equipment to help fulfill her catering orders and extra cooking supplies such as rice and potatoes.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her café

loans.name: Louk

texts.en:
Louk R., 35, is a farmer living in Siem Reap with her husband, Pi Pit, and their four children. Their children are aged 13, 11, 3, and they also have a young 3 month old baby. Louk R. typically makes US$2 working her fields each day and her husband makes US$5 per day as a construction foreman. The family's monthly expenses are US$75 for food, US$30 for utilities, and US$25 for public transportation and costs of motortaxis. Louk R. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for her crops to improve her crop yields. In the future, Louk R., would like to purchase another plot of land to grow more crops and diversify her options for customers.

Louk R. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Chhum T., 30, is married and lives in the Phnom Penh with her husband and two young children. Since 2005, she has been working as cattle dealer together with her husband and they typically make $2 each day. Chhum T. would like to get a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $800 to purchase more cows for trade.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for trade.

loans.name: Nilda Segunda

texts.es: De 52 años de edad, la señora Nilda tiene 3 de ellos invertidos en una pequeña tienda ambientada dentro de su hogar. Sabe que son tiempos difíciles, ella y su familia en sí, por lo que su hija de 18 años va tras la misma meta que ella: mejorar su calidad de vida, lo cual se explicita en que ella estudia y trabaja para poder darle una mano en casa a su señora madre: la señora Nilda. Al ser su zona rural y pobre, las ventas no son muy buenas pero ella quiere dar abasto en cuanto pueda a su barrio con relación a los productos que expende.nnTeniendo en cuenta que con mientras más capital cuente más serán sus posteriores ganancias, es que requiere de un préstamo de 250 soles, lo que le permitiría acariciar tan merecida calidad de vida que aún no goza.n
texts.en:
Nilda, 52, has been working for three years in a small grocery store she runs out of her home. She and her family know that these are tough times financially, so Nilda and her 18-year-old daughter work hard towards the same goal: improve their quality of life. Nilda's daughter goes to school and holds a job to help her mother with the household expenses. Sales on the store are not very good, because Nilda lives in a poor, rural area, but she wants to provide the products that her customers need. Since a larger investment will in turn create larger profits, Nilda is requesting a loan of 250 soles to invest in purchasing wholesale products to restock her store and, more importantly, to reach for the better quality of life that Nilda and her family deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wholesale products to restock small store

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en:
Maame Ekua S., a single parent with four dependents, was educated through junior high. Buying fish from local fishermen, Maame Ekua processes and preserves them and then sends them to the market for sale at Boatase near Elmina, an activity she has done since 2000. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses.

Maame Ekua will use the loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save towards building a family house.

loans.use: To buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has two children. She sells women's clothing at the local central market. Her income is 2,500 UAH per month (1 UAH =~ 0.124 USD). 

Svetlana has been in this business for 8 years. She likes selling women's clothing and believes this is what she can do the best. Svetlana is a kind person and treats her clients well. She also is a hard working person and wants to work more to develop her business further.

Svetlana would like to get a loan to increase the assortment of her goods. She believes that the loan would help her to increase sales and develop her business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane O. is a volunteer member of the Schobac group in Siaya, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home based care patient services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

She owns a tailoring shop in Sagam Siaya, Kenya. Her shop is in her home, which she opened in 1983. She makes dresses for men, women and children, which she sells to various market places. She is able to generate Kshs 8000 in profits. Besides tailoring, she grows crops such as maize and beans. Currently, she has over 20 bags of maize which she intends to sell when prices go up. 

Jane has applied for a loan to add more stock of tailoring materials and invest the remaining amount in her farm. 

Jane is married to a retired prison warden officer. They have 5 children, all of whom have finished school, though some are still dependents because they are attending college.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and invest the remaining in her farm.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora del Carmen C. D. O. vive en el municipio D. Ciudad Delgado en la capital del país, con su esposo Ramón D. 70 años y sus dos hijos. Debido a la alta edad D. su esposo, Dinora no pueD. contar ya con el respaldo económico suyo, y es ahora la responsable y cabeza D. la familia.
Dinora maneja una venta D. prendas D. vestir y materiales D. costura, negocio con el cual mantiene su familia y paga las cuentas mensualmente. Su enorme dedicación en su negocio la han llevado a ser uno D. los puestos más reconocidos D. su zona, alcanzando una gran demanda frecuente. Dinora y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar nuevos artículos y mercadería que le permitan ampliar su margen D. ganancia y brindar seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora del Carmen C. D. O. lives in the municipality of Ciudad Delgado in the country's capital, with her husband Ramon, who is 70 years old, and their two children. As her husband is of an advanced age Dinora can no longer rely on his economic support, and she is now the head of the family. Dinora works selling clothing and sewing materials, and with this business she is able to support her family and pay the monthly bills. Her enormous dedication to her business has resulted in it being one of the most well-known in the neighborhood, and attracting many regular customers. Dinora and her family are seeking a loan to buy new items and merchandise, which will allow her to increase her profit margin and offer economic security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y el menor D. sus hijos D. 24 años. DesD. niña se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas porque nunca se alejó D. su tierra natal donD. hasta ahora vive, pero por la avanzada edad que tiene ahora, optó por vender animales, principalmente cerdos. Luzmila tiene 2 cerdos hembras que cada 4 meses dan cría, después D. 1 a 2 meses D. nacidos los venD., obteniendo las ganancias necesarias. Todas las mañanas sale a cortar el pasto D. sus cultivos para darles D. comer a sus animales, D. esta manera ya no es un gran gasto el alimentar a sus animales. Luzmila reconoce que existen algunos riesgos en la crianza D. animales, como el que las crías D. sus cerdos mueran a temprana edad, lo cual disminuye sus ganancias, sin embargo, sigue trabajando para salir adelante en la mejora D. su granja. Es la tercera vez que Luzmila tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña en su banco comunal donD. toda oportunidad es buena para mantener unido al grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertir en la mejora D. la infraestructura D. su pequeño establo. Arreglará el techo y también comprará 2 sacos D. abono para una pequeña extensión D. terreno donD. tiene sus cultivos, ya que su cosecha le sirve para su consumo propio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 59 years old and lives with her husband and their youngest son, who is 24 years old. Since she was a girl, she has been dedicated to agricultural chores becuase she has never moved away from the land where she was born, which is where she still lives today. However, due to her old age, she has chosen to sell animals now, mainly pigs. Luzmila has two female pigs that are each four months pregnant; after a month or two, she will sell the piglets, obtaining a necessary earning. Every morning she goes out to cut the pasture so she can give the animals something to eat; this way feeding the animals is not a big expense. Luzmila recognizes that there are some risks in raising animals, such as if the newborn piglets died at a young age decreasing her earnings. Nevertheless, she continues working to improve her farm.

This is the third time that Luzmila has accepted a loan form MFP, and she is very happy that the work she does in her community bank gives them an opportunity to keep a good united group. The quantity that she is requesting is to invest in the improvement of the structure of her little stable. She will fix the roof and also buy two sacks of manure fertilizer for a little extension of land where she has her fields, since that her harvest there is for her family's consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix her stable

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo inició el negocio por tradición familiar ya que la mayoría de su familia se dedica a esta profesión. Comenzó el negocio hace 25 años empezó ofreciendo sus servicios a conocidos ya que la competencia familiar era muy fuerte se cambio de domicilio donde instalo su propio consultorio

Desde que inicio el negocio a la fecha le ha ido muy bien ya que es el veterinario principal de las quintas que hay en la región.  

El necesita un pretsmao por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar principalmente diversos medicamentos ya que como su trabajo es de urgencia a veces no puede acudir hasta que consiga el medicamento para los animales.
texts.en:
Reynaldo followed family tradition in choosing to become a veterinarian, as most of his family members are in the same profession. He began his business 25 years ago, offering his services first to people he knew who were familiar with the strong reputation of his family. Later, he moved into a new home and opened his own office. From the time he began his business until today he has been successful and he is now the primary veterinarian for the farms in his region. He is requesting a loan for 3,000 Mexican pesos, to be repaid in five months. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of medications to have on hand, since he often works in emergency situations but must delay his arrival until he can obtain the appropriate medicines for the animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es madre de un hijo pequeño y vive con su esposo. Desde hace un año brinda el servicio de costura para niños y adultos, esta actividad la realiza en un espacio que implementó dentro de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que éstos se sientan satisfechos de su buena labor. Además es un negocio rentable porque desde que comenzó cuenta con una gama de clientes que aprecian su trabajo porque es una persona que satisface sus gustos. Lo más difícil para Mariela es no contar con un taller adecuado. Con MFP ya tiene 11 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son puntuales, responsables y no tienen problemas dentro del grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina remalladora, la cual le costará 1200 soles, y  con lo sobrante adquirirá materiales textiles (telas, hilos, etc.).
texts.en:
Mariela is 40 years old, she has a young son, and lives with her husband. For a year she has been a tailor for children and adults, and she is working at a space she has set up within her house. She likes to do a good job for her clients to make them feel satisfied with her good work. It is a profitable business as her clients appreciate her work because she is a person who satisfies their taste. It is very difficult for Mariela not to have an suitable work space. With MFP she has had 11 loans and she likes to work with her communal bank as the partners are punctual, responsible, and have no problems with the group. With the requested money she will buy a special sewing machine ("remalladora") which costs 1200 soles and with the rest textile materiel (cloth, yarn, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and material

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme a ouvert une boulangerie dans son quartier à agbalépédo, elle vend du pain en gros, elle vend plus les matins parce que les matins les gens prennent leurs petits déjeuners avec du pain. Son stock de farine de farine de blé, de beurre et de sucre qu’il utilise dans la fabrication du pain est épuisé, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de blé, 05 sacs de sucre, 03 boîtes  de beurre et assurer le transport. Elle  est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman opened a bakery in her area in Agbalépédo. She sells bread in bulk, and she sells the most in the mornings, because people eat bread as part of their breakfast in the mornings. Her stocks of wheat flour, butter, and sugar, which she uses to make bread, are depleted and she is therefore seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy 15 bags of wheat, 5 bags of sugar, 3 tins of butter, and to pay for transportation costs. She is married and has two children, and she contributes to meeting her family's expenses with what she earns from her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter, and other products

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 44 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Cada día se levanta para seguir con el cuidado de sus animales y de sus tierras de cultivo, sus hijos la acompañan en algunas ocasiones, cuando tienen tiempos libres luego de sus estudios, pero el que sí trabaja a su lado en estos tiempos, es su esposo, quien la apoya mientras está de vacaciones, ya que labora lejos de casa. El trabajo físico en los campos es dura, más aun por el  clima lluvioso, pese a estas circunstancias su labor no se posterga y sus anhelos de seguir progresando tampoco. Para el futuro, Saturnina está planeando sembrar más extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción. Este es su onceavo préstamo con MFP, donde desea seguir trabajando porque ha encontrado un espacio de amistad entre los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicitara tiene como es para la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y costales para empacar su futura cosecha.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 44 years old and lives with her children and husband in their own house. Every day she rises early to care for her animals and her fields. Her children sometimes accompany her when they have time off from school, but the person who really works by her side is her husband, who helps her when he is on vacation since he works far from home. The physical work in the fields is hard and even more so during rainy weather. In spite of this the work continues, as does her desire to continue improving. In the future Saturnina plans to plant more areas of land to increase her production. This is her eighth loan with MFP, where she hopes to continue working because she has found friendship among the members of her communal bank. The money she requests is to buy fertilizers and sacks for packing up her future harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and sacks.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
K. Jamshed has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Jamshed has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of 100 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Jamshed began this enterprise 7 years ago.

By this time, he has expanded his business and today, this business has become a family affair, with his whole family engaged in the business. Today, Jamshed needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 800 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank P. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. His wife is a petty trader with little income. Frank single-handedly uses his income in taking care of the children.

Frank sells assorted provisions in Hohoe. He will use the loan to buy more provisions such as milk, Milo (a milk beverage) and coffee to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Frank plans to save.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as milk, Milo, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Ибодулло Курбонов проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Ибодулло более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В данный момент клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову и продавать молоко, т.к. есть спрос на него.
texts.en:
Ibodullo K. lives in the Yavan district. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. Ibodullo has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. He feeds and sells livestock. Currently, client is requesting a loan in order to buy a dairy cow and then sell milk because it is in demand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl L. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 36 years old. Cheryl is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Cheryl is just starting this business.

In 2007, Cheryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cheryl from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rebecca Jelagat

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36-years-old, married to Philip S. and they have two children aged eight and twelve. Her poultry business is located within Mailinne and Kapsaos area in Eldoret Town. She has been in the business for the past eight years.

Rebecca has gone through many challenges in the poultry business but she thanks God as she believes that He has enabled her to be successful. Rebecca was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by another client and with the loan she is seeking she plans to expand her business.

In the future she intends to be financially stable so that she can educate her children and enlarge her farming business.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Mr. Sela S., age 18, is single.  He lives with his widowed mother, a garment factory worker, in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sela has been a construction worker for seven months. He doesn’t have his own transportation, so he spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Because of this, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle so he can commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Alejandrina es viuda, tiene 70 años y 1 hijo, Alejandrina tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir en donde elabora ropa típica, productos que comercializa en los mercados y ferias de la región.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de telas.

loans.name: Abduahat

texts.en: Abduahat is a small producer in the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. Together with his wife they’ve been raising cattle for more than fifteen years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his two children and his wife. As well as caring for his livestock, he also cultivates agricultural crops such as wheat which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income. Abduahat has asked for this loan to buy young cattle in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy calves and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a passion for direct selling. She is Mrs. Ruth S., who is 48 years of age and a resident of P3 Labuyo, Tangub City. She is married to Ignacio S. Sr. who is working presently in Qatar as an engineer. She is blessed with two adult-aged children.

Ruth started her direct selling business for Natasha Products five years ago with an initial capital of only 3,000 PHP. She has one outlet in Labuyo, Tangub City, and earns an average net monthly income of 14,400 PHP, which is of great help to her family.

As a newly recognized member of Kiva partner PMPC, Ruth has the privilege of applying for the amount of 25,000 PHP as her first loan under the regular loan program. She will use the loan to add to her capital for her existing direct selling business. The income from Ruth's business will be used to support her family's basic needs and for her loan repayments. Her future dream is to open another outlet to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital for her Natasha Products direct selling business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and does not yet have children. He lives in Alabukam, a neighborhood in Bamenda, Cameroon. Samuel and his entire family live in a 2-room house. Samuel had to overcome challenges in life such as ill health and little or no education provided by his parents. He farms in order to earn a living.

This will be Samuel's ninth loan from GHAPE. He has been a member since 1998. He has been quite successful in the past with his business due to its location and his reasonable prices. Also, with experience, he is now receiving good yields from his farm.

Part of the profits from this loan will be used to build a house, improve on his farming system, and reinvest in his farm.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, to clear farmland, and to till soil.

loans.name: Tauala

texts.en:
Tauala S. is a 55 -year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Sataoa C.  She has 11 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Tauala owns & operates a business venture.  The business operates in the agriculture sector.  The main purpose of the business is raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for S..  Tauala has been engaged in this business for over 6 years.  From these activities, Tauala earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2006, Tauala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.   Taula had a previous loan loan from SPBD which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tauala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette C.'s main source of income comes from selling frozen foods and fruits like bananas. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Rizal, Santiago. Antonette has been in her business for over 3 years.

In 2009, Antonette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Antonette is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank consisting of 22 members in Cusco. The group is called Fuente de Vida ("source of life" in Spanish). Angelica is 44 years old and lives in Cusco with her husband, who is a painter by trade, and the two youngest of her five children.

Angelica sells toys on the street and around markets in Cusco, which she has been doing for the past five years. She mainly sells small toy cars and dolls in Cusco, and occasionally ventures to some of the smaller surrounding towns to sell there as well. Angelica wants a loan to increase her inventory of toys in anticipation of the upcoming holidays. She plans to sell toys at several big Cusco Christmas markets this season.

Angelica is pictured with her granddaughter, Kitana.

Angelica appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy toys to sell in the Christmas market.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina W. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Cristina is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a retail store where she sells seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat K. is the group leader of a four-member group loan. The members all live in Sambuor village in the Kandal province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Chhet Oret, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In the rice field, he faces an obstacle because his field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects that damage his crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sambat K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the rice farm.  

She is the mother of five children, two of whom are grocers while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the rice farm

loans.name: Lucia Yamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Lucia E. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia Brisas del Sur en la ciudad de Nacaome, Lucia se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene varios años de tener su pulperia. en estos momentos necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder surtirla mas, tiene el problema que los carros repartidores solo pasan una vez por semana y a veces no logra comprar lo suficiente para tener producto en toda la semana, es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito.
nos comento que se siente feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia un poco mas. piensa que dentro de unos años se puede convertir en un mercadito bien surtido.
texts.en:
Lucia E. is 41 years old and lives in the Brisas del Sur neighbourhood of Nacaome city. Lucia sells consumer products and has had her shop for several years. Now she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and be able to get ahead. She tells us that because supply vehicles only come by once a week, she is often unable to buy enough product to keep her shleves stocked all week. This is why she is requesting a loan. She says she feels very happy that her business is growing a little more every day. She thinks that within a few years it will become a thriving little market.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lozenges, sodas, juices, eggs, beans, bread, cookies, rice, sugar, water, dairy products, lard, margarine, oil, coffee, peppers, jams, pastries, salt, milk, and spices

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita P. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Juanita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling spices, "bihon" (rice noodles), vinegar, salt, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
