loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La Sra. Candelaria, tiene 35 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, tiene 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 
 Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes fijos, amigos del barrio, vecinos y moradores.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes en general cómo arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes aromas y parte del dinero lo invertirá en frutas y verduras, para dejar satisfecha a su clientela. 
Candelaria, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace, su meta es continuar con el negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en ella y en otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
La Sra. Candelaria, tiene 35 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, tiene 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, ya tiene buen tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa lugar donde acuden diariamente sus clientes fijos, amigos del barrio, vecinos y moradores. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 Nuevos Soles, comprará abarrotes en general cómo arroz y azúcar en sacos, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes aromas y parte del dinero lo invertirá en frutas y verduras, para dejar satisfecha a su clientela. Candelaria, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace, su meta es continuar con el negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en ella y en otras mujeres que lo necesitan.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes en general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy turkeys and guiney fowls to raise

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora  María Teresa  Fernández es socia del banco Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón Paute lugar reconocido por su clima templado favoreciendo el cultivo de flores, su gente amable y acogedora al turista y su comida típica son los atractivos que ofrece esta localidad.

María Teresa  tiene 44 años de edad divorciada hace 3 años por  la falta de compresión y problemas con su esposo, en su unión marital concibió tres hijos quienes se encuentran de 25, 23, 17 años,  sólo vive con su último hijo ya que el   mayor migró al exterior  en busca de un mejor futuro y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su hija es casada y vive independiente,  fruto de su trabajo goza ahora de su casa propia.

Ella es dueña de una  tienda de abarrotes hace 25 años el local  donde funciona  su negocio  es arrendado y  trabaja solo los días domingo y miércoles, los demás de días se dedica a colocar tierra en fundas para plantas, y en sus tiempos libre lava  ropa ajena, estos trabajos le están permitiendo salir adelante.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal y los créditos recibidos le han beneficiado para arreglar un poco su casa, con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir arroz,  azúcar, aceite, sal, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para abastecer su tienda.

Su meta es terminar los arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a member of the communal bank called Pautenitas. She lives in Paute, a place known for its pleasant climate, flower cultivation, friendly people and local cuisine. Maria Teresa is 44 years old and has been divorced for 3 years. She has 3 children from her marriage, ages 25, 23 and 17 years old. Only the youngest lives with Maria Teresa. The eldest has moved away to find better work and now helps his mother financially. Her daughter has married and lives independently with her family in their own house.

Maria Teresa has owned a small general store for 25 years where she works on Sundays and Wednesdays. The other days she works cultivating plants. In her extra time she washes clothes. This additional work has enabled her to improve her quality of life. She has 3 cycles now working with the communcal bank, and the loans have helped her to make necessary repairs to her house. With the new loan, she wil purchase rice, sugar, oil, salt, cleaning supplies and other items to fix up her store. She would like to finish the repairs on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, oil, cleaning supplies and other items for her store

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
Adamsay K. owns a store that is located along one of the popular streets in Makeni. She has been in business for about twenty-five years and used to trade in various food produce such as rice, palm oil and onions until recently when she changed to the sale of cosmetics.

Adamsay is married to a nurse and they have three kids and four dependents.She is therefore in need of a loan so that she can buy more cosmetics products to sell which will increase her profit. She intends to educate her children with the proceeds from the business which is one of her main priorities.

Adamsay also hopes to construct a dwelling house in the future. She is a very hardworking and determined woman.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Sulaimonkul

texts.en:
E. Sulaimonkul is a young, married man who breeds calves in a small village in the Shahristan district of the Sugd region. Sulaimonkul is full of energy and he tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Sulaimonkul started his business many years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is now a pensioner. Sulaimonkul has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed the work during his childhood. He would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his family's life conditions. IMON International wishes him good luck and appreciates your help!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand business

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married to Alberto and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Janita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also owns a sari-sari (general) store located at her house.

In 2009, Janita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Janita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Janita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase pigs to raise. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Santos Clementina

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Clementina M. H. se dedica a la venta de leche y sus derivados, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en la Col. Brisas del Poteca del municipio de Las Trojes.  También renta cuartos y esta construyendo dos cuartos mas, su negocio le es rentable y con los ingresos que obtiene cubre los gastos personales.
el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para mejorar y terminar los cuartos que esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Clementina M. H. has operated a business selling milk and dairy products for more than 6 years. She operates the business at her house in Col. Brisas del Poteca neighborhood of Las Trojes. She also rents rooms and is building two more rooms. Her business is profitable and her income covers her personal expenses, etc. She will use the loan to buy materials to complete and improve the rooms that she rents.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for room-rental business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga  Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Grace is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Grace owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products,  including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan D., 47 years old and is a villager who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own 2-hectares of land to cultivate rice and this spouse is also works very hard with their farm to support their family. Aside from farmers, they are also pig breeders at home. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support their both of occupation, Mrs. Chan D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for hire laborer to plow the farm to cultivate rice and to buy two piglets for breeding and pig food. This couple has three children, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other two are students in the local school

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for hire laborer to plow the farm to cultivate rice and to buy two piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is a mother of one young child. She has established a computer business to help provide various types of reports and computer programs for members of her community and for different companies. She is a relatively new business owner. She started her business in 2007. She is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop and a router to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business. And she’s certain that with the new laptop, she will be able to deliver her reports and services faster. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop and a router

loans.name: Harrybert

texts.en:
Harrybert M. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 24 years old. Harrybert is single. To make a living, Harrybert owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Harrybert has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Harrybert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Harrybert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a motorcycle. Harrybert is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintanence of a motorcycle used in his business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Harrybert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the repair and maintainance of a motorcyle used in his business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace ocho años, pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta, tiene dos hijos que son independientes.
Julia se dedica a la compra - venta D. sacos D. yute (tela) al por mayor y menor en las ferias D.: Yunguyo, Desaguadero y Chaca chaca. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó su capital D. trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar sacos D. yute.
Su visión es tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past two years. She lives in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 42 years old and she is married. She did not finish graD. school. She has two children who are grown and independent. Julia buys and sells jute burlap sacks in wholesale and retail at different fairs in Yunguyo, Desaguadero and in Chaca Chaca. Her first loan requested from Manuela R. (Kiva Field Partner) was used as working capital. This new loan requested is in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase more burlap sacks. Her dream is to have a grocery store. What she most likes about her community bank are the loans and savings programs.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase burlap to make sacks.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. Her children have grown up and moved out. Valentina sells clothing at an open market in Kherson town. The very good location of her kiosk brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Valentina has been in this business for nine years, ever since she saw that women's clothing was one of the few products that sells well and produces a stable income. 

Valentina has used microloans before and found them very helpful for her business development. This time Valentina is requesting a loan of 12,200 Grivnas to add to the assortment of clothing she sells. She will spend the additional income to help her children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Bebie

texts.en:
Bebie G. is a married woman who lives in Burgos Street, Brgy. IV, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures. She sells decorations and she raises pigs for fattening. Her husband, Noel G., is 47 years old and works as a tricycle driver. He also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 22 years old. Bebie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 27 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bebie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000 and improved the family's standard of living. This time, for her 28th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase more inventory of decorations. She continues to save up for future business expansion. Bebie G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of decorations

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.en:
Ibolya is a single mother who is raising her daughter herself. She works hard to ensure a decent livelihood for her small family. Ibolya started her business 10 years ago, when the used-clothing business was only getting started in Ukraine. Even today, there is still little competition at the market where she sells her inventory. This business is her family's only income.

Ibolya has used business loans before and finds them very helpful. She has been able to expand her business locations from one to three sites. Ibolya is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to increase the variety of her inventory. She would like to purchase more warm clothing and increase her sales.

loans.use: to increase inventory variety

loans.name: Paul Njoroge

texts.en:
Paul K. is 45 years old, married to Margaret and they have eight children: the eldest is 28 years old and the youngest 11 years old. They live in the Isbania area on the outskirts of Migori town.

Paul has a clothing business that he has been running for the past three years and he has seen his business grow through the years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully paying the previous one without any difficulty. He will use the money to buy more clothes to add to his stock as he has orders from his clients.

His desire is to expand into a wholesale shop one day where other business people would be able to buy stock from him to sell.

loans.use: Buy clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Phem S., 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. S. and her husband sell fish, earning an income of about $US9 per day. S. has to spend $US70 on food, $US10 on electricity and water supplies, and $US44 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of $US1000 to purchase more fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
There are 21 participants in this group loan, all residents of Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. This village loan selected Mr. Nuon S. as the village bank president. Each participant will use his or her portion of the loan to support their own specific purpose. 
 
Mr. Nuon S. is 42 years old and a farmer.  He cultivates citronella grass for a living, but he lacks the money to farm.  He is seeking a loan to buy citronella seeds and fertilizer to cultivate his crop. His wife, Mrs. Sun Huor, 43 years old, works as a cleaner for a company. 

This couple has three children who are the students in the local schoO. and also support their parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy citronella seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy L., 54, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She has two children, one of whom is already working while the younger one stays at home and helps her in managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Nancy has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a variety store, and as a sideline she is also raising a few hogs for slaughter. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for buying one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of $4.60 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy a few more piglets to raise. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Nancy dreams of being able to stay physically, mentally and socially strong for her children. She also wants more pigs to raise and sell for meat. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Philis Wanjiru

texts.en:
Philis has practiced agricultural activity in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She is 34 and a single mother to five children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to start rearing poultry for sale and she will use the loan to build a house for keeping the poultry.

In the future, Philis hopes to grow her poultry keeping business and become a leading supplier of poultry in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To construct a house for poultry to start rearing poultry for resale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 24, is married with one child who is two years old now. He has been practicing mixed farming for two years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market and local hotels. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea and also depends on the income from his salary to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 30,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo t purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from the sale of milk will be used to provide for the basic needs of his family. He would like to acquire more dairy cows in future and build a modern dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Guillermo De La Asunción

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo de la Asunción R. C. el trabaja como Asistente topográfico tiene  dos  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado actualmente  tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Guillermo de la Asunción R. C. works as a topographical assistant. He has worked at this activity for two years. He is married and has three school age children. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL and has bought construction materials with all of them. He has bought sand, cement, stone, gravel. blocks, etc. to expand and improve his house. The Ceprodel loans have been of great help in this way and he has improved his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Faustino trabaja en la municipalidad del Cusco como chofer pero también se dedica a la venta de arena y hormigón, él requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como piedra chancada y arena.  
     
Faustino pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Faustino, 54, has three children and lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.

Faustino works for the city of Cusco as a Driver but also sells sand and concrete and needs the loan to buy more materials like crushed stone and sand.

Faustino is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means; he also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more materials like crushed stone and sand.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: La Sra. C. Gutierrez es maestra de secundaria tiene cuatro años de trabajar para esta institución, es soltera, no tiene hijos, se le han financiado tres créditos y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para compra de medicamento, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  solucionado problemas familiares y también ha mejorado su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. C. Gutierrez is a secondary school teacher and she has four years working with the institution. She is single and she does not have children. She has had three past loans and each one has been used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve her house. The loan she requests now will be used to purchase medicines. The loans granted to her by Ceprodel are a great help because she has been able to overcome family difficulties and she has also improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to rocks and construction blocks

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Mrs. Shirley B. is from the Village of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and blessed with six adult children.

To make a living, she is engaged in the photocopying business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business activity for 15 years already. She’s earning an average amount of not less than PHP 3,000 a month. 

In January 2011, Shirley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. As a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 Program, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as her first loan, which will be used for purchasing materials for her printing services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans and possibly expanding the  business

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her printing services

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya T. is widowed and lives with her two children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son attends a college and her daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

She used to work as food quality-control specialist for a local bakery between 2005 and 2011. She started to make and sell clothes besides her job in 2008. Then she began operating a new business in 2011 after quitting her job. 

She bought an oven, a stove and and other useful equipment and started selling homemade bread. She wants to expand her homemade bread business and increase her working capital in order to have her own bakery in the near future. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to save money for my children and give them a good education." 

Otgontuya is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase new ovens and equipment for her homemade bread business.

loans.use: To purchase new ovens and equipment

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor B. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old. Maricor is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $192 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Maricor is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her different viand of her restaurant. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her Restaurant Business

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Pasdakrad

texts.en: Pasdakrad K. is 29 years old, married, and has one child.  They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pasdakrad has been operating a business renting out a space of his house. His wife sells rice and food in front of garment factory. He is requestng his first loan of $1,000 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.

Ghaith has a mobile shop where he buys and repairs phone. He has two years experience and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.


He is requesting $2,400 to buy a laptop and to make an aluminum awning for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a laptop and to make an aluminum awning for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a farmer from the past 10 years. In 2006, he bought some land and started farming independently. He cultivates all types of vegetables, and he distributes his products to multiple agricultural markets. 

This will be his second Kiva loan and he notes that he has been able to increase his profits by a large percentage since taking his first loan. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplies, such as spices and seeds, in order to make his products grow faster and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as spices and seeds

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married and has five dependents. Rebecca cooks food such as jollof rice (as seen in the picture above) and plain rice. The plain rice is served with tomato sauce and fried chicken. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan she hopes to receive will be used to buy food items to cook for sale. The profit realized from the sales as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 49 años de edad, es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora, esta casada con Amadeo de 47 años y tienen 04 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia morada donde reina la armonía. Marina trabaja arduamente desde hace 25 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba tan solo a la agricultura lo cual le servía solo para sostener a su familia. Con sus ahorros acumulados abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, desde entonces su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas. Menciona que la clave de captar consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lleva seis años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir más espacio de terreno para cultivar donde trabaja su amado esposo. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este será su 17avo crédito, y esta muy contenta de saber que contara una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con el crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes.
texts.en:
Marina, 49, is from the city of Quimbiri and is a simple, hard-working woman.  She has been married to Amadeo for 47 years and they have four school-aged children.  They all live together in their own house in a harmonious environment.  Marina has been working hard for 25 years.  She used to work in agriculture to support the famly.  With the money she was able to save she opened a grocery store and offers a variety of basic needs products.  Her business generates a good income.  She claims the key to attracting customers is kindess and support when they are shopping.

She has been involved in this business for six years and feels that the hardest part of it is having to stand all day long.  But business is going very well and thanks to this she was able to buy more crop-land for her husband to farm.  In the future she would like to expand the house and the store.  This will be her 17th loan and she is happy knowing that she can count on lenders to help her keep growing.  In her communal bank she is an active member and very punctual for meetings.  She plans to use the loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils and detergents.

loans.name: Junrill

texts.en:
Junrill is married and a father of one school-age child. He is 25 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Junrill is a motorcycle taxi driver. He owns and operates a business providing passenger services in the local community. He has been in this type of service for five years. He earns PHP 4,000 each month from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to pay for motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

Junrill has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Junrill hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle for service.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel es una madre de familia muy dedicada a su hogar, tiene  3 hijos  y vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. Desde hace más de 3 años decidió tener su granja de cuyes, actividad que le ha generado rentabilidad, pues al día llega a vender 20 cuyes. Por ello trata de intensificarse en su crianza. Por tanto la venta de cuyes no solo lo realiza en el mercado sino también se ha convertido en proveedor en varios restaurantes de su localidad o en la solicitud de clientes que le hace de acuerdo al tipo de evento que realizan. Tiene grandes deseos de mejorar e implementar su granja  para lo cual se va a capacitar en la crianza de cuyes así como también en ampliar el espacio de su granja. Es una de las socias de mayor trayectoria en crédito, que ha venido solicitando con MFP, ahora es su octavo ciclo y espera concretar sus objetivos. Con el dinero que solicita, le servirá para contratar mano de obra para que realicen surcos y siembren alfalfa; así como comprar alimentos para cuyes.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a mother who is very devoted to her home; she has three children and lives with her husband in a house that’s hers.  Over three years ago she decided to have her own guinea pig farm, an activity that’s generated profitability, because she sells up to 20 guinea pigs daily.  Because of this, she's attempted to increase breeding.  As a result, she not only sells guinea pigs in the market but she’s also become a supplier to various local restaurants or to individual customers who place orders according to the type of event they will have.  She has a great wish to improve and equip her farm so she’s going to become more adept at breeding guinea pigs as well as increase the size of her farm.

She is one of the clients with the longest credit history with MFP.  This is her 8th cycle and she expects to reach her objectives.  She will use the requested money to hire workmen to dig furrows and plant alfalfa as well as to buy feed for the guinea pigs.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy guine pig feed.

loans.name: Agustino

texts.en: Agustino is 49 years old, married to Caroline and together they have four school-going children. He has been running his hotel business for 12 years and he earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He has been loaned KES 30,000, which he plans to use to purchase a refrigerator. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and build a residential house. In the near future, he hopes to have completed his residential house and expanded his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Gloria Amada

texts.es:
loria tiene 57 años vive en Pujilí cerca de Latacunga Centro sur de Ecuador, vive con sus tres hijos que tienen 33, 29 y 16 años, Gloria se describe como una persona tranquila y responsable.

Trabaja en la crianza de animales los cuales son cuyes, cerdos, becerros, trabaja acompañada de sus hijos. Ya a trabajado con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y becerros para seguir incrementando sus animales y seguir en la crianza de los mismos.

El crédito le ayudará a seguir creciendo con su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in Pujilí near Latacunga in south central Ecuador. She lives with her three children who are 33, 29 and 16 years old. Gloria describes herself as an easygoing and responsible person. 

She works raising animals including guinea pigs, swine, and calves. She works in the company of her children. She has worked previously with FODEMI, and the loan she seeks is for purchasing pigs and calves so that she may continue to expand her herds and keep caring for them. 

The loan will help her continue to grow with her business and raise her income, and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and calves.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and vegetables to sell to their community. Leonor’s husband mainly manages their rice farm. Leonor, on the other hand, raises chickens and sells prepaid mobile-phone credits to the people in her community.

Leonor requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, feeds and prepaid load credits. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, feeds and prepaid mobile-phone credits.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has eight children, is married to a farmer and lives in the village of Jukwa. She completed high school and has for the last five years earned a living by making items for people to eat. She and her husband use their incomes to provide their children with clothing, food and schooling. Alice is applying for this loan to buy more ingredients to use to make food for her customers. She plans to use some of the additional income she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a food business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Arlene has a shop in which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mariana Catalina

texts.es:
Mariana de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inició su negocio hace 5 años. La profesión de ella es vendedora de cosméticos de uso personal.

El negocio de ella inicia a las 4:00 pm termina a las 6:00 pm, posteriormente inicia su otra actividad que es de cuidar niños.

Solicita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio e incrementar los productos que vende en su negocio como: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes.

Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda e incrementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is 31 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who started her business five years ago.  Her business is selling cosmetics and personal care products.

Mariana is requesting this loan to invest in her business and to increase the range of products that she sells such as perfume, creams and deodorants.

Mariana's dream is to finish building her home and to further increase her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, deodorants and creams

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para seguir incrementando el negocio, y al mismo tiempo tener el apoyo de la institución, por el momento comprara tomates, repollos, aguacates, pepinos, esta inversión espera que le ayude como la anterior, ya que también le ha ayudado a mantenerse en el comercio.
Las inversiones de Maria le han ocasionado un incremento en las ventas, ya que al disponer de más mercaderia los clientes encontraban en ella lo necesario en verduras.
texts.en: María has decided on a new loan to continue expanding her business and to continue having support from the institution.  For the present, she will buy tomatoes, cabbage, avocadoes and cucumbers.  She hopes this purchase will help her like the previous one since it also helped her stay in business.  María’s investments have led to increased sales since having merchandise in stock makes it possible for her customers to find all the vegetables they need with her.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, avocadoes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene is the 42-year-old mother of three sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in the outer ger (Mongolian traditional tent) district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. This district is without basic infrastructure. Her elder son lives and works in Japan, and her daughter got married and went to live with her husband, so today Bolor-Erdene lives with her spouse and two sons, who attend local university and kindergarten, while their father is a contracted employee in Korea.

She supports her family by operating a business selling men's jackets in the largest outer market of Mongolia. She has been operating this business since 1994, so she is a very experienced entrepreneur. Also, she has 4.6 million Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. In the winter season, she specializes in selling handmade men’s coats. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. She will use these materials to sew handmade coats.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to sew handmade coats

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio sigue trabjando en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien sigue trabajando en el area de seguridad de una empresa,el negocio de tienda de abarrotes lo realiza su pareja,por medio D. negocio y de su trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos  .El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azúcar,aceite,fideos y golosinas para la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, 33, lives with his live-in partner and has three children.  He continues working in his grocery store business and also in the area of security for a company.  His partner takes care of the grocery store business.  By means of the business and the job, the member gets his family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy for the grocery store.                                                

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy.

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en: Sana' is a 33 year old young woman who is married with three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sana' wants to pay the university fees for her son who is studying engineering, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Sana' gets the loan, she will pay the university fees for her son and this will enable her son to complete his study and change his life positively. Sana' is a conservative woman, so her husband Hani is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for her son.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Narciso;  El socio tiene 77 años de edad, El socio es casado, El socio tiene 4 hijos ya son independientes; el socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, el socio tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa, frejoles. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz para sembrar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz para la siembra.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HUCHUY QOSQO", which is in the district of Lamay in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Mr. Narciso is 77 years old, married and has four independent children.  His main source of income is agriculture and he owns land where he cultivates corn, potatoes and beans.  He is requesting a loan to buy corn seeds to plant.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is a 50-year-old widow. She lives with her son in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a food stall in front of their house for the past two years. She sells soups and noodles to people in her community. 

Nguyet would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and cooking appliances.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman who has three adult children. She is 43 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is operating a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. In the future, Jocelyn wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josphat Mwanzi

texts.en: Josphat, 25 years old, is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and friendly man. He has been providing transportation services within a viable busy market for the last year. In addition, Josphat sells green grams (a type of legume) to add to his source of income. His business challenge is the high price of fuel. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy another motorbike. In the future, Josphat hopes and dreams of expanding his services and employing more people in this business.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Epifaniahas a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Epifania has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Hysni

texts.en:
Hysni a rural villager located in south-central Albania,is a 54-year-old father of two dependent children. He has been selling milk and other dairy products to locals. He started this activity in his thirties and has since then been enjoying it. Not only does it keep him busy, but he also generates an income. Hysni has been the only one to earn an income for the past 20 years, and that makes him proud of himself.

With a lack of money for his business, Hysni is applying for his first loan with VisionFund Albania. He will use this loan to add some more sheep to the herd he currently has. This loan will enable him to generate more income, to better support his family's living situation and set aside some money to pay the university tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Metha

texts.en:
Meet Metha. Metha is married and living with three persons in the family home in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta. 

Metha runs a small stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits, and also services bill payments for her customers. She joined Ruma because she wants to improve her business. She is glad that her business got assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has got around $62 per day in sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. 

In the photo, Metha is standing in front of her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: La señora Basilia, tiene 23 años de edad,  vive en el municipio de Monteagudo departamento de Chuquisaca, en  domicilio alquilado, su actividad es la confección de ropa de vestir y deportiva, de la cual genera sus ingresos mensuales, esta actividad la desarrolla también en un taller alquilado, tiene un hijo de 3 años que depende de ella y vive con su esposo quien trabaja de chofer. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para confección de prendas de vestir (tela, hilos) y compra de una maquina elastiquera, de esta forma podrá incrementar su cantidad de trabajo y generar mayores ingresos para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Señora Basilia is 23 years old. She lives in the community of Monteagudo in the department of Chuquisaca in a rented home. Her business is making clothing and sports clothes, from which she generates her monthly income. She also developed this business in a rented workshop. She has a three-year-old son who depends on her, and she lives with her husband, who works as a driver. She is now applying for a loan to purchase basic materials (fabric, thread) to make articles of clothing and to buy a machine for sewing elastic. In this way she will be able to increase her amount of work and generate more income to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic materials (fabric, thread) for making articles of clothing and to buy a machine for sewing elastic.

loans.name: Choman's Group

texts.en:
Choman, is a 27 years old married and has one child .To assist her husband Choman bought an old sewing machine and after a while gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work.
She has three years of experience with her home based sewing business activity and to improve the quality of the services to her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy new sewing machine ,over sewing machine iron and fabric.
She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits to provide good life for her family.
The story of Choman and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their faces for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Choman's  group's $ 3,000  loan helps a member to buy new sewing machine ,over sewing machine ,iron and fabric.

loans.name: Gandjehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GANDJEHOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Louise, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 27 ans est mariée à un certain Bernardin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Louise a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour cette raison, Louise vend des fruits de saison et divers produits par la technique de distribution depuis une huit ans. Louise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GANDJEHOU un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison et divers produits.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is in construction supplies business. She sells sand, gravels and hollow blocks in their local market and is making good sales. She is a member of Paglaum MPC for 8 years now and had availed various loan products including insurance. Recently, she avails a loan to buy more volumes of sand, gravel and make hollow blocks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more volumes of sand, gravel and make hollow blocks to sell

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her eight children, who mean everything to her. Irine is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village.

Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Irine offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mum, Irine has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Irine has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

Irine's dream is to keep expanding her cereal business so that her children can have a stable future and in the near future, take over the business.

She would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support and help they are giving smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to start cereal selling.

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Galo is a fisherman, 33 years old. He’s worked in this activity since 15 years old. He’s married and has 3 children. His wife is a housewife and Galo is the only income for his family. 

Galo always has been an entrepreneur and nowadays he has his own boat. He works 6 days a week. Tuesdays and Friday goes fishing with his two assistants, usually they remain two or three days at sea. In the sea they start the work day at 4pm and finish 8pm. 

Galo wants to improve his business and this loan will let him to purchase fishhooks and longline fishing (special fishing net). This tool helps him to catch more fishes. He hope to count with your support.

loans.use: to purchase fishhooks and longline fishing (special fishing net)

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Four years ago Hugo started a small beauty parlor in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon because it was very difficult to find a job paying enough money to cover his basic necessities. His business requires a number of upgrades and improvements, for example, the building is very small and he doesn\\\'t have all the tools he needs. For this, Hugo requests a loan of $200. He will buy a chair and other materials and products he needs to make his business grow and to increase his income.

He plans on repaying the loan within 3 to 6 months. He needs your support. He is very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hugo hace 4 años inició con una pequeña estética, en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, debido a que era muy difícil encontrar un empleo que pudiera darle un salario que cubriera todas sus necesidades. Sin embargo su negocio presenta muchas carencias, pues el espacio que tiene es muy pequeño y tampoco cuenta con las herramientas necesarias, por lo que no ha podido crecer mucho desde su comienzo. Por ello Hugo requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS, para poder comprar un sillón y otras insumos que requiere para hacer prosperar su negocio y generar más ingresos para sus necesidades diarias.

El planea cubrir el monto total de su crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, solo hace falta que tu te decidas a apoyarlo y volverte parte de sus logros, el te lo va agradecer. Apóyalo, no lo dudes.

loans.use: Purchase armchair

loans.name: Ziyaddin

texts.en:
Ziyaddin is 42 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, Almali village. He is now settled in the Khirdalan settlement and is married and has 3 children.
He has his own shop. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 140 sacks of cement. The second time he borrowed $1000 to make repairs to his shop.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to increase variety of building materials.
He has run this business for 3 years.

loans.use: To increase variety of building materials

loans.name: Sauaso

texts.en: Sauaso is a young, active woman.  She is married with two children.  She has a talent for making hand-printed fabrics and using her fabrics for making men’s dress shirts, T-shirts and sarongs (locally referred to as lavalava).  She used an initial loan from SPBD to purchase her sewing machine and printing equipment.  Her business has been very successful, and she was able to pay back this loan in full and on time.  Given her history, Sauaso qualifies for a home improvement loan, and she is seeking loan funds in order to repair the roof and back of her house.  Given that her home doubles as her workshop, this loan will ensure that she can protect her income stream and continue to keep her work safe and dry.  Sauaso’s dream is to be able to build a separate workshop apart from her house; she says that she will work toward this goal with future loans.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en: Hamida is the mother of two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. Hamida knits clothes to provide for her family. She has been in the business for four years. She would like a loan of $725 to purchase yarn to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Ni Komang Sudiartini

texts.id:
The business of Komang Sudiartini is Pig farming. Today she only raise 5 piglets she bought for Rp200,000 (about US$22)/piece. Food given are traditional, from cooked banana tree trunk mixed with Pollard (wheat shells), given twice a day, mornings and evenings. Expenses for 3 months are about Rp200,000 (about $22). As usual after it was felt large enough, that is after 3 months raised they could be sold. Sales could reach Rp 2,000,000 (about $220) per harvest. Profit after 3 months is Rp800,000 (about $88), used to supplement her tenant farmer husband income, and provide needs for her 2 children who are still in Grade school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni Komang Sudiartini adalah beternak babi, saat ini hanya memelihara 5 ekor anak babi yang dibelinya dengan harga Rp.200.000 per ekornya. Pemberian pakan yang dilakukan yaitu dengan pakan tradisional yaitu, pakan yang terbuat dari batang pohan pisang yang direbus kemudian dicampur dengan Pollard (dedak gandum), pemberian ini dilakukan 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore hari, biaya pakan selama 3 bulan bisa mencapai Rp.200.000,- . Seperti biasa penjualan setelah dirasa cukup besar yaitu selama 3 bulan pemeliharaan. Hasil penjualan sampai Rp.2.000.000,- sekali panen. Hasil keuntungan selam 3 bulan yaitu Rp.800.000,- dipakai untuk membantu pendapatan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dan memenuhi kebutuhan 2 orang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed stock and availability of animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pengadaan bahan makanan ternak

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha owns a small restaurant. She is married and has four children ages 12, 15, 18, and 20 years. Her husband is jobless. Asha works very hard for her family. She has a dream to be a great business woman. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy plastic chairs and catering materials. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: Buying plastic chairs and catering materials

loans.name: Sasani

texts.en: Sasani I. is a thirty-five year old lady from the village of Vailoa Tai. She has a second-hand refrigerator and she decided to run an ice cake business in order to have access to SPBD loans. Her husband does not work and there is no other source of income for her to support her family and the children. She has five kids and all of them are young and attending primary school. Sasani is using this loan on buying stuff for the ice cake and she is looking forward to selling it at school and also to the village people. There will be six working days and she is looking at earning about 50-80 WST ($20-32 USD) a week.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, flour, plastics bags, and ingredients for the ice cake business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S., 63, is widow and has seven children. She works very hard on her plot of land growing variety of vegetables and she then sell them to the people in her community. She normally makes on average around $4.60 each day, while three of her children are lately employed at Thailand as laborers and the rest of whom are enrolled in school.  Kim S. has had a problem with a water system to grow her crop. Additionally, she will use this loan to purchase a water- pump machine and pipes to enable her to get water supply from a nearby pond and a well in her community. This will enable her to make the cultivation much further faster, easier and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pump machine and pipes to facilitate her water supplies.

loans.name: Mkwawa D Group

texts.en:
Kikwisa M., age 26, is married and has 2 children (ages 7 and 4). She has a business selling clothing and cosmetics which she started 2 years ago. Kikwisa's business is open from 8 am to noon and from 4 pm to 6 pm daily, and she is able to make a monthly profit of about US$52.

In the past, Kikwisa has taken out a previous loan with Tujijenge to expand her business. She now hopes to receive a new loan to purchase an additional stock of clothing and cosmetics. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses clothing, charcoal, and food sales.

In the picture, Kikwisa is the one on the far left.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
Carlos is 48 years old. Due to a difficult financial situation, his family separated until conditions would improve. His wife does not live with them. Instead, he lives with his three daughters who are 5, 12, and 14 years old, in the region of Sabana Grande. He has 7 years of experience in the beef and pork business, which he learned from his mother who had a company and devoted most of her time to business. In the afternoons, he works as a cab driver to bring in more income to sustain his 3 daughters, who depend on him. His wife, lacked a job and felt it was necessary to leave the country to find work. She is working in Spanish and sends home money to support the family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his daughters with the best quality of life he can afford. Their butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that reside in their region. He buys meat daily and sells them fresh to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan to invest in more fresh meat and buy in greater quantities so he can have enough to sell during the mornings.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Don Carlos tiene 48 años de edad, por la difícil situación económica su familia sufre una separación hasta que la situación mejore ya que la esposa no vive con ellos, este señor habita con sus tres hijas de 5, 12 y 14 años en la comarca de Sabana Grande, el señor Carlos, lleva 7 años de dedicarse a comercializar carne de res y cerdo, esta actividad lo realiza en compañía de su madre quien le dedica el mayor tiempo al negocio y le apoya en esta actividad, por la tarde el señor trabaja de taxista, esto con el objetivo de buscar mayores ingresos con lo pueda subsanar todos los gastos de sus 3 hijas, quienes están a su cargo, ya que la esposa ante la falta de empleo se vio en la necesidad de irse a trabajar fuera del país, trabajando de domestica en España y envía remesas para apoyar en los gastos familiares. Es así como este padre diariamente trabaja con el fin de brindarles a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida. La carnicería abastece en gran medida a la mayoría de los pobladores de la comarca en donde reside, la carne la compra a diario, ya que ofrecen a sus clientes un producto fresco, debido a la demanda de este producto el señor solicita un préstamo para invertir en carne fresca, comprar mas cantidad de carne para cubrir su demanda y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes carne toda la mañana.

loans.use: to buy more beef and pork

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is married woman with five children.  Zawadi is a fish seller through a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly V. lives with his wife in Potakouy Village in the Pursat Province. V. is an ice-plane machine repairer and generates income of $8 per day. His wife, Mrs. Penh Sokha, is a porridge seller in her village. They have five children, one of whom is married. Four of their children are in school and they are responsible for school’s fee. With growing family expenses, V. works hard to expand his business as much as possible. V. is requesting a $700 loan to grow his ice-plane machine business. This will help improve his income and ability to cover family expenses.

loans.use: To expand his ice-plane machine business

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary T., 40, and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Un, 43, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have two sons. Their first son has full time employment in Phnom Penh and the youngest son is in the local school. 

Mrs. Sotheary has been growing and selling flowers for five years. She collected flowers from her farm and bought some from villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Kunthea has been a motor taxi driver for eight years.

Now Mrs. Sothery is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase flower trees for planting and to buy flowers under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase flower trees for planting and to buy flowers under contract for resale.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji (baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning "elder sister") is the wife of A. M. and they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are enrolled in a local school.. She owns a two-room brick house. A. M. drives an auto-rickshaw. Kosar baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy another auto-rickshaw to expand the business.

She is joined in her loan group by several other members. Kosar baji would like to buy masonry tools. Bushra baji wants a loan for her sweetmeat business. Anwar baji wants to buy a lift machine (similar to a tractor). Shabana baji would like to buy fruit for her fruit sales business.

In this group loan, the funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Asha is a 39-year-old divorcee with three children, all of whom are in school. She owns and operates a store that sells phone accessories such as mobile phone cases, phone docks, chargers and so on. Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmothers in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that mobile phones are the only form of phone communication available to most people because there are few land lines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

Due to the widespread demand for mobile phones as well as the enterprising attitude of Asha and her two employees, Asha makes a monthly profit of approximately $US100. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional phone accessories to be able to earn more profits. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Jadranka

texts.en: Jadranka is from Prnjavor and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and his monthly salary is 700 KM. Jadranka sells clothes at the market on a bench that she rents. This is her second loan  in the amount of 1 000 KM and Jadranka intends to use this loan to purchase additional clothes for her bench.
