Her wish is to expand her goods in order to earn more money that she needs because she has two children and both of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Paugata

texts.en: Paugata L., 19, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the village people and general puplic 6 days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD). SPBD loans are Paugata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase carving materials such as a rip saw chain and paints to decorate the crafts and designs. Her mother is lending a helping hand to her business.

loans.use: To purchase carving materials such as a rip saw chain and paints to decorate the crafts and designs

loans.name: Tiyum

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiyum M. (pictured with her son), 54, is a widow with two children. The children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Tiyum M. has been fishing since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. She does fishing from Mekong River and sells them in her village.

Mrs. Tiyum is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Mrs Belinda Montero E., 54, is a resident of Brgy. San Francisco North, Tibiao Antique, Philippines.  She finished her Bachelor of Science in Education and practiced her profession for almost 5 years. Unfortunately she did not continue teaching when she was separated from her husband because there was a third party involved with their relationship on her husband's side.  She now stands as a mother and a father for her six children.  

Being a single mother, many challenges and trials come into her life. One of these is a financial problem concerning the medical treatment for her son, who suffers from drug abuse.  She recalls those years when she baked bread and cooked dishes to sell in their neighborhood just to earn income to meet the basic needs of her family.  

Those past experiences have made her become firm in the face of challenges.  Besides, despite being a single mom, she established her 5 children and sent them to school to finish college, and recently they have stable jobs. Being a responsible mother she felt her responsibilities for her children. Currently she wants to have working capital for her own business and not depend on them.  

She is hoping that someday she will be able to start up a restaurant or refreshment stand because she is a good cook but she lacks opportunities because of having no capital.  If she is given a chance and if somebody like ASHI is willing to grant her working capital of Php 10,000 to start with, she will do her best to expand her business and to show her integrity.

loans.use: variety store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Mary sells fabric, shoes, and bags in an area called Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is an auto electrician. Mary uses her income to pay the utility bills and to feed the family. Mary will use the loan to purchase more fabric, shoes, wrist watches, jewelry, and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest back in to the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric, shoes, wrist watches, jewelry, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Asanta

texts.en:
Asanta L. is currently in the business of making local brew and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Asanta is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is an air traffic officer. She has one child and her child does not go to school yet.

With the extra profits from her loan, Asanta hopes to be able to expand the business. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Gatete

texts.en:
“Assalamu alaikum", which means peace be to you.”from GATETE A. in Remera sector, Gasabo District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda!! A. is 29 years old, single without orphans.

A. is a bead worker, he has been employed in a barbershop as a barber for 3 years and he decided to open his own barbershop at Remera in Gasabo District near the AMAHORO Stadium. A. employs 7 people who help him to run the businees. His Barbershop is called HAVANA Barbershop.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515 000Rwf, which will help him to buy more material in order to expand his business. A. believe that once he get this loan, the number of staff will increase and also his monthly income will increase.

loans.use: Expand his Business

loans.name: Nabiya

texts.ru: Набия работает в государственном учреждении в городе Исфара. Ей 44 года, воспитывает 4 детей. Недавно она засватала за своего сына девушку и собирается организовать торжественное бракосочетание. Для осуществления своего плана ей не хватило некоторой суммы денег и поэтому она обратилась за займом.
texts.en:
Nabiya works in a government agency in the city of Isfara. She is 44 years old and raises four children. Just recently her son got engaged to a girl and she is planning to organize a festive wedding ceremony. She is short on a certain amount of money so to realize her plans she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To host a wedding celebration

loans.name: Risitas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Ricitas " esta representado por la señora Mariela  y conformada por 15 personas con ganas de salir adelante. Una mayoría de los socios (as) se dedican al comercio de productos como el pan, ropa, pollos, celulares y prendas de vestir. Los socios (as) de este banco tienen experiencia hace ya varios años en el rubro y son emprendedoras y trabajadoras por lo que no temen a la competencia. El destino del crédito es para el incremento de su mercadería y a la compra de insumos y herramientas que faciliten y agilicen su trabajo para aumentar sus ingresos y darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Los socios (as) no tienen mucha experiencia con grupos solidarios ya que es el primer financiamiento para el grupo pero si tienen muchas granas de trabajar y salir adelante es por esta razón que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda una oportunidad de valerse de capital para mejor sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The “Ricitas” group is represented by Mariela. It is made up of 15 people with the desire to get ahead. The majority of the members do business with products like bread, chickens, cell phones, clothes, and other articles of attire. The members of this bank have several years of experience in the area, are very enterprising, and are hard workers. Therefore, they are not afraid of the competition. The loan is to increase their merchandise. They will buy supplies and tools to facilitate and speed up their work. This will increase their income and give their families a better quality of life. The members do not have much experience with groups as this is their first group loan. They do have a big desire to work and get ahead; that is why the Agrocapital foundation offers them the opportunity to get a loan which will increase their income and help their families have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Magda Isabel

texts.es: Magda Isabel es  casada, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor tiene 18 años estudia su 2do año en la universidad y la niña  de 11 años estudia su 6to grado de educacion primaria, su esposo trabaja en un negocio propio como es una vidrieria, ambos comparten los gastos familiares pues son una familia muy unida, viven en la zona # 4 de Nueva Guinea, trabaja como administradora de la univerisdad URACCAN desde hace 11 años, esta solicitando su 4to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en la construccion de una habitacion y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Magda se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, ella es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que sus dos hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer  personas de bien.
texts.en:
Magda Isabel is a married mother of two. Her eldest is an 18-year-old who is in his second year of college, and her daughter is an 11-year-old sixth grader. Her husband has his own glass business. Both she and her husband share the household expenses because they are a very close-knit family. They live in Zone #4 in Nueva Guinea. She has been working as an administrator at URACCAN University for 11 years. She is requesting her 4th loan from AFODENIC so that she can invest the money in building a room in her house, thus improving her family’s living conditions. Magda is known to be very responsible and honest. She has demonstrated good behavior in society, and is very well-loved by her co-workers. Her dream is to have health and job stability. She also wants her two children to study so that they can grow up to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio Maria Auxiliadora distante a 300m de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 

Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las actividades ya mencionados mas arriba.  Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

Hay tres mujeres del grupo que no estan sacando credito en este ciclo.  Los que retiran credito son:

Mirta C.	Merceria
Gladis Z. 	Vendedora
MARTA C. 	Tejedora
ISABEL V.	Vendedora de remedios yuyos
DAYSY V. 	Tejedora 
HERIBERTA B.	Tejedora
MARIA G.	Empleada
AIDA B.	Tejedora
PANFILA CRISTALDO	Vendedora de cigarro
ROSANA P.	Tejedora 
INES F.	Tejedora
LILIANA Z.	Vendedora
PATROCINIA E.	Empleada
texts.en:
In the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood in the city of Carapeguá, some 300 meters from the Carapeguá office, some women of limited resources entered the program of the Women Entrepreneurs Committee of the Fundación Paraguaya and decided to meet together in order to receive information about this program. These women are hardworking and actively engaged in the the activities mentioned below. They are looking for just a little assistance in the form of loans in order to boost their household incomes and improve their quality of life. They need this creditary process in order to invest in their respective lines of work and thus be able to achieve sustainable growth both as a group and on an individual basis. There are three women from this group who are not taking out loans in this cycle. Those who are taking loans are: Mirta C. . . . Notions shop Gladis Z. . . . Salesperson Marta C. . . . Weaver Isabel V. . . . Sales of Herbal Remedies Daysy V. . . . Weaver Heriberta B. . . . Weaver Maria G. . . . Employee Aida B. . . . Weaver Panfila Cristaldo . . . Sales of Cigarettes Rosana P. . . . Weaver Ines F. . . . Weaver Liliana Z. . . . Salesperson Patrocinia E. . . . Employee

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Guadalupitas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Guadalupitas", están representadas por la señora Janeth y conformada por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco entre la presidenta y la señora Luisa que son primas pero ambas tienen ingresos propios. Las socias desarrollan diferentes actividades por el barrio la colorada entre ellas la venta D.  fruta, comida, ropa, cosméticos y los socios participantes se dedican al servicio mecánico y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma y el crédito favorece para mejorar su negocio con la compra D. mercaderías así como los materiales y las herramientas necesarias para ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos pudiendo así dar a su familia una mejor calida D. vida. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que una mayoría D. las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the Guadalupitas (Women of Guadalupe) Communal Bank are represented by Señora Janeth and consists of 13 members among whom there exists a strong relationship. The President and Señora Luisa are cousins but both have their own incomes. The members developed different activities for the La Colorada neighborhood, such as the sale of fruit, meals, clothing, cosmetics, and the participating members are engaged in the mechanics traD. and public passenger transit. With respect to their capabilities, it may be said that they are all conscientious and the loan is granted to improve their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, such as the materials and tools necessary in order to increase their income and thus give their families a better quality of life. The members have experience with solidarity groups since most of the members are working on their second cycle while demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success” said Nenita.  She believes that determination to succeed does not require becoming rich first but requires hard work and patience.  

She is married to Pedro and blessed with two children: Rosita and Joniely. The eldest is a graduate of Education but chooses to work abroad while the youngest is a fresh graduate of the same course. Because of her desire to maintain her sari-sari store business, she now hopes to borrow PHP10, 000 as additional working capital.  She also sometimes assists her husband in farming, through labor and by financial assistance from her business income. She hopes to grow her business more for their future welfare.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Sta. Maria, Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Here are Hawa F. and Kadiatu T.. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city.  They named their group Hands Together. This is not the first loan these women are receiving from SMT/Kiva.  With previous loans, these women were able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve their standard of living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.
 
Hawa F. (right) is the leader of this group. She is 27 and was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with two children; one in class two and the other in class one. Hawa sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper and rice. She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      
Дилбар женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями и мужем. Дилбар откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Дилбар продает их на скотном рынке. Дилбар кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. Она успешно закончила все предыдущие займы, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Дилбар планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Дилбар благодарит нашу организацию и Киву за поддержку обществу.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Together with her sons and husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Dilbar feeds the livestock at home, and once the livestock is ready, Dilbar’s sons sell it at the livestock market. Dilbar has been our client for 2 years. She successfully repaid all of her previous loans and now wants to obtain another one. Dilbar plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family profit. Dilbar thanks our organization and Kiva for supporting the society.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is a single parent with six dependents. She was educated through junior high school. Agnes sells palm oil and tomatoes and other food supplies at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 1971. She uses her income to pay for household expenses. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more food supplies for resale.  Agnes plans to invest any new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy aluminium

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha S. lives in Preak Ta Ke village in Kandal province. She is a second-hand clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more clothes. She would use the rest of money to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport the clothes to sell. She is a 45-year-old widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Zonia Maria

texts.es:
la sra, Zonia L. de dedica a la venta de joyas de plata como ser cadenas, aritos, pulseras, collares etc. cuenta con  clientes fijos de varias empresas sus clientes le recomiendan a otros, también  sus vecinos que por lo general son maestras. Asimismo su hijo  le ayuda a colocar producto en el trabajo ya que el labora en una empresa privada (LEYDEE)  y en esta empresa trabajan muchas mujeres que son los clientes mas potenciales que tiene.
Desde hace nueve años se dedica a este tipo de actividad, ella vive en la residencial la Cañada,  asimismo  recibe otros ingresos por remesas dos veces al mes de su hija que vive en Estado Unidos.
en estos momentos ella necesita hacer un pedido grande que se tarda en venir y lo quiere tener para la temporada de navidad, quiere comprar mucho producto porque para esa epoca se vende muy bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia L. makes a living selling silver jewelry in the form of necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc. She has regular customers in several companies who then recommend her services to others. Her neighbors, mostly teachers, are also regular customers in her business. Furthermore, her son helps her sell her products since he works in a private company (LEYDEE) with many women employees and potential customers. Zonia has been in this business for 9 years and lives in the residential areal "La Cañada". She also gets additional income from her daughter who sends her money from the United States. Now she needs to place a large order that will take some time to arrive and which she wants to have available for the Christmas season. Zonia would like to purchase a lot of jewelry since it sells very well at that time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of silver necklaces, bracelets, rings

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 34-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Hussein has owned a mobile phone shop for a year now. He sells mobile phones and accessories, and he also repairs phones. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new mobile phones and their accessories. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan. 

People from his region know Hussein well because he is known for having a good reputation. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When Hussein first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties since he has a good networking group. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años cría ganado vacuno, por lo que todos los días atiende a sus animales en el establo que implementó en el terreno donde está su vivienda. Yolanda sale por las mañanas a cortar los pastos que sirven de alimento para sus vacas y en esto tiene sumo cuidado, pues la alimentación es la base para que estén saludables y los pueda ofertar a un mejor precio. Por ello, Yolanda quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, además de asistir a una capacitación donde le enseñen las mejores técnicas de crianza. 

Esta es la quinta oportunidad  en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es muy responsable y puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, lo cual promueve en sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children. She has been breeding cattle for the past 2 years. Every day she attends to her animals in the stable that was built on her property. Yolanda comes out in the mornings to cut grasses to feed to her cows. She is careful in managing their diet since food is the basis for keeping them healthy and attracting better prices at market. Yolanda would like to make improvements to her stable as well as attend a training class to learn better breeding techniques.

This is the fifth time she has received a loan from MFP. Yolanda is very responsible and punctual with her payments, which is highly encouraged by the other Communal Bank members. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a cow of good breed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a young entrepreneur, is married and has a boy one-and-a-half months old. Previously he used to sell clothes until he saw an opportunity for electronics from his friend. He has rented an electronics stand where he sells radios, torches (flashlights), batteries, belts, padlocks and watches. His business is located in a marketplace near a road and most of his clients are walk-ins and local residents.

John’s major challenge is lack of adequate storage for his valuable inventory and so he needs to rent space. John is borrowing KES 50,000 to buy more radios and lead products. He has also set funds aside for storage.

John is a friendly person and enjoys networking. His hopes are to see his only boy get the best education and to see himself as the only supplier of radios in the area in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more electronic products to sell

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael V. lives in the small village of Barangay Anquiray Amulung, Cagayan where farming is the major source of income. He is 22 years old and single, so he lives with his immediate family. He is a college student taking a Computer Science Course at the private school in Tuguegarao. 

Ismael wants to help his parents provide his daily allowance, so he has started a business selling kitchen utensils to his neighbors and friends.
His loan request of PHP14,000 will be used to purchase additional merchandise to sell to expand his business. Through this, he expects that his sales and his income will increase. He hopes that his business will grow so he can continue to help his parents financially by providing his own daily school allowance. He dreams of finishing his studies and becoming successful in his career in order to help his parents improve their house and their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao C., 59, is a hard-working man. He lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang. He currently earns his living driving a truck at the brick-field. To help with responsibility for family, his wife stays at home and sells a few groceries for a profit and also does housework. This couple has two school-aged children who are dependent on their parents’ income. Kao C. needs a loan to help purchase the inventory for his wife’s grocery business.

loans.use: To help purchase inventory for his wife’s grocery business.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta M. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TANAFF depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle gère sa boutique où elle vend divers produits tel que du lait, du riz, du sucre de l'huile végétal etc... elle fait également la transformation et vente de savon traditionnel.
texts.en:
Binta M., 47, is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of TANAFF for six and a half years. She has a little shop where she sells various items such as milk, rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. She also makes and sells traditional soap.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand her little business

loans.name: Cairo José

texts.es:
Cairo D. vende emparedados, gaseosa, jugos y café en el mercado Israel lewite Managua.
Cairo va usar el crédito para comprar dos termo y una cafetera. 
Su negocio comenzó cuando cairo quedo desempleado, y al no encontrar trabajo puso su propio negocio en el mercado viendo que las ventas iban aumentando el decidió quedarse en el mercado.
Trabaja cada día de 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
El espera que con la compra de los termos y la cafetera la clientela aumente.
Cairo  es  padre de una hija la que se encuentra en edad escolar.
Este es el séptimo crédito que Cairo ha tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 2 años.
Cairo dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que su negocio se ha mantenido
texts.en:
Cairo D. sells sandwiches, sodas, juices and coffee in the Israel Lewites market in Managua. Cairo will use the loan to buy two thermoses and a coffee maker. His business started when Cairo became unemployed; when he could not find a job he set up his own business in the market and after sales started to increase he decided to stay in the market. He works every day from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. He hopes the purchase of the thermoses and the coffee maker will increase his clientele. Cairo has a young daughter. This is the seventh loan that Cairo has with CEPRODEL and has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. Cairo said that the loans from CEPRODEL have helped him a lot to sustain his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two thermoses and a coffee maker.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer L. is from the village of Poblacion 4 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products such as canned goods and soy sauce, in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Jennifer's 10th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi T., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She has a business selling vegetables and buys rice in bulk for resale, earning an income of $1 US per day. 

Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 US per day. By doing so, he is able to cover the family's expenses, especially the children’s education. He has been in this job since 2004. 

T. is requesting a loan of $300 US to purchase more rice in bulk for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es una mujer luchadora, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 30, 25 y 18 años (conviviente), trabaja con EDAPROSPO desD. hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta D. pescados y mariscos (choros, cangrejos, machas), desD. hace 13 años, se inicio a raíz D. que vio la necesidad que había en su hogar y  ubicó un mercado el cual no tenía mucha competencia, con sus ingresos cubre los gastos D. pago D. servicios, apoya a su hija con su nieto e invierte en su negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado la educación D. sus hijos y la construcción D. su vivienda. Dentro D. los planes que Angélica  tiene para el futuro es terminar D. construir su vivienda. 
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para la compra D. mercadería y comprar los útiles escolares D. su nieto quien es huérfano D. padre y madre. Angélica agradece el apoyo brindado a los inversionistas, ya que le ha sido D. mucha ayuda para implementar su negocio y así mejorar  su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica is a determined woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children (ages 30, 25, and 18). Her youngest child is in a common law relationship. Angélica has been working with EDAPROSPO for three years and has been selling fish and shellfish (mussels, crabs, and clams) for thirteen years. She started her business so that she could meet the needs of her household. Angélica’s business is located at a market where she does not have much competition. With her earnings, she is able to cover her expenses, pay for services, and support her daughter and grandson. She also invests in her business, and because of the effort she puts into her work, Angélica has been able to proviD. her children with an eduation and build a home. Among her plans for the future are to complete the construction of her house.

This recent loan will be used to purchase merchandise and acquire school supplies for her orphaned grandson. Angélica appreciates the support that has been provided by her investors, since it has been very helpful in implementing her business and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & acquire school supplies for her grandson

loans.name: Los Planes 4 Group

texts.es: El grupo los planes 4 se han dedicado a la elaboraciòn de cintas y fajas de mostacillas y  delantales para damas con unos 6 años a tras y ellas con esto han salido avante  pero por la demanda  ellas quieren incrementar sus capitales  y por ello acuden ala  ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR para poder ayudarlas en sus capitales  para tener màs venta y surtir sus meraderias y asi ganar  y tener otro nivel de vida y superar en toda el area de su vivencia.-
texts.en:
The "Los Planes 4" group manufactures beaded sashes and belts and aprons for women; they have been in this line of work for 6 years. Demand has been high and this has made it possible for them to get ahead. They need an increase incapital so they have called upon ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR to request funds to buy merchandise in order to increase sales and profits so that their standard of living will rise and their entire way of life will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Prosperidad lo encontramos en la ciudad de Cuenca que  es la capital de la provincia del Azuay  situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana,  es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

 La señora Elsa V. es una de las socias activas de éste banco comunal desde hace tres ciclos  invitada por la presidenta del banco a formar parte del mismo;  nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad  es casada y madre de cinco hijos que se encuentran de 13, 10, 5, 3, 1 año sus tres primeros hijos son estudiantes de  pre primaria, primaria y  secundaria respectivamente,  su esposo trabaja como agente vendedor de libros, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Elsa se dedica a la entrega de comida preparada (viandas) actividad que realiza hace cuatro años, tuvo que dejar su negocio por un tiempo ya que su hijo  enfermo y necesitaba de cuidados especiales pero ya lo va a retomar de nuevo, también se dedica a la venta de libros, cuentos hace un año.

Con el  crédito solicitado  va a invertir en la compra de libros y cuentos para abastecer y seguir con este negocio hasta retormar el anterior, su meta es de llegar a tener un carro para poder trabajar mejor.
texts.en:
The “Prosperidad” communal bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which is the provincial capital of the Azuay province. The province is located in southern part of Ecuadorian Andes corridor. It is the third most important city in Ecuador and is characterized by its tranquility and beauty of an old city. Its historic center was declared a cultural landmark by UNESCO (United Nations Education, Scientific, and Cultural Organization) in 1999. Elsa is one of the most active members of this communal bank. For the past three cycles, the president of the bank has invited her to be a member. [Elsa] is 33 years old, is married and has five children, ages 13, 10, 5, 3, and 1. Her children attend pre-school, elementary school and junior high school. Her husband sells books. They are saving up for their own home. Elsa has been delivering prepared food for the past four years. She had to stop for a period of time because her son was taken ill and needed special care, but she is getting ready to begin again. She has also been selling books and comics for the past year. She will use the money from this loan to buy books and comics in order to stock up and continue with her business as before. Her goal is to be able to buy a car in order to be able to work better.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Books and comics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is married and has three children to look after, two of whom are still in school. Unable to meet the material needs of her children, she sought assistance from GHAPE when she joined the program in 2007. Her dedication to the program is unquestionable and her hard work has left untold results on the situation of her family.

With her new loan, she plans to buy groundnuts. She plans to keep a good quantity of stalk so that she can resell them when groundnuts are scarce in supply and demand is high. The profit she gets from the loans will be used to educate her children and provide food for her family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling groundnuts

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El señor Paulino L. P., tienen la edad de 42 años,  es casado y su esposa labora como docente aportando con sus ingresos a la economía domestica, tiene 3 hijos adolecentes, un menor, y los otros dos mayorcitos que actualmente estudian, la familia habita en el Barrio Piedra Quemada de la ciudad de Ticuantepe, el tipo de habitantes que ahí moran, son de recursos escasos, que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y de familias grandes, que no les permiten mejorar su economía por la necesidad de suplir las necesidades básicas de consumo.

Ellos cultivan yuca y tiene 31 años  de experiencia en este rubro, solicita un préstamo para la adquisición de abono y fertilizantes y mejorara el mantenimiento agronómico y fitosanitario a los sembrados de yuca, con esta inversión mejoraran la producción de yuca y así los volúmenes de venta, que aporten a  la economía que ha futuro les brindara el capital necesario para proyectos del negocio, personales o familiares.
texts.en:
42-year old Señor Paulino L. P. is married; his wife is a teacher and contributes to household finances. He has three teenage children, and the two older ones are students. The family lives in the neighbourhood of Piedra Quemada in the town of Ticuantepe. The majority of the people who live there are poor, work in agriculture, and have large families so they lack the money to improve their financial situation. Everything they earn is spent on basic necessities. Paulino and his family grow yucca and have 31 years of experience in this line of work. He is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve the health of his yucca crop. Such an investment would help increase production and lead to more sales and greater income. This money would give Paulino the capital necessary for business, personal, and family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his yucca fields

loans.name: Cleida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Cleida ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores la socia se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes y a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene cuyes y pollos, gallinas; La socia no vende sus animales, es para consumo. La socia sale en la foto junto a su asesor, ella está muy feliz de pertenecer a este banco comunal. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche al por mayor para la tienda abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Purificada - Angostura (Purified Virgin Communal Bank, Angostura). She lives in the Angostura district, located in Saylla, a province of the Cusco region. Her name is Cleida, she is 35 years old, she is married and has 2 young children. She dedicates herself to the managing of her grocery store and to the breeding of small animals: cuyes (Quechua for Guinea pigs), roosters and hens. She doesn't sell her animals, she breeds them for personal consumption. The man with her in the picture is her adviser, and she is very happy to be a member of this communal bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk in bulk for her grocery store. She deeply values and is immensely grateful for the loan received, as this will help her improving her business and the quality of her life; at the same time, she commits to repaying her dues respecting the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en:
Myagmardorj is operating an internet and PC game cafe in the busy center of the city. He is 32 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in a small rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He began his business in 2007 when he saw a great market opportunity, as many local young people were really getting into internet surfing and computer games. He is planning on expanding his business by adding more computers so that he can accommodate more customers. 

Myagmardorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase replacement computer parts and upgrade his internet speed. In the future he wants to open more internet cafes.

loans.use: to purchase replacement computer parts and upgrade his internet speed

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang S., 40, is married and lives with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia – an area known for quality palm products. S. is a grocer, earning a gross income of $20 US per day. Her husband raises pigs and earns $8 US per day. S. is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase a motorbike to transport groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bakh Yaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BAAX YAYE est créé le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame Magatte D., à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle est aussi détentrice de kiosque où elle vend du pain.

Son crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en légumes afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Elle a comme objectif de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BAAX YAYE was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of seven members who all come from the same district.They set up their group based on common interests and neighborhood. The solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" of KEUR SALLA DERGUENE. Mrs. Magatte D., on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 32, married and raising four children. She has a little business selling vegetables and she also has a kiosk where she sells bread. Her loan will allow her to add to her stock of vegetables so that she can expand her profit. Her goal is to help improve living conditions for her family and to add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter E. O., tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado, y  tiene dos hijos de  17 y 10 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante, además de la mano de obra. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Walter también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Walter E. O. is 40 years old and married. His two children, ages 17 and 10, are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to help on his farm, specifically for the coffee crop. The plan is to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and to pay for the labor. He wants to give his coffee crop adequate maintenance in order to produce better quality. He wants to get the greatest possible income at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the opportunity presented to him. Walter has worked in agriculture for several years. In the future he hopes to gives his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his coffee crop

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel B. Díaz es dueño y conductor de una moto taxi en Ciudad Sandino, el inició hace 6 años cuando decidió comprar su propio medio de transporte después de trabajar vendiendo repuestos de vehículos por 12 años. El piensa utilizar el crédito otorgado para darle mantenimiento al que hoy es su principal fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel B. Díaz is the owner and driver of a moto taxi in Ciudad Sandino. He began this business 6 years ago when he decided to buy his own form of transportation after he worked selling spare parts for vehicles for 12 years. He wants to use the loan granted to him to maintain his vehicle, which today is his main form of work.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Nanziga Kwagalana Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
42-year-old K. Patrick of Nanziga Kwagalana group goes about his business excitedly and with enthusiasm. That has, for the past 7 years, been the trademark he has employed to obtain a dependable footing for his agro cash crop sales business in Mpigi. He mostly sells coffee.  

With this line of business combined with his mondus operandi, he has  made progress by leaps and bounds.  A business that started off small is now grown, principally due to the stable and reliable price of coffee on the local market. 

Patrick also does farming and animal husbandry. In a month, he makes 450,000 shillings. This married father of eight likes to describe himself as God-fearing and diligent. With this loan, he wants to purchase more coffee for resale and also pay his farm laborers.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of coffee for resale and pay  farm laborers

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo B. G.  oriundo de sabanalarga, lugar donde se dice que “La Inteligencia es peste” tiene un puesto de frutas donde también ofrece servicio de llamadas, y vende lotería, ubicado  en un lugar público muy cercano a una terminal de transportes y le va muy bien, porque permanentemente salen y llegan buses interdepartamentales y sus pasajeros compran las deliciosas frutas para emprender su viaje, hacen llamadas mediante cualquier operador y también compran su boleto de lotería o chance soñando con ser algún día millonarios o tener unos pocos pesos mas para pasar un momento feliz.   

Su vida ha cambiado mucho, y dice que ha dado un giro de 360 grados  desde que se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y obtuvo su primer crédito, pues con ninguna otra institución lo había logrado. Su credikiva es su quinto crédito, porque quiere comprar frutas al por mayor debido a que próximamente distribuirá a otros comerciantes y también realizará una adecuación locativa en su cocina.

Gumercindo es un hombre muy trabajador y ejemplar padre de familia,  que inició el negocio que su papá le enseñó cuando se dedicaba a vender lotería desde sus 17 años y durante algún tiempo esta fue su actividad principal y fuente de ingresos; tiempo después se desempeñó como voceador de prensa y tenia ayudantes que no le respondían con el dinero que él debía pagar  a la empresa, que se lo acreditaba diariamente. Sin embargo esto no le quitó el entusiasmo de continuar trabajando dedicado al negocio,  a través de el  logró educar en el colegio a sus hijos y hoy algunos están trabajando en empresas de la ciudad y otros siguen los consejos de su padre en la actividad comercial. Como ha sido un gran ahorrador compró con sus utilidades su lote y construyó su casa en el barrio Carrizal, gracias al sacrificio y fuerza de voluntad para sacar adelante a su familia y por eso hoy se siente feliz y continúa trabajando para fortalecer mas, sus ingreso y continuar mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gunmercindo B. Gomez is a native of Sabanalarga, a place where they say "intelligence is endemic."  He has a fruit stand where he also offers calling services and sells lottery tickets.  It is located in a public place very close to a bus terminal, and the business is going very well because there are constantly people who are traveling and inter-departmental (long-distance) buses that are arriving.  Their passengers buy the delicious fruit to start their trip with and make calls through an operator, and they also buy lottery tickets, dreaming that some day they will become millionaires or have a few more pesos that they can enjoy.

His life has changed a lot, and he says that it changed 360 degrees since he became involved with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and got his first loan, which he was not able to do with any other institution.  This Kiva loan is his 5th loan; he wants to buy fruit at wholesale which he will turn around and distribute to other traders, and he also wants to make some improvements to his kitchen.

Gumercindo is a hardworking man and an exemplary father.  He began in the business that his father taught him; he was selling lottery tickets from the time he was 17 years old.  For some time this was his main activity and source of income.  Sometime later he worked selling newspapers.  He had assistants who did not bring back the money that he had to pay the company, which he had to deposit daily.  But this did not cause him to lose his enthusiasm to continue working and dedicate himself to his business.  Through the business he managed to educate his children and today some of them are working in companies in the city and others work in commercial activities with the advice of their father.  As he has been a good saver, he bought a lot with his earnings and built his house in the Carrizal neighborhood, thanks to his sacrifice and his will to get ahead with his family.  For this reason, he now feels content and will continue to work to further improve his income and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale to distribute to other traders and also to make improvements to his kitchen

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam is a resident of Sumandri, which is a small city located in Punjab. This city is a big dealing center of rugs in Pakistan. All types of rugs (simple and designer) are available there for selling.

She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her family.

Her husband, S. G. Z., runs a private medical clinic in the community. He has studied a compounder (mixing drugs to fit the unique needs of a patient) course. He has a good knowledge of different common diseases and provides good quality health services to his patients who can’t afford the medicical expenses of big hospitals for treatment.

Maryam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s medical clinic. With the loan, her husband will buy medicines, which will help him in better serving his patients.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds the book (an Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Maryam.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical clinic

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma M. is from the village of Lawis. She is 50 years old. Thelma is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $412 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Thelma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mr. Sea Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who live in Ta Mung village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Sea P., who was born in 1949, was selected by the other members to be the village bank president.  Each of the members will use their portion of the loan in a way that can improve their family's standard of living. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Srieng Sou, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a vice chief in their village and receives a low salary to help support his family. 

In the rice field, he has some problems because his field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mr. Sea P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. 

He is the father of three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe P. is from the village of Dapacan in Alto Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Mariafe is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Mariafe owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community. Mariafe has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mariafe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariafe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Mariafe is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mariafe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nonilona

texts.en:
Nonilona C. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Nonilona is widowed and has one grown child. To make a living, Nonilona makes and sells food, primarily snacks and delicacies like rice cakes. Nonilona has been engaged in her business for more than nine years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nonilona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nonilona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nonilona is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken by Nonilona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Samuel Maina

texts.en: Samuel, who is 38 years old, married to Mary Wangari and the father of two children, has been in the transportation business for the last three years.  He normally transports farm produce to and from the market for farmers. Introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, Samuel is requesting his first loan in order to repair his vehicle. In the future, he hopes to buy a new lorry which he feels will serve him better.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Maras.  She is 38 years old.  Carmelita is an individual member of PMPC.  Carmelita is married and has 3 children, two of whom are still studying in school.  To make a living, Carmelita operates a business which is a Sari-Sari store in the local community.  

Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.  In 2010, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Carmelita is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to pay the tuition fee for her children.  This is the 1st loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital of her Sari-Sari store and to pay for the tuition fee for 2 of her children.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is from the village of Miputak. She is 22 years old, married, and has one infant child. 

Norma operates a family member's business in the retail sector, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fresh vegetables to sell. 

Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish and salt for a dried fish business. This will be the third loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish and salt

loans.name: Ney Soraida

texts.es:
Ney tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Ney nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora artesanía. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Ney requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y también collares y aretes. 
 
Ney pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ney is 32 years old, has two children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

She says that she sells handmade trinkets. Ney has a small workshop in her home where she produces her crafts. She has been in this business for many years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Ney is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy materials, necklaces, and earrings.

Ney belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials, necklaces, and earrings

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Josefina, La socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia  es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compostura, ella tiene un taller de costurera en su casa y hace compostura de trajes, mandiles, manteles, enaguas, y todo tipo de trajes para fiestas. La socia desea el crédito para comprar telas, encajes, cintas, hilos, agujas y otros para implementar su taller.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Hacia el Triunfo (Toward Triumph) Community Bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Josefina. She is 44 years old. She is single and has two children. The member is a seamstress; she has a dressshop in her home and sews suits, aprons, blankets, skirts, and all sorts of party outfits. She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric, lace, buttons, thread, needles, and other items for her sewing.

The member is happy with this authorize loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, lace, buttons, thread, needles, etc. for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 43-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and four children. 

Hasan has owned a bakery since 2006, with 20 years of experience in this field. Hasan specializes in Lebanese saj bread (Markouk) specially done  over charcoA. on domed convex metA. griddle called a "saj."  

Hasan is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time in order to do necessary painting and renovation to his shop. He also wants to buy tables and chairs to let customers sit and eat there. Hasan will introduce new saj receipes with speciA. ingredients. He is planning to expand his business more and more to change his small bakery to a big saj restaurant. He hopes he can make this dream come true.

loans.use: to do necessary renovation to his bakery

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is married with five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Siena is 44 years old. 

Siena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Siena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in the market.

Siena has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Siena would like to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad, y es casada con 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. María se dedica a la venta de refrescos y hamburguesas, y champu, un alimento tradicional de maíz, azúcar y fruta. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años en un puesto del centro de su comunidad. Conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Con sus ingresos, María puede ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura, con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. María solicita un crédito para la compra de más insumos para utilizar en la preparación de su champu, comida y refrescos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old, and is married with one child. She lives in her own house in a rural part of the Lambayeque district in the north of Peru. Maria works selling soft drinks and hamburgers as well as champu, a traditional delicacy of corn, sugar, and fruit. She has been pursuing this activity for five years in a stall in the center of her community. She knows the zone perfectly and has many established clients in the area. With her income, Maria can help her husband, who works in agriculture, with sustaining the family economically. Maria is asking for the loan to purchase more supplies to prepare the champu, as well as for the purchase of food and soft drinks. This is why she has thought it convenient to ask for a loan for 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem P. (pictured here), 61, is a widow with five sons and one daughter. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and the other two attend school. Unfortunately, another one died. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away.  

Sem sells meat and vegetables. She buys them from Phnom Penh market and sells them in her local market. She hopes to expand her business and get extra income to better support her family. So, Sem is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional meat and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and meat for resale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man with six children, three of whom attend school and three of whom have graduated. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 16 years, Henry has been buying and selling fruits (e.g. mangoes and apples) from door to door, to his neighbors and to passers-by. His major challenges are the low season and the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and educating his children so they can have a better future.  With his KES 5,000 loan Henry wants to purchase 16 sacks of fruit. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sacks of fruit.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 25. Her husband works as a farmer.

She is a fruit and vegetable dealer working in Banga, Agusan Del Sur. She has been in this kind of business for 15 years. Letecia also raises pigs to help augment their income. She earns 15,000 PHP per month from her businesses.

This loan will be used to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and more fruits and vegetables to resell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and help her family and others.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderia para su tienda de ropa.
Maximiliana es socia de FINCA Peru desde el 2000, inicialmente usaba sus préstamos para su negocio de venta de carne, pero ahora se encuentra mejor con el negocio de ropa. 
En las reuniones de su Banco Comunal FINCA Perú ha hecho muchas amistades y  en las sesiones de capacitación ha aprendido a ser responsable, puntual y cómo ahorrar. 
Su objetivo es que su negocio siga creciendo para que pueda ofrecer sólo la mejor calidad de vida de sus hijos que tienen 15 y 13 años de edad.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  She has been selling clothes for four years.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying merchandise for her clothes store.

Maximiliana has been a member of FINCA Peru since 2000.  She initially used her loans for her meat sales business but now she is doing better with her clothes business.

Maximiliana has made many friends during her community bank meetings with FINCA Peru and she has learned to be responsible and punctual, and also how to save, during the training sessions.

Maximiliana's goal is for her business to continue growing so that she can offer the very best quality of life to her children who are 15 and 13.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes

loans.name: Esmeralda De San Pedro Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ESMERALDA D. SAN PEDRO" ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 INTEGRANTES. LA SEÑORA ANGELICA ES UNA D. LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, TIENE 41 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, ES COMERCIANTE Y TIENE UN TOTAL D. 4 HIJOS (2 MUJERES Y 2 VARONES), ELLA SE DEDICA A LA REPARACION Y VENTA D. ELECTRODOMESTICOS Y LINEA BLANCA, EL CUAL INICIO HACE 21 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR REFACCIONES D. LINEA BLANCA. HASTA EL MOMENTO SUS CLIENTES SE SIENTEN CONTENTOS CON EL SERVICIO QUE LA SEÑORA OFRECE, ADEMAS D. QUE EL NEGOCIO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN UN LUGAR CENTRICO. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ Y MOTIVADA A CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO. QUIERE ESTE PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIRLO EN REFACCIONES D. LINEA BLANCA PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO Y CUIDADO D. SU MERCANCIA. A FUTURO TIENE PLANEADO LLEGAR A TRABAJAR CON EQUIPOS INDUSTRIALES Y PODER CONSOLIDAR SU NEGOCIO PARA PODER DAR EMPLEO Y CAPACITAR A JOVENES QUE TENGAN GANAS D. SALIR ADELANTE. TAMBIEN DESEA AHORRAR DINERO PARA LA EDUCACION D. SUS HIJOS Y VERLOS COMO PROFESIONISTAS EN UN FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group called "Esmeralda D. San Pedro"  is located in the State of Mexico. The group is maD. up of 12 members 

Señora Angelica is one of the members of the group.  She is 41 years old, and has studied up to secondary level.  She is a business woman, and has a total of 4 children (2 male and 2 female).  She works repairing and selling household appliances and white goods, which she started doing 21 years ago.  She is requesting the loan to buy spare parts for white goods.  So far her clients are happy with the service that the Señora provides, plus the business is situated in a central location.

At the time of applying for this loan, she feels happy and motivated to continue investing.  She wants this loan to be able to invest it in spare parts for white goods, for the maintenance and care of her merchandise.  In the future, she has plans to get to work with industrial equipment and to be able to strengthen her business, so as to be able to proviD. employment and train young people who have a desire to get ahead. She also wants to save money for the education of her children, and sees them as future professionals.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for white goods (household appliances).

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong (pictured with her daughter) is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Heng, is a construction worker and farmer. He also raises chickens at home. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: one son and three daughters. Two are in school, one is a garment worker and another one stays with his aunt. 

Kong is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  66 años de edad, hace quince años su querido esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene seis hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero cuatro de ellos  aun viven con ella, el menor de sus hijos estudia en Universidad y una de sus hijas es madre soltera.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que supo sacar a sus hijos adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo, tiene un negocio en el cual  se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida, en su negocio vende corviches, bollos, hayacas entre otros platos. La mayoría de los productos que ella prepara son para entregar ya que sus clientes le piden que les prepare cierta cantidad de sus productos con anticipación, solo un dia a la semana prepara para la venta en general, nos cuenta que lleva 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. 
Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante
texts.en:
The members of the “Rocafuerte” communal bank meet every two weeks in Rocafuerte Canton.  This place is renown for the delicious sweets its residents prepare that are famous throughout the country.

Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  She’s 66 years old and her beloved husband died fifteen years ago.  She has six children who are all adults now but four of them still live with her.  The youngest of her children is going to university and one of her daughters is a single mother.

She is a very tenacious woman who succeeded in moving her children forward thanks to her effort and work.  She has a business making fast food and snacks to sell.  She sells “corviches” (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), “bollos “(banana leaf wrapped Ecuadorean tamales) and “hayacas” (another type of tamale), among other dishes.  Most of the dishes she prepares are for delivery since her customers pre-order determined amounts of products.  She only prepares items for sales in general one day a week.  She tells us that she’s been in this line of work for 14 years.

She will use the loan to buy oil, bananas, peanuts and other ingredients needed to prepare the food.  Her dream is to own a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, peanuts, bananas and other ingredients.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 35 years old. He is a widower who has two children. One of the children is in school. To make a living, he operates a grocery shop to meet the needs of his family. He previously used to operate a retail shop. He wants in the next five years to improve the quantity and the portfolio that his shop handles so that he is able to realize his dream of being a prosperous businessman. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a solar lamp. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to access finances to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Joyitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JOYITAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de enaguas a máquina, chofer, tejido de mantas, tienda, panadería, limpieza

La señora Juana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora de zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tejido de enaguas en máquina que viene trabajando recientemente, aprendiendo este oficio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra lana, hilos y botones) que adquirirá por mayor y los trabajará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que todos los pagos son rápidos.
texts.en:
The “Joyitas” communal bank will begin its second loan cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional hub. It is made up of 9 members and is managed by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana.  The businesses carried out by members of the communal bank are varied and include: machine knitted skirts, a chauffeur, woven blankets, a general store, a bakery and a cleaning service.
