Sra. Juan states that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and that she joined the organization by invitation from a supporter in the area. Currently she has a business that she started running recently selling machine knitted skirts, a craft she learned from her mother. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to buy wool, thread and buttons wholesale) and she will work at home. This kind of work will enable her to generate income to support her family since she is a single mother and has two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the fact that all of the disbursements are prompt.

loans.use: to buy multi-colored wool, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport facilities to the passengers and generates income for the family. With the loan, he will repair the rickshaw’s engine because now it is creating problems and doesn’t allow him to drive it for long hours. 

Kalsoom is the mother of three children. Two of the children are enrolled in a local school getting their education. She is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Kalsoom is very hopeful that a fully repaired rickshaw will enable her husband to drive it for longer hours and facilitate many more passengers in a day.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida lives with her husband who is a security officer and their three children. For the past 11 years, she has worked cooking and selling koko (porridge) in Jukwa, which is a village in Ghana’s central region. The profits from her business are used to support her family. The loan will enable her buy millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale. She is therefore very grateful for the support of the lenders.

loans.use: buy millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man. He has 9 years of experience working as a women's hairdresser and started running his own business since that time. With his requested loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, Ali will be able to do necessary decorations to his shop, such as changing his shop's tiles, and to buy a tattoo machine in order to reply to customers' requests. Ali will redecorate his salon in order to offer his clients a comfortable and beautiful place.

This is Ali's second cycle with A. Majmoua. His previous loan was very effective. It helped a lot in improving his income. Ali was a good standing borrower.

Ali hopes to stay on top of clients' expectations, and to expand his business more and more through adding more services in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary decorations to his shop, and also to buy a tattoo machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the operation of local city tours

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José, por necesidad en su negocio, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, para la compra de cubre camas, colchas, almohadas, para continuar vendiendo, él préstamo anterior le ayudo grandemente para crecer en el negocio, esto lo motivo a continuar fortaleciendo y crecer cada día más en su mercadería.
Estos préstamos son el apoyo para que microempresarios continúen en su labor, tratando de hacer su vida y contribuir con su familia.
texts.en: José is once again requesting a loan because his business needs it.  He will buy comforters, bedspreads and pillows to continue selling.  The previous loan helped him quite a bit to grow in business and this motivated him to continue strengthening it and to grow daily with his merchandise.  These loans are the support that makes it possible for micro businessmen to stay in business trying to make a life for themselves and contribute to their families.

loans.use: to buy comforters, bedspreads and pillows.

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
This is Vangeline, 36, resident of Talon Amadeo Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a tricycle driver and father to her children. By the grace of God, they are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vangeline oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community, all of whom pay a daily fee. Vangeline’s husband drives their tricycle. Their regular customers are their neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Vangeline is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vangeline hopes to expand her business and dreams that through all their hard work in their business their children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of a tricycle.

loans.name: Go Ahead Group

texts.en:
Francis is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Francis was born in Magburaka town, about 45 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple have two children who are attending primary school. Francis sells medicines and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Francis and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Francis will use his share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy basic medicines to add to his current stock of medicines.

loans.use: to buy basic medicines to add to his current stock of medicines.

loans.name: Junafe

texts.en:
Twentysix-year-old Junafe earns a living through farming. She is married and has 4 children. The oldest child is only 6 years old.

Junafe ventured into farming 2 years ago. She grows rice crops to sell. Junafe and her husband work together to provide for their children and send them to school.

Junafe has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Junafe hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maota

texts.en:
Maota is 67 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Maota needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Maota joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Maota's 4th loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru:
Айнуре 38 лет, замужем, имеет четверых  детей, младшей их которых два года. Айнура по профессии – учительница и преподавала кыргызский язык и литературу в местной школе. В настоящее время Айнура находится в декретном отпуске.
В поисках источника дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, в 2005 году Айнура начала свой бизнес в разведении, откорме и перепродаже скота, начав с начальной суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день,  в ее хозяйстве насчитывается  четыре голов коров, десять  баранов и две лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в ремонт кошары для обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 38 years old, married, and has four children, the youngest of whom is two years old. Ainura is a teacher by profession and she teaches the Kirghiz language and literature at a local school. Currently Ainura is on maternity leave. Searching for a source of additional income to support her family, in 2005 Ainura stared a business breeding, fattening, and reselling cattle. She started with 20,000 som in capital. Now, her farm has four cows, ten sheep and two horses. In order to further develop her business, Ainura contacted Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som to buy additional livestock. With income from the loan, Ainura plans to invest in repairing her barn to improve living conditions for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Corazon has a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Tobico

texts.en:
Tobico is 59 years old, married to Nina and they have six children.  He has been in the business of buying and selling goats and sheep for the last ten years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd for KES 50,000, which he will use to buy more goats and sheep. With the anticipated profits he plans to save for the future expansion of his business. 

He hopes to expand his goat and sheep selling business to include the distribution of goat and sheep meat.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell on.

loans.name: Josphat Mavu

texts.en:
Josphat Mavu is a 31-year-old tailor in Voi. He is married and has been sewing clothes for his customers for the last six years with great success.  

This is Josphat’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build business premises.
 
He hopes to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.

loans.name: Amie's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juin 2009. Il regroupe des femmes issues de différents quartiers de la commune de Sédhiou sous le labelle Sœurs Jumelles de par leur entente et la solidarité de groupe de plus elles ont des liens de parenté. Les activités principales que mènent ces femmes concernent : le petit commerce, la transformation et l’artisanat.
    
Madame Amie (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle marié, âgée de 53 ans et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles âgés de 09 à 25 ans. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elle gère une cantine où elle vend des céréales et des légumes au marché central de la commune, pour les céréales elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la zone. Quant aux légumes elle achète à la capitale. Pendant les vacances elle est assistée par ses filles.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 300 kg de diverses céréales, 02 sacs d’oignon et 05 de pomme de terre.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent de payer les frais scolaires des enfants et d’assister son mari pour la nourriture et les soins de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
This village bank was created in June 2009. It is made up of women who come from different districts of Sedhiou under the name Twin Sisters. They are united by their complicity and the solidarity of the group, in addition to their family ties. Their main activities are small trade, transformation and handicraft.

Mrs. Amie (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 53 years old and married with five children, two boys and three girls aged between nine and 25 years. She has a lot of experience in the village bank system. She runs a canteen where she sells cereals and vegetables in the central market of the commune. She buys her supplies of cereals at the local markets. As for the vegetables she buys them in the capital. During the holidays, her daughters help her.

With her new loan, she plans to buy 300 kg of various cereals, two sacks of onions and five of potatoes.

The profits from her business enable her to pay school fees for her children and to help her husband to pay for food and health care for the family.

loans.use: to buy 300 kg of various cereals, two sacks of onions and five of potatoes.

loans.name: Akossiwa Mawule

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Akossiwa est une marchande de pains accompagné de la mayonnaise. Akossiwa s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant pour gagner son revenu. Pour commander des dizaines de pains et des unités de boîtes de mayonnaises, Akossiwa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien revendre et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Acheter 10 dizaines de pains

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza lives in Escobedo in the province of Neuvo Leon with her three beautiful children aged 3, 11 and 20 years. She started her business when she saw that her husband\'s salary was not enough tto cover the household costs. She makes and sells traditional foods such as tacos and chicken dishes. She has been running the business now for more than 14 years and she wants to expand in order to cover the cost of education for her children who hope to attend university.

She requires a loan of $325 to buy ingredients, such as condiments, for her cooking. She needs your help and your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza vive en Escobedo Nuevo León tiene tres hermosos hijos de 3, 11 y 20 años de edad, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de que el salario de su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de comidas caseras como flautas, guisos con pollos y tacos; tiene más de 14 años con este negocio y Esperanza quiere hacerlo crecer para seguir apoyando a su esposo y cubrir los estudios de sus hijos ya que se encuentran cercanos a estudiar la universidad.

Ella requiere de $325 USD para comprar insumos como materiales de cocina, así como condimentos y la comida para preparar los platillos; ella necesita tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gulsafa

texts.en:
Gulsafa has been engaged in this business at home for 5 years. She has a lot of clients. She sews sheets, slipcovers and curtains.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought a sewing-machine and cloth. The second time she borrowed $800 to buy a lot of cloth.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to build a sewing-shop in her own yard.
Gulsafa is 28 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. She is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To build a sewing-shop

loans.name: Kilita

texts.en: Kilita runs a lawn mowing business.  It is very hard work, but she says that it is worth it because of the money she is able to earn.  She says that demand for her services is so high that her major constraint right now is that she only has herself plus one part-time laborer to do the work.  She says that she needs to do two things to grow her business even further:  1) hire another employee; and 2) repair and upgrade her equipment.  Kilita is confident that with another SPBD loan to provide the working capital, she can expand and upgrade enough to meet her community’s high demand.

loans.use: Repair and upgrade mowing equipment

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura is a single mother of two daughters. She's never relied on anyone but herself in moving her family forward, which she has worked hard to do. Her daughters were her motivation in starting her own business 10 years ago. She started selling floral arrangements but later incorporated selling new clothes and experienced better results. Now, she only sells clothing and has been able to grow her business, increasing her customers and offering her products at the market.

Currently, Rosaura is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase more clothes to cover her clients' growing demand and to provide them with a better service. She plans to repay the loan within four months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business. Your help will lend a great hand to Rosaura and her daughters. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosaura es soltera y tiene dos hijas, nunca ha tenido el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio hace 10 años, empezó vendiendo arreglos florales pero después incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y obtuvo mejores resultados, ahora sólo se dedica a esta actividad y ha hecho crecer su negocio incrementado sus clientes y ofreciendo sus productos en un mercado.

En estos momentos Rosaura necesita de un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Mrs. Nub N., 37, lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling bread in front of a secondary school, where a number of students pass by. She usually can make around $2/day in profit, while her husband can earn around $1/day from selling ice-cream in front of the school. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for transportation for their business needs, so that it is much easier and faster for them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for their business transportation needs

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old, married and has one son. He owns a chemist’s (pharmacy) in front of central policlinic of Beylagan. He established his business four years ago. Rauf needs a $500 loan to expand his business.

loans.use: Rauf would like to expand his chemist's business (pharmacy).

loans.name: Gaga

texts.en: Gaga P. is one of the young mothers of the loan program from the village of Faleula. She is twenty-two years of age, and she has one loving son. Her husband does not work but he is a good fisherman who is talented on the sea. He goes fishing six days a week, depending on the weather. When her husband comes back successfully then Gaga is responsible for selling the fish. Depending on the quantity, she either goes to the market or sells at the roadside. She sells one string that contains about 25 fish for $20 WST ($8 USD), and usually she can sell about five to six strings of fish a day. She is one of the new members and she is young and very active.

loans.use: To buy strings, hooks, and some new sets of fishing nets for the fishing business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
A. Mavjuda is 33 years old. She is the loving mother of three children. Mavjuda has been divorced since 1999 and for all this time she has been supporting her family alone. Her parents are trying to help her, however, Mavjuda never asked her parents to assist her financially.  

For  the past 4 years Mavjuda has been selling clothing for women and kids in one of the local markets. Two times in a month she travels to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to purchase new goods. For the time of her trip her parents are looking after the kids. Mavjuda tries to have so wide range of goods in order to meet the requirements of clients with various tastes and incomes . 

Today Mavjuda requires 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars). This is her first loan; however, she is sure that she shall pay the loan in 12 months. Mavjuda is planning to purchase the new clothing for women to expand her business; so that she can have the money for her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women to sell so she can have the money for her children's education

loans.name: Namwezi East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Unithy N.. She is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to expand fish business. Unithy is 32 years old and is married. Her husband has a butcher's shop. She has five children ranging from age 3 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Unithy makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Unithy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy chicken feed and drink and the loan was paid back on time.

Unithy is joined in her small group by Rehema N., Aisha Z., Nora N., and Joyce N.. Rehema N. has a business in poultry and wants to add to the business. Aisha Z. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to expand business. Nora N. operates a business of new clothing sales and wants to increase stock. Joyce N. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To expand fish business and make more profits

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is thirty years old and she lives with her four children (three girls and one boy) in the Mulo community of Yamasá. To supply the family’s needs, Antonia sells clothing to men, women and children of the community. Shortly after starting her business, Antonia got a loan with which she made the purchase of a wide variety of clothing she needed to have a well-supplied stock.  The entrepreneur wisely used her loan, and she managed to move her business forward and she repaid successfully the loan. Antonia hopes that she’d like to see her children become professionals, and she says she'd move heaven and earth to help them achieve this goal. In the meantime, she’s supporting their primary school studies. Antonia is requesting a loan to buy a new collection of shirts and pants to add to boost her business. The entrepreneur is working hard to improve her life and her children’s.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of new fashionable pants for a small clothing store.

loans.name: Zakati

texts.en: Zakati is a married woman with four children.  Zakati also owns a small domestics shop, which she started in 1996. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more household items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more household items for her business.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 64 years old and the mother of 4 children. She has 1 grandchild who she is taking care of. Akosua has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, peas, onions, tilapia, etc in the family house and the community market for 10 years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more palm and vegetable oils, vegetables, and tilapia to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Quality. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables like tomatoes, garden eggs, gallons of vegetable oil, etc

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Click this link to view Marleni's first loan

Marleni belongs to the Village Bank Bonanza. She is single and 29 years old. She sells cosmetics from a catologue to her friends and family. Additionally, she sells various types of clothing in the different fairs of the region, as well as working in a bakery at night. Her business is growing little by little because she now has more capital to help her business.

Marleni needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US700), money she will invest in the purchase of children's clothes such as polos, pants and coats.

Marleni's dreams are to get a professional title, have an established store and a beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for children such as polos, pants and coats.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is a producer of cow milk at the same company that sells PIL, and her husband works in the sewing industry. These two activities are their main sources of income to cover the expenses of their small 8-month-old son. She lives in the community of Akjerana - Achacachi (three and a half hours from La Paz).

The credit will be allocated for the purchase of a medium cow to increase milk production. It is her first credit with Impro, and it qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Veronica, es productora de leche de vaca la misma que comercializa en la empresa PIL, el esposo trabaja de empleado como costurero; estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con los cubren la manutención de su pequeño hijo de 8 meses. Vive en la Comunidad de Akjerana - Achacachi (A tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamos solicitado por Veronica.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe I. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Since 2005, he has made a living selling drinks, and has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more beverages to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: FATIM EST UNE NATIVE DE BAMBEY LE 12/04/1951.ELLE EST mariée et mère de trois enfants .elle a une expérience de seize ans dans la vente de jus de fruits sur le marché local.elle dispose d'un réfrigérateur dans lequel elle conserve  les jus qui sont prets  à consommer.elle sollicite ce pret dans l'optique de renforcer son stock de bissap et de pain de singe qui sont les matières premières qu'elle utilise pour faire les jus qu'elle revend.
texts.en:
Fatim F. was born in Bambey on April 12, 1951. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling fruit juice at the local market for 16 years. She stores her juices in a refrigerator so that they are ready to drink. She is requesting this loan in hopes of strengthening her supply of bissap and baobab fruit, which are the raw materials she uses to make the juices she sells.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural fruit juice sales

loans.name: Vaioleti

texts.en: Vaioleti A., 38, is married with four children.  She has many years of experience in the retail business. She sells to other villagers three days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 850 Tala (~354 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaioleti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Vaioleti's small shop is open 7 days a week from 6am to 10pm. She's a very hard-working lady aiming to be successful. She will use the loan to purchase milk, mosquito coils, diapers, soaps, onions, salt sugar flour, rice, tin meats, lamp flaps, chicken, sausages, and ham.

loans.use: Purchase items for her shop.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. is a villager in Sream Chieng Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns one hectar on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, she now faces a problem because she cannot cultivate the rice because she does not have any cows to help her plow her field.

Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. She will also use part of the loan to buy fertilizers to help support the field and make her crops more productive.

Her husband Mr. Suon Sam Oeurn is a palm juice collector. He gathers the palm juice to produce palm sugar.

Mrs. Phalla S. is 28 years old and the mother of two children. The children attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to help plow the field and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 32 años, es conviviente, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Ella realiza diversas actividades, tiene dos hectáreas sembradas de plátanos, y cítricos, cuando termina de cultivar o cosechar se dedica a trabajar como peón en la fabricación de cajones de fruta, pero esta temporada se propuso preparar y vender comida en el mercado, los días de feria, ya que es tanta la demanda que le llega a faltar comida esos dias, le es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias. Su dificultad es que no tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado y los vigilantes de la municipalidad la desalojan de cada lugar donde la encuentren. Con el dinero solicitado comprará utensilios adecuados para la venta de comida, y víveres para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son. She partakes in several business activities. She has two hectares of plantains and citrus, but when she finishes growing and picking her crops, she makes fruit crates. This season, however, she set out to sell food at the market on market days. Demand is so high that she runs out of food on some days. This business is very lucrative and yields good profits. Her problem is that she does not have a fixed booth at the market, so the municipality guards evict her from wherever they find her. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase cooking utensils for food sales and the supplies needed for food preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils and provisions

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es: La Sr. Juana tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua, estado madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos ya son independientes, los planes para su familia es mejorar su vivienda. Doña Juana se desempeña como costurera, vende comida y venta de cosmético desde hace cinco años, sus objetivos para su pequeño negocio incrementar sus ventas de comidas con nuevos y variados platillos, también espera tener más encargos de  cosméticos, en el ámbito de costura perfeccionar trajes y venderlos al  público en general. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr comprar materias primas como: telas, maquina de coser, cosméticos y otros productos para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, como captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 59 and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is single and has 4 children, who are independent. Her plans for her family are to improve her home. Doña Juana is a seamstress and has also sold food and cosmetics for 5 years. Her goals for her small business are to increase her sales of food with new and varied dishes. She also hopes to have more cosmetic orders. In the field of sewing, she would like to make suits and sell them to the general public. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy materials like: fabric, a sewing machine, cosmetics, and other products to offer better service to her customers and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to make her sewing orders

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang P., 39, started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller. She sells items like cooked ingredients, sweets, and canned goods. She has been running her business out of her home, and currently earns an income of approximately $4 a day. She now lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia, where she cares for two children; both of them are teenagers and attend school. She is married to Touch Thy, 36, who is a civil servant. P. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to  purchase a plot of farmland, and the remaining loan will be use to buy a range of groceries for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Haidee

texts.es: Haidee es una mujer luchadora y muy admirada por sus vecinos, a sus 44 años es madre soltera y ha sabido darle una buena profesión a sus hija Maria de 22 años, junto a la cual tratan de mejorar la vida que llevan. Con un ojo muy acertado, Haidee se dedica a la venta por campaña, ella vende según la temporada y tiene un gran olfato para saber que es lo que más compra la gente, ahora se encuentra distribuyendo por los puestos de mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ropa de verano traída desde el país de Bolivia, ya que quiere aprovechar el intenso calor que hace en la ciudad. Para Haidee los más difícil de su trabajo, es saber cual seria un buen producto para vender, aun así disfruta mucho de llevar novedades a los puestos que compran sus productos, tiene ya 13 años en esta actividad y anhela poner una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los productos que trae desde distintos lugares del país y del extranjero. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Haidee con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos, y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa y siempre tiene algo de qué aconsejar al resto de las socias. Con los 800 soles que solicita comprará artículos para la temporada de carnavales, máscaras de jebe para que la gente se disfrace y pueda divertirse, además traerá ropa de Pepino (Payaso tradicional de las danzas de la región altiplánica), según dice eso será lo que más se venda en estos carnavales.
texts.en:
Haidee is a hard-working woman, very much admired by her neighbors. At 44 years of age, she is a single mother who has known how to give her daughter Maria, 22 years old, a good profession. Together, they work to improve their standard of living. With a good eye, Haidee dedicates herself to selling seasonal products and she has a great feel for knowing what will be in greatest demand by people. Currently, she is distributing products throughout the stalls at the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her offerings include summer clothing brought all the way from the country of Bolivia, as she wants to take advantage of the intense heat that the city experiences. The most difficult part of Hailee’s work is knowing what products would be good to sell, yet she still enjoys taking her novelties to the stands that buy her products. She has been doing this activity for 13 years. She yearns to have her own store to sell the products she brings from other parts of the country, as well as from overseas, herself. This is Haidee’s fourth loan with MFP, and she has repaid her previous loans in a timely manner. She hopes to pay this latest loan on time as well. She is very active in her cooperative bank, and she always has advice to share with other members. With the 800.00 Peruvian soles that she is requesting, she will buy articles for the carnival season, including costume masks so the people can dress up and enjoy themselves. In addition, she will bring clothing of Pepino (a traditional clown of dances of the Andean plains), which she says will be her most popular items during these carnivals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el kilómetro. 11 ½ carretera a Masaya entrada Esquípulas, todavía no es casado vive con su mamá y trabaja como Administrador de cybernik, los sueños de don José es llegar a tener su propio negocio y lograr mejorar la casa de su mamá ya que en un futuro piensa casarse y formar una familia .La mayor necesidad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, ya que lo que el gana aporta parte para la casa y sus propios gastos. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 8.000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción y poder mejorar parte de la vivienda y poder sentirse sastifecho con los logros
texts.en:
Señor José Leonel is 38 years old and lives in the 11 1/2 km of the highway to Masaya entering Esquípulas. As of yet he is not married. He lives with his mother and works as a Administrator of an Internet cafe. José dreams of one day owning his own business and to manage to improve his mother's house, since in the future he hopes to be married and to form a family. His greater need is for financing, since what he earns he contributes partly for the house and partly for his own expenses. He requests the amount of C$ 8.000 ($400 US) to buy building materials to be able to improve part of the dwelling and to be able to feel satisfied with the progress.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer mejoras a la casa

loans.name: Irma Ermitana

texts.es:
La señora Irma Ermitana F. S. tiene 63 años, vive en el caserío de Sicsa, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo transición, dejo de estudiar debido a que su madre se enfermo y tuvo que dedicarse a cuidarla. Tiene 05 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Irma se dedica a la venta de quesillo, cuando inicio hace 35 años vendía quesillo por kilos de casa en casa con el tiempo a logrado hacerse de clientes y tiene muchas ganancias, en tiempos de cosecha también se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa, así como a la venta de animales (vacas, huachos, chanchos), su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra de quesillo.
Con el crédito de 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro.
Irma sueña con tener su casa en Trujillo y conseguir que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Ermitana F. S. is 63 years old, lives in Sicsa, Salpo district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru. She did not finish elementary school because her mother became ill and she had to stay home to care for her. She has five children, none of whom are dependent on her. Irma sells cheese and when she started 35 years ago she sold it in bulk from door to door and as time has gone by she has acquired and kept regular customers and her net gains are good. During harvest season she also sells grain and potatoes as well as livestock (cows, calfs, pigs) and she runs her business from her own home. With her initial loan of 300 soles from the "Luchando por el Progreso" bank she purchased cheese and with her 1800 sol loan she will invest in a bull. Irma dreams with having a house in Trujillo and to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.
